Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires pour satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans. Elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés  tous les  prêts précédents( 4 solidaires et 4 individuels). 
Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 3 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali) et 2 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso.
   Elle vend les bois de chauffe à domicile et les poissons fumés au marché de leur localité.  
    Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan D., a married woman of 40 and the mother of 4 children, lives with her husband and children in Sanoubougou I, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Sitan D. has been in the business of buying and selling firewood and smoked fish for about 10 years. She enjoys an excellent reputation in this business and gets a lot of orders, especially during the rainy season.

Looking for complementary financial resources to satisfy the needs of her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. She is on her fifth individual loan after having reimbursed the preceding ones (4 solidarity loans and 4 individual loans) appropriately.

She intends to use this new loan to buy 3 cartons of smoked fish in Gao (7th administrative region of Mali) and 2 cart loads of firewood in the surrounding communities of the town of Sikasso. She sells the firewood out of her home and the smoked fish in the market in their neighborhood.

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 85,000 F CFA which will be used to help support the family and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Samuel Mugambi

texts.en:
Samuel W. has been selling DVDs and tapes for the last five years in Naivasha town. He is 30 years old, married to Ruth Wambaire, and they have two children. Samuel was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this is his first loan with the organization. He plans to buy more tapes and DVDs to sell from the proceeds of this loan. This will increase his stock and enable his customers to have a wide variety to choose from. In the future, he hopes to move into a more permanent place where he can sell his wares both retail and wholesale.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more DVDs and tapes to sell

loans.name: Zamoyoni

texts.en:
Zamoyoni started her own food business selling vegetable three years ago. She is a 22-year-old woman, married and the mother of one child. Her child is 1 year old. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 240,000 Tanzanian shillings. Zamoyoni is a member of the Ushirikiano borrower group in Kola, Morogoro.

This is Zamoyoni's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 in order to buy more vegetables for sale.  With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zamoyoni hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en:
Ajoke sells drinks and foodstuffs. She is happily married with four children and she is 45 years old. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. Ajoke has been able to increase her productivity and profitability and she is very happy and grateful to LAPO and Kiva for their financial support. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. 
She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
Folashade sells clothes and foodstuffs. She has been in her business for the past 12 years and lives in Lagos. She is 40 years old and married with four children. 
Folashade is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more clothes and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group. She is 37 years old and married, and she has two children, ages 15 and 20.

Agness started her own grocery business two years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Agness's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested a loan in the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda and beer for sale in her store.

With the additional profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Agness hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more soda and beer for sale in her store

loans.name: Ankadjidia 1 De (Ankadjidia De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe ANKADJIDIA 1 sont toutes mariées et  résident à zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, 3 enfants  et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
.Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et tous les trois précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 7  hectares  en arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes espèrent sur une production moyenne de 2 tonnes par hectare soit 14 tonnes. Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture..
Le bénéfice de  la vente (estimé à 55.000 FCFA par femme en fin de campagne)  sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, la prise en charge des frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariage des filles..
texts.en:
The 10 women of the ANKADJIDIA 1 group are all married and live in Zoha, a village in the Sous-Prefecture of Fakola, Prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They have an average age of 28 and 3 children each on average, and they live in polygamous families. They met due to bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

When Soro Yiriwaso began to give rural loans which correspond to their work as farmers, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their fourth rural loan, and the three preceding ones were correctly reimbursed.

They want to use this new loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides. They want to plant 7 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet. These women hope to have an average harvest of 2 tons per hectare, or 14 tons in all. A part of the harvest will be sold in the various weekly markets and the rest destined for consumption.

The profit on their sales (estimated at 55,000 F CFA per woman at the end of the growing season) will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan, cover school fees, for the health of their children, and for buying wedding trousseaus for their daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is 27 years old and single, and she cares for one dependent.

Subira started her own salon business four years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Subira's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy commodities for her business. With the additional profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Subira hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her salon business

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells jewelry and clothes. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She travels to Togo and Cotonou (in Benin) to purchase her goods. Toyin lives in Lagos. She is 34 years old and married with 2 children. Toyin is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more jewelry and clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Ankadjidia 2 De (Ankadjidia De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe ANKADJIDIA 2 sont toutes mariées et  résident à zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, 2 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant  des paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne, après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois précédents.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 5  hectares en  arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes estiment leur production en moyenne, à 2 tonnes par hectare soit 10 tonnes. Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture.
Le bénéfice, estimé par femme à 60.000 FCFA après  la vente, sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, la prise  en charge des frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et  acheter les trousseaux  de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The 10 women of the ANKADJIDIA 2 group are all married and live in Zoha, a village in the Sous-Prefecture of Fakola, Prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They have an average age of 25, 2 children each on average, and live in polygamous families. They met due to bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

When Soro Yiriwaso began to give rural loans which correspond to their work as farmers, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their fourth rural loan, and the three preceding ones were correctly reimbursed.

They want to use this new loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides. They want to plant 5 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet. These women hope to have an average harvest of 2 tons per hectare, or 10 tons in all. A part of the harvest will be sold in the various weekly markets and the rest destined for consumption.

The profit, estimated at 60,000 F CFA per woman after their sales, will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan, cover school fees, for the health expenses of their children, and for buying wedding trousseaus for their daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Omonike

texts.en: I. sells sarongs and ready-made clothes, and is also a fashion designer. She has been in the business for 10 years. I. lives in Lagos. She is grateful to LAPO-KIVA for their financial assistance in these hard times. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. I. hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs and ready-made clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and ready-made clothes to sell

loans.name: Moturayo

texts.en: Moturayo is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells groceries and drinks. She has been in this business for 25 years. Moturayo lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is hoping for a loan of N150,000 to purchase groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
At the age of 29, Alex is still single. He manages a beauty parlor in the public market in Aglipay, Quirino. He is thankful because he has been able to manage the business for 10 years. His business still needs improvement and still lacks materials that are essential for him to cater to the needs of his customers, so he wants to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva. He believes that this small amount is already a big help to his business.

Alex lives in the simple village of San Leonardo, Aglipay, Quirino with his parents, where he serves as the breadwinner. Most residents of Quirino are indigenous people and upland (hillside) farming was their common livelihood. Alex belives that Kiva will initiate a true sense of change in their place, especially to small entrepreneurs like him.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Funmilola

texts.en: Funmilola O. is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She sells medicine. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell.  She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo lives in Lagos. She grinds pepper, tomatoes, and beans in her house. Titilayo has been in her business for the past 10 years. She is 45 years old and married, and has 5 children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more food so that she can expand her business and maximize profit. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“Strive hard to achieve your dreams in life,” says Erlinda B.. She is a farmer in the of village in Barangay Inaban Dupax del Norte in Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Leonardo B. and they are blessed with five children. The couple has been farming since childhood. And because of life's difficulties, they were not able to send their children to college. Instead, they sent them to the high school level only, but some of their children are still studying in elementary level and one is patiently coping with his high school studies. 

Erlinda wants to borrow a loan from Kiva of PHP 10,000.00. If she is given the chance, Erlinda will invest the amount in their rice farming business and plans to buy a piglet that will be beneficial to her family when it grows and is sold to buyers. Erlinda is also planning to venture into the vegetable-selling business for additional income.  She hopes that Kiva lenders will assist her in uplifting their family from poverty.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo W. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells cooked food to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married to Reynaldo B.. The couple works very hard for their family and especially for their children. They want them to live a progressive, comfortable, and happy life by giving them the best education and hoping that they can have a successful life in the future. They live in the rural barangay of Inaban in Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. 

To earn an income, the couple is patiently cultivates their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Aside from helping her husband in their farming business, Juliet also buys and sells vegetables in the nearby villages for additional income.  Juliet hopes to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000.00 from Kiva lenders for their rice farming businessand eventually to improve her vegetable business. She hopes that their business will become productive and fruitful for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina  es socia del Bancomunal  Niño Divino, es conviviente, tiene 22 años, un hijo de 5 años que esta estudiando en el nido.
Karina termino  de estudiar en la escuela estatal y salio embarazada y se dedico a cuidar a su hijo, pero el año pasado su esposo se quedo sin trabajo, su suegra le dio la idea que venda golosinas, ella es ambulante, también se ha puesto a vender ropa ofrece a sus familiares, conocidos y amigos.
Desde que Karina esta en Finca ella siente un gran respaldo por los prestamos 
Karina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de golosinas, chocolates, galletas.
El sueño de Karina tener un puesto propio y dejar de ser ambulante.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Divine Child community bank. She is 22 years old, has a live-in partner, and has a 5 year old son who is home-schooled. Karina completed public school and then became pregnant,so she had to care for her son. Last year, her husband was still unemployed, so her mother-in-law suggested that she sell candy. She travels around selling her sweets and also has a stand to sell clothes to her relatives, friends, and acquaintances. Since Karina has been with Finca, she feels that she has great support. Karina now needs a loan of 800 soles ($275) to buy candies, chocolates, and cookies. Her dream is to have her own stand so that she can leave traveling sales behind.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies, chocolates, and cookies

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en: Dasola is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells building materials. She is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more building materials to sell.  She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is managing a beauty parlor. She is married to Warlito, who works as a therapist. The couple is blessed with five children: four already have their own families and only Joel, 27 years old, is still single and working as a teacher.

Francisca is thankful that, through her business, she was able to give her youngest child a quality education. Aside from having a happy family, Francisca also aims to become a successful businesswoman. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional capital to improve her beauty parlor business.

loans.use: Additional capital for a beauty parlor

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem lives in Lagos and she sells drinks and provisions from her home. Kareem has been in this business for the past six years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She is 34 years old and married with five children. Kareem is very optimistic about the prosperity of her family and her business growth. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. 
She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells provisions in her house. She has been in her business for the past 30 years and has been able to use her years of business experience to retain customers. 

Maria lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a widow with five children. Maria is 60 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Bianita

texts.en:
Having many children in their family is a difficult thing to consider, says Bianita. She is sending all of her seven children to school for them to finish even a two-year course in college. She is hoping they will have better jobs.  

Bianita is engaged in a general-store business. With this, she was able to support the education of their children and their daily needs.  She is using all the best strategies and efforts in life that she knows in order to overcome all the trials in life.

To be able to help with her financial crisis, Bianita is now seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10,000 as additional capital to make her business more progressive. The loan will be of great help to make her business grow and to enable her to gain more income.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca sells drinks, foodstuffs and frozen food and she has been in the business for the past ten years. She lives in Lagos. Rebecca is 35 years old and married with three children.

Rebecca is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en:
Yetunde is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells clothes, diapers, body cream and shoes.

Yetunde is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
“A person without a goal doesn’t know his destination.” This is the guiding principle of Mercedes C. who is currently residing in Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Pablo and they are gifted with a son named Paul Jeremy who is 21 years old and is already in his junior year in college.
 
Farming is the main source of income for the couple. Mercedes’ husband manages their farm while she is maintaining her hog-raising business. Aside from being a businesswoman, she is also appointed as Barangay (district) secretary at their place. She is glad that they entrusted the task to her for she also loves serving other people. 

Mercedes wants to further improve her hog-raising business so that, with their rice and vegetable farming business, they will have a progressive living standard. To do this, Mercedes is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva lenders for business maintenance, especially for her hog-raising business. She hopes that her son will soon finish his course in college in order to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital

location.town: Barangay Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Abigirl

texts.en:
Abigirl sells foodstuffs. She has been in her business for the past eight years. Abigirl lives in Lagos. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She is very happy with the financial support of LAPO-KIVA. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

Lagos July 2009

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose sells shoes, sarongs and ready-made clothes and has been in this business for the past five years. Bose is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Bose is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more shoes, wrappers and ready-made clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, wrappers and ready-made clothes to sell

loans.name: Gloria Roxana

texts.en:
Señora Gloria has a small shop where she sells basic grocery goods and beauty products. She is pictured here behind her shop counter. In the forefront of the picture is the glass showcase where she displays her beauty products.

Gloria is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the city of Pucallpa. Her husband works at a sawmill. Gloria's children serve as her inspiration to continue to work hard at her business ventures.

Gloria has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (“New Friends”). Gloria used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in her grocery shop. She plans to use this loan of 1,000 soles to buy products for her shop and also to have the cooler/display case, where she keeps her drinks, sent out to be repaired.

Gloria's vision is to keep progressing with her business until one day she is the owner of a much larger and better stocked grocery shop. Gloria is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos and is grateful for the financial assistance provided by the organization.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop and to repair her cooler/display case for drinks

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi is 53 years old and married with five children. She sells herbal medicines. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more herbal medicines to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more herbal medicines

loans.name: Ayobami

texts.en: Ayobami is 45 years old and married with three children. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Kola

texts.en:
Kola sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past eight years. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State.

Kola has been with LAPO for one year. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria P. is 52 years old, married with five school-age children, and lives in Purok Urong Yulo, Brgy. Sto. Rosario in the town of Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. Gloria earns her living by sewing and renting out gowns. She has been in this business for the last five years since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, and it earns her on average, PHP 3,500 per month. Gloria wants to borrow PHP 14,000 for her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she can buy cloth and other sewing materials to make new gowns which she rents out to the local community. The income Gloria earns from her business has been a big help in the day-to-day living of her young family, especially as it allows her to send all her children to school. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy cloth and other sewing materials and accessories

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
In the photo, Señora Eloisa appears in her sewing workshop, showing the few of her pieces that remain after having sold almost everything during the month of July.

Eloisa lives in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Pucallpa. She is 53 years old and works full time as a seamstress. Eloisa's husband works at a sawmill. The couple has five adult children.

Eloisa has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about nine years and is a member of the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (“The Little Mangoes”). Eloisa invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in the purchase of fabrics. She plans to use this loan of 1,300 soles to remodel her sewing workshop. The wooden boards in the background of the photo will be used in Eloisa's remodeling project.

Eloisa's goal is to have a more modern sewing workshop. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her with the ability to finance her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for remodeling her sewing workshop

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 42 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs and she has been in the business for the past ten years. She lives in Lagos.

Fatima is very happy with LAPO-Kiva for their financial support. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to enable her to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
In the photo, Señora Gloria appears in her kitchen, where she prepares a lunch menu daily for her customers. Gloria is 61 years old and is married with three adult children. She runs her home-based restaurant independently. Her husband is a carpentry teacher at a high school in Yarinacocha, the small suburb of Pucallpa where the family lives. In addition to running her restaurant, Gloria also keeps pigs, ducks and chickens at a family-owned farm nine kilometers from her home. This farm is named "Natalia".

Gloria has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about six years and is a member of the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (“The Little Mangoes”). Gloria used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in ceramic decorations for sale. With this loan of 2,100 soles, Gloria plans to purchase staple foods for her restaurant business as well as medicines and feed for the animals she keeps on her farm.

Gloria's goal is to produce more at her family farm, which she has had for about seven years. Gloria is grateful for the financial assistance and business education she receives from Manuela Ramos (loan officers from the organization give an educational session at every monthly meeting of each communal bank).

loans.use: To buy staple foods for her restaurant/catering business and feed and medicines for her farm animals

loans.name: La Buena Fe Group 11

texts.en:
Edita O. F. is 20 years old and has just recently opened her own business selling new women's and children's clothing. When Edita first began selling clothing eight months ago, she found it difficult to obtain capital to invest in her business. And so, two weeks ago, she opted to take out her first loan from Kiva and Esperanza International.

With this new access to capital and credit, Edita will finally be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise, including women's tops, blouses, and pants and children's clothing. With her new loan, Edita hopes to begin selling women's shoes and sandals as well.

Once her loan is fully funded, Edita will travel several hours by bus (called a guagua) to the larger city of Higuey on the eastern coast to buy her merchandise. She will then sell her wares to her neighbors in the Villa Guerrero neighborhood of El Seybo, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic.

Revenues from Edita's clothing business will help supplement what her husband earns working for a local construction company, and will also support the family's two children: a 4-year-old son and a 3-month-old daughter.

As of now, the family lives in relatively difficult circumstances: they have no electricity in the home, and the 3-month-old girl currently has an untreated skin infection over much of her body. Furthermore, the family, like the majority of their neighbors in Villa Guerrero, is of Haitian descent, which means it is generally more difficult for them to secure economic and political rights as compared to Dominican citizens.

With these challenges in mind, Edita recognizes the importance of her clothing business to her family's well-being. She has hopes to keep selling more clothing in the future so that her children may eventually attend school and have better lives.

Here, Edita is pictured with her fellow borrowers in La Buena Fe (The Good Faith) Bank of Hope, Group 11. She appears second from the left, along with her daughter. Thank you for supporting the members of La Buena Fe!

loans.use: To buy more new women's and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Ankadjidia 3 De (Ankadjidia De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe ANKADJIDIA 3 sont toutes mariées et  résident à zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
.Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne, tous les trois précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt actuel pour les frais de labour,  de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles envisagent exploiter  4 hectares en arachide, riz et mil pour une production estimée en moyenne à  2  tonnes par hectare soit 8 tonnes. 
Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture.
Le bénéfice de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, la santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux  de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The 8 women of the ANKADJIDIA 3 group are all married and live in Zoha, a village in the Sous-Prefecture of Fakola, Prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They have an average age of 25, 3 children each on average, and live in polygamous families. They met due to bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

When Soro Yiriwaso began to give rural loans which correspond to their work as farmers, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their fourth rural loan, and the three preceding ones were correctly reimbursed.

They want to use this new loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides. They want to plant 4 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet with an average production estimated at 2 tons per hectare, or 8 tons in all. A part of the harvest will be sold in the various weekly markets and the rest destined for consumption.

The profit from their sales will be used to reimburse the loan, cover school fees, for the health expenses of their children, and for buying wedding trousseaux for their daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Djantoyerela 1 De (Djantoyerela De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA 1, au nombre de dix, sont toutes mariées, avec en moyenne  de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à  zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne, tous les trois précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour, les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 20  hectares  en arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes espèrent sur une production moyenne de 2 tonnes par hectare soit 40 tonnes. Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture..
Le bénéfice de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, la santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The women of the DJANTOYERELA 1 group, 10 in all, are married, with an average age of 35, 4 children each on average, and they live in polygamous families in Zoha, a village in the Sous-Prefecture of Fakola, Prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They met due to bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

When Soro Yiriwaso began to give rural loans which correspond to their work as farmers, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their fourth rural loan, and all three preceding ones were correctly reimbursed.

They want to use this new loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides. They want to plant 20 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet. These women hope to have an average harvest of 2 tons per hectare, or 40 tons in all. A part of the harvest will be sold in the various weekly markets and the rest destined for consumption.

The profit after their sales will be used to reimburse the loan, cover school fees, for the health expenses of their children, and for buying wedding trousseaux for their daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 40 years old and married with two children. She grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans in her house and has been in the business for the past twenty years. With her years of business experience, she is able to attract and retain her customers.

Deborah hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase a grinding machine so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Djantoyerela 3 De (Djantoyerela De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA 3 sont toutes mariées et  résident à zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et tous les trois précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 6.5  hectares en arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes espèrent sur une production moyenne de 2 tonnes par hectare soit 13 tonnes.  Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture..
Le bénéfice de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, la prise en charge des frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux  de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The 10 women of the DJANTOYERELA 3 group are all married and live in Zoha, a village in the Sous-Prefecture of Fakola, Prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They have an average age of 32, 3 children each on average, and they live in polygamous families. They met due to bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

When Soro Yiriwaso began to give rural loans which correspond to their work as farmers, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their fourth rural loan, and all three preceding ones were correctly reimbursed.

They want to use this new loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides. They want to plant 6.5 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet. These women hope to have an average harvest of 2 tons per hectare, or 13 tons in all. A part of the harvest will be sold in the various weekly markets and the rest destined for consumption.

The profit after their sales will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan, cover school fees, for the health expenses of their children, and for buying wedding trousseaux for their daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and weeding

loans.name: Djantoyerela 4 De (Djantoyerela De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les  trois femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA 4 sont toutes mariées et  résident à zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  4 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et tous les trois précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 3  hectares en  arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes estiment leur production  en moyenne à 2 tonnes par hectare soit 6 tonnes. Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture.
Le bénéfice de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, la santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariage  des filles.
texts.en:
The three women of the Djantoyerela 4 Group are all married and live in Zoha, a village in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, in the prefecture of Kolondièba, in the third region (Sikasso) of Mali. Their average age is 35 and have, on average, four children. They live in polygamous families and met through family and neighbourhood ties.
When Soro Yiriwaso introduced farming loans, these women, who work as farmers, jumped at the opportunity. They are on their fourth farming loan and the previous three were all repaid without any difficulties.
They want to use this loan to cover the costs of labour, hoeing, and buying seeds, fertiliser and herbicide. They want to grow three hectares of peanuts, rice and millet.
These women hope to produce an average of three tonnes per hectare, therefore six tonnes in total. Part of the harvest will be sold in various weekly markets and the rest will be used as food.
The sale profits will be used to repay the loan, pay for the children’s schooling and healthcare, and pay for their daughters’ dowries.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, hoeing, seeds, fertiliser and herbicide.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo de 69 años y su nieta, quien ocasionalmente pasa un tiempo con ellos, ya que su hija es independiente. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de joyas por catálogo, actividad que ha venido realizando gracias a la motivación de su hija quien la introdujo en el mundo el negocio, ya que ella también se dedicaba a este rubro, pero pasado el tiempo encontró un trabajo más estable y dejó de lleno el negocio a su madre. Ahora Rosa se apropió netamente de su trabajo y le va muy bien, ya que cada vez logra mejores ventas por su cordialidad, amabilidad y poder de convencimiento, pues ofrece joyas de calidad y garantía, bañadas en oro de diferentes kilates. A Rosa le gusta mucho su trabajo puesto que le permite mantenerse ocupada y generar un ingreso extra al de su esposo. Ella espera muy pronto incrementar sus ganancias y con ellas dedicarse al alquiler de habitaciones, y ahora mismo ya está arreglando un mini departamento para ponerlo en alquiler. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más joyas para tenerlas de reserva y poder ofrecerlas a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 65 years old and lives with her 69-year-old husband. Their granddaughter also lives with them sometimes, since their daughter is independent. For the past two years, Rosa has been selling jewelry by catalog, thanks to her daughter, who introduced her to the business world and encouraged her. Her daughter used to sell catalog jewelry, but as time went by she found more stable work and passed her catalog jewelry business on to her mother. Rosa has fully taken over the business, now, and it is going very well. She is selling more and more merchandise thanks to her cordiality, friendliness, and persuasiveness. The jewelry she sells is of guaranteed high quality and comes bathed in different karats of gold. Rosa really enjoys her work, since it keeps her busy and helps generate some extra income to add to to her husband's earnings. She hopes to increase her income very soon so that she can use the profits to start another business renting out rooms; she's currently fixing up a mini-apartment to rent out. This is her sixth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has always made all of her payments very punctually. With the requested loan, she plans to buy more jewelry to have in stock to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo William de 37 años y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Son 10 años los que lleva fabricando ladrillos, su horno está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de Juliaca, cerca al aeropuerto “Inca Manco Cápac”. Se levanta muy temprano y junto a su esposo comienzan con el amasado y moldeado del barro, para luego dejarlo secar por 10 días y meterlo al horno. Antonia disfruta de vender sus ladrillos, ya que siente que su trabajo es recompensado, pero considera que lo más difícil es trabajar sin importar el clima, puesto que muchas veces el sol hace que el trabajo sea más pesado o la lluvia impide que los ladrillos se moldeen correctamente, aun así ella continua trabajando duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda de comestibles, ya que actualmente hay muy pocas por su barrio. Es el segundo préstamo al que accede Antonia en MFP y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades. En su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para ladrillos de techo, ya que es lo que más le solicitan.
texts.en:
Antonia is 36 years old; she is a very hard-working woman and a fighter. She lives in her own home with her husband WIlliam, who is 37 years old, and the couple's greatest goal is to get ahead in life. She has been making bricks for the past 10 years. Her oven is located outside the city of Juliaca, near the "Inca Manco Cápac" Airport. She and her husband wake up very early each morning to start mixing and molding the clay, which they then allow to dry for 10 days before firing the bricks. Antonia enjoys selling bricks, since she feels well compensated for her work. She says that the hardest part is working through all kinds of weather conditions, since sometimes the hot sun makes work more tiring, or the rain prevents the bricks from taking the correct shape. Still, she continues to work hard each day to improve her quality of life. In the near future, she hopes to open a small grocery store, since there are very few in her neighborhood. This is Antonia's second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she expects to pay in on time without any difficulties, just as she has done with her earlier loans. She is very well respected in her village bank, since she is the most active, committed group member. With the 2,000 soles she has requested, she will buy new molds for roof bricks, since this is what she receives the most requests for.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy brick molds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana tiene 48 años, es una mujer cuyos hijos, hace mucho tiempo, ya hacen su vida por si solos, ella vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. En las afueras de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra el horno de ladrillos de Damiana, quien se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para amasar y moldear los ladrillos, los cuales luego de 10 días meterá en su horno. Esta actividad le ha generado los ingresos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, es por eso que ella todavía continua realizándola. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus ladrillos y ver que su trabajo es bien recompensado, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar con el barro, ya que en las temporadas de frió el barro se torna muy helado, haciendo que se enferme y no pueda trabajar normalmente. Para un futuro cercano desea contratar unos ayudantes para mejorar su producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo préstamo de Damiana con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para hacer ladrillos, ya que los que actualmente usa, ya están deteriorados por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Damiana is 48 years old and is a woman whose children have been independent and living on their own for a long time now. She lives in her own home, and her greatest dream is to live peacefully in her old age. Damiana's brick oven is located in the outskirts of the city of Juliaca, and she wakes up very early each morning to mix and mold the bricks, which she fires in the oven 10 days later. This activity has provided her with enough income to help her three children get ahead in life, and this is why she continues to make bricks. Her favorite part of the job is selling bricks and seeing that her work is well compensated. She has had this business for the past 10 years, and says that the most difficult part is working with clay, since when the weather get colds the clay becomes very cold and sometimes makes her sick, preventing her from working normally. In the near future, she hopes to hire several workers to help her increase production and earn more. This is Damiana's second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she hopes to make all of her payments on time so as not to cause problems for the other members of her village bank, who really respect and care for her. With the requested loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy new molds to make bricks, since her current molds are in bad shape because she has been using them for so long.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy molds to make bricks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es una madre muy cariñosa, vive en la casa de unos de sus familiares junto a sus dos pequeños niños, Ebert de 5 y Mayeli de 3 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Todos los días a partir de las 6 de la mañana, junto a su carretilla de jugos, sale en busca de clientes, a los cuales poder venderles sus deliciosos preparados. Ella vende distintos tipos de bebidas durante el día, por la mañana brinda a sus clientes el popular jugo caliente de quinua (bebida caliente hecha a base de quinua, mandioca y manzana licuada), durante el resto de la mañana vende jugos de frutas, y ya llegada la noche sirve sus saludables emolientes, para calentar a la gente que concurre a su carretilla. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que los más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer en la calle todo el día, soportando las inclemencias del clima, anhela que su negocio progrese y que pronto pueda poner una tienda donde atienda con más tranquilidad a sus clientes. Este es el sexto préstamo de Elisa con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, ya que es la socia más joven y alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas ollas, vasos, baldes, etc, para preparar sus bebidas con mayor higiene, ya que las que usa actualmente ya están muy viejitas.
texts.en:
Elisa is a very loving mother who lives in the home of some relatives along with her children, Ebert (5) and Mayeli (3), who she wants to provide with a good education. Every day at 6am, she goes out with her juice cart to look for clients to sell her delicious juices to. She sells different types of drinks over the course of the day: in the morning she sells her clients the very popular hot quinoa juice (a hot drink made from quinoa, tapioca and applesauce), later in the morning she sells fruit juices, and in the evening she sells "emolientes" (hot herbal drinks with curative properties) to warm the bones of the people who stop by her drink cart. Her favorite part of her work is chatting with her customers. She has had her business for 5 years now, and says that the hardest part is having to be on the street all day, withstanding harsh weather. She hopes to grow her business to the point where she can open up a store to serve her clients in a calmer environment. This is Elisa's sixth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very confident that she will be able to make all of her payments on time. She doesn't want to cause any problems for the other members of her village bank, who care for her very much, since she is the youngest, most cheerful group member. With the requested loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy new pots, glasses, and buckets, so that she can prepare her drinks more hygienically (the equipment she's currently using is very old).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new pots, glasses, and buckets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer es un hombre de 21 años, vive en su propia casa hecha de abobe, junto a su esposa Micaela de 18 años y su querido hijo Ton de 6 meses, a quienes desea dar un buen futuro. Los días como ladrillero de Elmer son muy largos y duros, se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para realizar el amasado y moldeado de los ladrillos, los cuales posteriormente meterá en su horno para coserlos y así estén listos para la venta. Los pedidos que tiene por lo general son muy grandes, por lo que muchas veces pide ayuda de sus vecinos ladrilleros para cumplir con el pedido, con la promesa de ayudarlos cuando ellos necesiten de él. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer los ladrillos, ya que siente que juega con el barro y no tanto que trabaja, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es acomodar los ladrillos en el horno, ya que tiene que ponerlos de forma que todos cosan por igual. Para el futuro espera que su negocio progrese y pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el tercer préstamo de Elmer con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para vender ladrillos, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para hacer ladrillos y así incrementar la cantidad que produce diariamente.
texts.en:
Elmer is a 21 year old man who lives in his own adobe home along with his 18 year old wife Micaela and their beloved 6 month old son, Ton. He wants to provide his family with a good future. Elmer works long, hard days as a brickmaker: he wakes up at 6am each day to mix and mold the bricks, which he later puts in the oven to fire so that they will be all ready to sell. He usually receives very large orders, so he often asks for help from his neighbors (who are also brickmakers) in order to fill the orders. He always promises to help them when they need the help. His favorite part of the job is making the bricks, since he feels like he's just playing with clay, it doesn't feel like work to him. He has had his business for the past five years, and says that the hardest part is fitting all the bricks in the oven, since he has to arrange them so that they all cook through evenly. For the future, he hopes to expand his business and improve his income. This is Elmer's third loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and he doesn't want to miss any payments due to lack of money, so he is already making contacts to sell more bricks. He is the only man in his village bank, so he always tries to be responsible and respectful of his female group members. With the requested loan of 2,000 soles, he will buy new brick molds and thus increase the number of bricks he can produce in a single day.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy molds to make bricks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer de 34 años, sencilla y trabajadora, vive sola en la casa que le cedieron sus padres, puesto que nunca se casó y lo que más desea es vivir un futuro tranquilo. El negocio de la sastrería es una actividad que viene de familia, puesto que aprendió este arte de su padre, cuando todavía era muy joven, su negocio es muy concurrido y sus clientes hacen cola para que les realice la confección de una prenda. Aunque tiene muchos clientes ella trabaja sola, ya que sus ingresos económicos todavía no le permiten contratar a un ayudante, con el cual pueda acelerar la confección de los pedidos. Lo que más le gusta a Julia de su trabajo es realizar el acabado a sus prendas, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su sastrería. Julia anhela que su negocio crezca con el tiempo y que se convierta en uno de los talleres de confección más reconocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Julia is 34 years old and is a simple, hard-working woman. She lives by herself in a house that her parents gave her, since she never married. What she wants most is to live a quiet life. The tailoring business runs in her family, as she learned this art from her father when she was still very young. Her shop is very busy, and her customers line up for her to make them a garment. Although she has many customers, she works alone because her income still does not allow her to hire an assistant, who would help her make the orders faster. What Julia likes most about her job is finishing a garment. She has been doing this for 20 years, and the most difficult part is staying in the tailor shop all day. Julia is eager for her business to grow over time and to become one of the most recognized tailor shops in the city of Juliaca. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is prepared to pay it on time. She does not want to cause problems with her partners at the communal bank, where she actively participates. With the requested $675 (2,000 PEN), she will buy new materials to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina G. O. tiene 32 años de edad. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es un comedor. El negocio empezó hace 10 años, ya que inicio vendiendo comida en su habitación, y por los escasos recursos económicos enfrentaba esto impedía elaborar una amplia variedad de comidas, debido a estas circunstancias  tenía que prestar el dinero a una amiga y así incrementar sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, frutas, vegetales. Su deseo es proporcionarle  mejoras  a su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina G. O. is 32 years old, has 2 children, and runs a diner. The business started 10 years ago, when she started selling food in her room. However, scarce economic resources that she encountered impeded her from elaborating her variety of food options. Due to these circumstances, she had to give money to a friend and in that way increase her food products. The loan is for working capital for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, fruits and vegetables. Her wish to to provide improvement to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Captal

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 19 años, es una joven soltera muy alegre, vive en casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Aunque todavía es muy joven, está decidida a trabajar muy duro para ya no depender de sus padres, puesto que siente que es hora de sobresalir por sí misma. Ella realiza tejidos artesanales, los cuales luego lleva a vender a su puesto de venta que está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más aun si son artesanías, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los tejidos hasta su puesto de venta, puesto que le resulta muy cansado. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda muy grande de ropa tejida a mano, en la cual pueda vender con más tranquilidad y atender mejor a sus clientes. Ya son 2 los préstamos que Maritza ha solicitado en MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará mejores materiales para elaborar más tejidos artesanales y así incrementar la cantidad que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Maritza is 19 years old and is a very cheerful, single young woman who lives in her parents' home and hopes to help them with household expenses. Though she is still very young, she is determined to work very hard so that she doesn't have to depend on her parents, since she thinks the moment has come for her to excel on her own. She is a weaver, and sells her work from her stand on the Laguna Temporal esplanade (a place in the city of Juliaca where markets are held). Her favorite part of the work is weaving. She has had this business for the past two years, and says that the most difficult part is moving the weavings to her stand, since it is very tiring. In the future, she hopes to have a very large store to sell hand-woven clothing, so that she can sell in a calmer environment and better serve her customers. Maritza has already taken out two previous loans from Microfinanzas Prisma. She has been very punctual with her payments, and has never had any problems with her village bank, where she is in charge of being cheerful and putting all her fellow group members in a good mood. With the requested loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy better materials to do more weavings and increase the number of weavings she has in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy weaving materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Dios Nos Ayude Group

texts.es: El Grupos Solidario Dios Nos Ayude está conformado por Jacoba Ramona Solís Mejía  y Hilda de Jesús Mejía  B. . Las actividades económicas de ambas son diferentes. Pero ambas luchan por lo mejor y así seguir adelante con su negocio. Por lo que solicitan este financiamiento para invertir en sus negocios. Ellas son personas responsables y muy trabajadoras. El sueño de ellas es seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta los momentos.
texts.en:
The Dios Nos Ayude (God help us) Group is made up of Jacoba Ramona Solís Mejía and Hilda de Jesús Mejía B.. The two have different economic activities, but both fight for the best and thus move forward with their business. For that reason they request this financing to invest in their businesses. They are both responsible, very hard-working women. Their dream is to continue working as they have up to now.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Yadira

texts.es: Ana Yadira R. tiene 40 años de edad. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella comienza este negocio desde muy joven, ya que tenia 2 hijos varones que necesitaban de estudio y alimentación, actualmente ellos no dependen de ella. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta es que tiene problemas de la vista, y esto se debe a que en muchas ocasiones ella labora de noche porque tiene muchos encargos y no le gusta quedar mal con sus clientes.  Por lo que solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de  telas, hilos, tijeras y agujas. Su mayor sueño es establecer una tienda en donde exhiba solamente diseños nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Ana Yadira R. is 40 years old. She works as a seamstress and has been in this business for over 20 years. She started her business when she was very young because she had 2 sons who needed food and an education. At the moment, they do not depend on her. She faces many challenges due to problems with her vision caused by working many nights to fulfill her orders. She doesn't like to disappoint her customers. This is why she is requesting financing for working capital to buy fabrics, threads, scissors and needles. Her greatest dream is to create a store where she will exhibit only Nicaraguan designs.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Los Tres Barrios - Qoricancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “LOS TRES BARRIOS –QORICANCHA”,  son 13 miembros que residen en la comunidad de 
Qoricancha, situada en el distrito de Chincheros, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba, a 1 hora con 15 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, de bellos paisajes y dueños de 2 lagunas impresionantes.

Nuestros socios son gente muy trabajadora y muy ingeniosa, ellos se dedican principalmente a la ganadería,  ellos cuentan con bastos terrenos, su segunda actividad es la agricultura, y venden lo que sus tierras producen, según las fechas de siembra y  cosecha, los otros meses que ellos no están en sus tierras ellos se dedican al comercio, comprando y almacenando víveres para su futura venta, hacen el intercambio de productos con las otras comunidades que se dan cita cada 3 meses en este pueblo, muchos de nuestros socios, llevan a diferentes lugares del País su producción para su venta, otros llevan las crías de sus ganados y los derribados del mismo, siempre están haciendo algo provechoso y tratando de salir adelante pese a las inclemencias de clima y de otros factores. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para así seguir reinvirtiendo en sus diferentes actividades.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado, ya que en la comunidad de Qoricancha ellos, solo tienen este apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
The partners of the community bank “Los Tres Barrios – Qoricancha” consist of 13 members who live in the community of Qoricancha, which is located in the district of Chincheros in the Urubama province. With its beautiful landscapes and two impressive lagoons, Urubama is located an hour and 15 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Our partners own vast farmlands and are very hard working and resourceful. Their main business is cattle raising and their secondary business is agriculture. In the months when they are not working the fields, sowing and harvesting, they buy and store food for future sale. Every three months they exchange products with other communities that come to Qoricacha. Many of our partners sell their agricultural products throughout the country while some partners sell their calves and dairy products. They’re always doing something productive and trying to get ahead in spite of the harsh climate and other challenges. The partners are requesting the loan to continue to reinvest in their businesses.

Our partners are very appreciative and value this loan. In the community of Qoricancha, it is their only financial support.


Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Denis Francisco

texts.es: Denis Francisco T. Martínez tiene la edad de 36 años, es un hombre soltero. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulperia. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Cuando dio inicio a su negocio desde muy joven tenía la edad de 16 años, ya que tenía que mantener a su esposa e hijos. El siempre disfruta de su negocio  porque le gusta conversar con sus clientes, porque de esta manera obtiene experiencia. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos basicos. Su deseo es poseer los suficientes materiales para facilitar su trabajo y ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Denis Francisco T. Martínez is 36 years old and single. He is responsible for 1 son. For a living he has been working his local store for 9 years. When he started this business he was very young, 16 years old, and had to provide for his wife and children. He enjoys his business as he likes to make conversation with his customers as it provides him with experience. He requests the loan as work capital to purchase basic grains. It is his wish to have enough material to make his work easier and offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Sofia Mercedes

texts.es: Sofía Mercedes V. A. tiene la edad de 56 años. Tiene la actividad económica de alquiler de sillas. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente laboraba como docente, pero debido a su edad avanzad tuvieron que despedirla. Por lo que Sofía tenía que buscar un medio de vida  para su hijo porque ella realizaba las dos funciones de padre y madre a la misma vez para su hijo. Fue por esto que decide establecer este negocio de alquiler de sillas, inicio solamente con 50 sillas, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos fue incrementando sus productos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de sillas, mesas plásticas y además ella viaja hasta Managua porque el mucho más favorable. En sus deseos esta el seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Sofia Mercedes V. A. is 56 years old. For a living she has been renting out chairs for 7 years. Previously she worked as a teacher but becase of her advanced age she was laid off, but as she is responsible for her son being father and mother at the same time, she needed to find another way of providing for him economically. Therefore she decided to set up the chair rental business. She started with only 50 chairs but with the help of the loans the number increased. The money requested is for work capital to buy chairs and plastic tables. She also travels to Managua as it is more favorable. It is her wish to continue with her business as it is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia B. Velásquez tiene la edad de 44 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Ana es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi.  Ella tenía que buscar el medio para una mejor búsqueda de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Ana son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que Ana solicito ayuda en Fundación León 2000 con el fin de aplicarle reparaciones y proporcionarle mantenimiento a su vehículo. Y así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Julia B. Velásquez is 44 years old, married, and responsible for 3 children. For a living she offers taxi transportation. She had to search for a way of improving the family income. The purpose of Doña Ana is to get ahead with her business as it has taken a lot of effort for her to have what she owns now and she does not want to lose it.Therefore Ana requests support from Fundación León 2000 in order to fix and maintain her vehicle, and thus offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Arcelia Ysallana

texts.es: Arcelia Ysallana Hernández Gutiérrez tiene 36 años. Es una mujer casada con 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Arcelia es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Es una mujer muy luchadora y que le gusta su trabajo. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que inicio por cuenta propia y con el apoyo necesario de su familia ha logrado salir adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y ropa para niños. El sueño que tanto le gustaría realizar es establecer un cafetín y una pequeña tienda donde exhiba su ropa.
texts.en:
Arcelia Ysallana Hernández Gutiérrez is 36 years old. She is married with 2 children. For a living she has been selling general merchandise for more than 9 years. She is a fighter and enjoys her work as a street vendor. She started on her own and with the support of her family she has succeeded in getting ahead. The purpose of the loan is for work capital to buy t-shirts, pants, skirts and children's clothing. It is her dream to set up a café and a small store to exhibit her clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es: Aura María L. tiene 50 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con esfuerzos propios, ella recorre las calles todos los días y ofrece a variedad de productos. Ella es una buena cliente de Fundación León 2000 ya que siempre se ha dedicado a pagar sus deudas en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra pantalón, camisas, trajes para damas y faldas.
texts.en:
Aura María L. is 50 years old. For a living she has been selling general merchandise for more than 11 years. She started this business with her own efforts, she sells in the streets every day and offers a variety of products. She is a good client of Fundación León 2000 as she has always been very punctual with the repayments of her loans. The loan requested is for work capital to buy pants, shirts, ladies' suits and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Dina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Dina del Socorro Pavón C. ella tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad. La señora se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales vende en el mercado. Ella empezó hace 5 años con este negocio, por lo que compra las cosechas en pie y luego las comercializa en los mercados, aunque a veces viaja a los departamentos a vender también. Cabe señalarse, sin embargo debido a que la competencia que ella posee es por eso que trabaja duro. El crédito será invertido en la compra de una cosecha de cítricos. Su sueño siempre ha sido incrementar su capital de trabajo que le permita independizarse del negocio de su familia, que se han dedicado a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dina del Socorro Pavón C. is 42 years old, is married, and has 2 young children. She sells fruits and vegetables, which she sells in the market. Five years ago, she started her business, for which she buys the harvests on foot and then sells them in the markets. Sometimes she travels to other departments to sell her products as well. It is worth saying, however, that she works hard because of her competence. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a citrus harvest. Her dream has always been to increase her capital for her business, which will allow her to make her business independent of her family. Her family has pursued this activity for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Martha Oralia

texts.es:
La  señora Martha Oralia Ramírez tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de arreglos flóreles. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para darle lo mejor a su hijo que tiene bajo su responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera.
Últimamente le está haciendo falta material y armaduras para realizar los arreglos, pero no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y las armaduras que necesita para poder tener variedad de arreglos. Y así tendrá más ingreso al negocio y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Oralia Ramírez has spent more than six years making and selling flower arrangements. This business is her source of income, which allows her to give the best to her child, who is under her care because she is a single mother. As of late, she is lacking material and frames to make her arrangements, but she doesn’t have the money necessary to make the investment. Because of this, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the material and the frames that she needs so that she can have a variety of arrangements. In this way, she will have more income, from which she plans to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and frame for garlands

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alberto R. tiene  43 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es mayor y los demás son menores de edad. El señor R. se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte. Don Carlos R. dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, tiempo en el cual por ayuda de una hermana logró comprar su primer microbús con el cual empezó a ahorrar y comprar lo necesario para acondicionarlo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para su microbus, el cual le comprará llantas y batería para un mejor funcionamiento del mismo. Su meta principal es seguir creciendo en la empresa de transporte, mediante la compra de más unidades de servicio, que provea un futuro para su familia en general.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Alberto R. is 43 years old, is married, and has three children, of whom one is an adult and the others are young. Mr. R. offers transportation services. Carlos R. started his business 6 years ago, during which time he, with the help of his sister, was able to buy his first minibus. He started to save and then bought the necessary items to upgrade it. The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for his minibus. He will buy wheels and a battery to have his vehicle function better. His main goal is to continue growing his transportation business by purchasing more service units, which will provide a future for his family in general.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña María Chávez M. tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad. La señora se dedica al negocio de la compra-venta de mercadería en general. Vende ropa, cosméticos, lo cual distribuye de manera ambulante y también en su casa, Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. La señora dio inicio a este negocio hace  bastante tiempo, sin embargo el negocio lo había quitado. Después, hace 10 años volvió a empezarlo con la venta de productos varios y le ha ido invirtiendo más y más. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos varios, ya que actualmente tiene bastante pedidos pero son de ropa, ya que esta entregándoles mercancías a otras personas. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener un restaurante con sus instalaciones bien establecidas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is 56 years old, is married and has four grown-up children. She buys and sells general merchandise. She sells clothes and cosmetics as a roving sales person and also from her home.
