She has been selling in this manner for ten years. She had previous experience selling merchandise but quit. Afterwards, since ten years ago, she began selling various products and she has been investing more and more in this business. The loan will be used to buy various products. She actually has many requests for her products. The requests are for clothes. Her dream has always been to have a restaurant in a stable location.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Violeta Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Violeta del Socorro González F. tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos menores de edad. La señora tiene 9 años de dedicarse de tener su negocio de mercadería en general, ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual además de vende granos básicos y golosinas, también vende ropa y zapatos. Ella empezó  hace 9 años con la venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, y con el tiempo fue que ella adquirió el capital necesario para establecer su negocio, a la que le ha estado invirtiendo todos los créditos solicitados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, ya que desde su establecimiento puede vender tanto los granos básicos como el vestuario. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una distribuidora en la cual emplee a otras personas y sea un ingreso fuerte para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Violeta del Socorro G. F. is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are still minors. For nine years she has worked at her store which sells common merchandise. The store is located in the home she lives in. Here she also sells basic grains, candies, clothing, and shoes. Ms. F. started selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes nine years ago. Over time she acquired the capital necessary to establish her business, in which she has invested all of her loans.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains. Since starting she has been able to sell as many basic grains as clothes. Her dream has always been to have a distributorship which would employ other people and be a good income source to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
A L. vivienda del señor Margarito U. le está haciendo falta terminar L. barda y algunos acabados D. L. casa. 
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y así poder realizar L. mejora lo más pronto posible ya que si familia se queda soL. todo el día. 
Por que el trabaja D. guardia D. seguridad en un rancho que está a las fuera D. L. ciudad y es por eso que quiere L. seguridad D. su familia. 
Cuando fuimos a realizar L. visita a L. vivienda del Don Margarito el encontraba en su trabajo y quien nos atendió fue su esposa L. señora Hortencia Reyes, quien es L. persona que aparece en L. foto.
texts.en:
At the household of señor Margarito U., he needs to complete a fence and some finishing work for the house. That is why he is applying for a loan from us-- in order to be able to buy material and, thus, be able to complete the improvement as soon as possible since his family is left alone all day. Because his work as a security guard is at a ranch that is outsiD. the city he wants to protect the security of his family.

When we came to carry out the visit to Don Margarito’s home he was at work, and his wife, señora Hortencia Reyes, took care of us. She is the person who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completing a fence and finishing work for a house

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María del Carmen López tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos todos mayores de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de comida enchiladas, tacos y golosinas en un bar estudiantil localizado en la escuela La Sallé. Ella dio inicio a este negocio  hace nueve años con venta de comida solamente. Después fue proporcionándole capital al negocio y ahora vende golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías necesarias para el funcionamiento de su negocio, tal como gaseosas y golosinas. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener un negocio grande que sea en su casa de habitación, además que desea mejorar la condición actual de la casa en que habita.
texts.en:
María del Carmen López is 50 years old, married, and has 2 grown children. She works selling enchiladas, tacos and candy in a students' cafe at La Sallé school. María began this business 9 years ago selling only food. Later, she was supplied with business capital and now sells candy and soda as well. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise necessary for her business operations, such as soda and candy. María's dream has always been to have a big business run from her home, as well as to improve the physical condition of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Antonio M. C.  es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor M. C. posee un una pequeña industria de bolis  que son refrescos en bolsa, los cuales luego sale a distribuir en una camioneta que posee. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Don Bayardo M. dio inicio a su negocio hace 15 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue heredado por su mama, ya que ella tuvo la idea de establecer el negocio y la fabrica. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias primas para su negocio. Su esposa trabaja como maestra en una escuela de primaria. Su meta principal es comprar mejores y más actualizadas maquinarias para mejorar su negocio, además que desea comprar otra camioneta que le permita distribuir mayormente su producto.
texts.en:
Bayardo Antonio M. C. is married and has two minor children. Mr. M. C. has a small factory that makes “bolis”, which are soft drinks in plastic sacks. He distributes them in his small truck. This business is located in his house. Bayardo M. started his business 15 years ago. He inherited the business from his mother. She had the idea of establishing the business and the factory. The loan is to buy raw materials for his business. His wife works as a teacher in an elementary school. His main goal is to buy improvements and more current machinery to improve his business. He also wishes to buy another truck that would allow for greater distribution of his product.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es: El señor Panfilo D.
texts.en: Panfilo D.

loans.use: Buy material for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Mayra Mayita

texts.es:
Es una joven soltera de 22 años de edad, manabita, oriunda de Jipijapa de ocupación profesora, desde muy niña ella empezó en el mundo de las ventas ya que sus padres sostenían un negocio de legumbres y hasta los actuales momentos lo conservan gracias al apoyo de ella y de sus hermanos que han sabido trabajar junto a sus padres.

Ella distribuye muy bien su tiempo para salir en el carro y recorrer entregando a los clientes las legumbres como tomate, cebolla, brócoli, papas, coliflor y más productos, comentaba que  tiene un recorrido de ciudades donde entregan como Pajan, Machalilla, Puerto Cayo entre otros.

Mayra comenta que para ella es tan importante este negocio ya que por medio de él ha podido obtener sus estudios, aunque para sus hermanos no ha sido fácil porque han tenido que dejar de estudiar para dedicarse por entero a las ventas.

En Mayra se podía notar durante la conversación que es una persona llena de fortaleza y de grandes retos, y que las ganas de trabajar son muchas, en sus planes a futuro ella desea terminar una nueva carrera universitaria.

Le preguntamos en que invertirá el préstamo y ella emocionada nos comentó que lo invertirá en comprar más productos, para abastecer su negocio, eso consiste en que tiene que viajar  a ciudades como Ambato, Guayaquil y Portoviejo para comprar los productos necesarios  y seguir vendiendo como hasta ahora lo ha venido haciendo sin ningún problema.

Ella está feliz porque tienen ya sus clientes fijos que la esperan para recibir las verduras frescas y en buen estado para consumirlas, todo esto le ha hecho acreedora de una gran confianza en sí misma para seguir apoyando a sus padres, muy a pesar de sus edad ella ama a los niños se involucra con ellos y es una excelente profesora, nada de esto le quita el sueño de llegar lejos y obtener más experiencia en el mundo de los  negocios.
texts.en:
Mayra is 22 years old, and she is a native of Jipijapa, a province in the Manabí region of Ecuador. She is employed as a teacher. When she was a little girl, she began working in the sales world by helping in her parents' business of selling vegetables. Until now, they have preserved that business thanks to the help of Mayra and her brothers, who have learned how to work through their parents.

Mayra budgets her time well when she travels in her car to deliver vegetables to her clients, such as tomatoes, onions, broccoli, potatoes, cauliflower, and more. She has certain cities where she delivers the vegetables, such as Pajan, Machalilla, and Puerto Cayo, among others.

Mayra believes her business is very important because through it, she has been able to fund her education. Although for her brothers, it has not been easy because they had to stop their studies in order to dedicate themselves entirely to the business.

In conversation with Mayra, you can see that she is a person full of strength with great challenges, and because her desire to work is so strong, she plans to complete a new degree course at the university in the future.

We asked her how she would invest her loan, and she excitedly responded that she will invest it in more products to supply her business, which includes trips to the cities of Ambato, Guayaquil, and Portoviejo to buy the products she needs. She will continue selling, without problems, like she was doing before the loan.

Mayra is happy because she now has her regular clients that wait for her in order to receive her vegetables, which are fresh and ready to eat. She credits this to her strong confidence in her self to continue helping her parents. Despite her age, she loves her students and involves herself with them, and she is an excellent teacher. None of this overtakes her dream of getting farther and obtaining more experience in the business world.


Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to supply her business

loans.name: Abejitas Group

texts.es:
Eulogia C. es la presidenta del grupo "Abejitas" que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal "German Busch". Eulogia vende frutas  en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y necesita el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería, así que con algunas vecinas y amigas de las zonas Ingavi, German Busch y Mercurio se agruparon. Las demás integrantes tambien tienen sus diferentes negocios como la venta de comida, chocolate y otras se dedican a negocios de servicio como el lustrar zapatos y transporte y otras al tejido de mantas.

El grupo espera permanecer mucho tiempo juntas y hacer uso de los servicios de Pro Mujer como la capacitación y la atención en consultorio.
texts.en:
Eulogia C. is the president of "Abejitas" Group, which at the same time belongs to "German Busch" Focal Center. Eulogia sells fruit in different markets in the city of El Alto and she needs the loan to grow her merchandise. So, with some of her neighbors and friends in the neighborhoods of Ingavi, German Busch, and Mercurio, they formed a group. The other members have their own different businesses, such as selling food and chocolate, while others dedicate themselves to service-oriented businesses, such as polishing shoes, transportation, and weaving blankets.

The group hopes to remain together for a long time and make use of the services Pro Mujer offers, such as trainings and office hours.


Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing merchandise, consumables, and raw materials

loans.name: Gladis Johana

texts.es:
Johana  forma parte del banco comunal Señora de la Luz desde hace 4 ciclos, es una madre soltera de una niña de 7 años, de ocupación maestra ella estudia educación Parvularia  en la universidad Eloy Alfaro de Manta y trabaja con niños en un jardín con alumnos de Pre-kínder.

Ella tiene 28 años de edad y trabajando de profesora hace 4 años, dos de ellos en su actual trabajo, en estos momentos tiene una pareja desde hace un año y medio él es Richard, y es su apoyo en todo.
Johana comparte el tiempo entre el estudio y su trabajo, se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropa, vende a crédito tiene pocos pero responsables  clientes, entre ellos están sus compañeras de trabajo y las compañeras de la universidad, empezó en el mundo de las ventas gracias a una buena amiga quien fue la que la impulso a trabajar.

En la mañana Johana sale al trabajo deja a su niña en la escuela y en la tarde regresa a casa para cumplir con su hija luego sale a la universidad ella cuenta con el apoyo de la mamá ya que es ella la que le ayuda a cuidar a su niña, Johana esta a punto de terminar su carrera solo le queda un año de estudio para graduarse de licenciada en Educación Parvularia.

Con el préstamo que ella esta solicitando a la fundación piensa invertir en comprar más joyas como cadenas, anillos, aretes, y también invertirá en compra de prendas de vestir como pantalones, camisas, blusas y más.

Johana al igual que muchas personas también tiene su sueño, ella espera poder hacer realidad tener su propio Jardín de Infantes.
texts.en:
Johana has been part of the community bank Senora de la Luz for the past 4 cycles. She is a single mother with a 7 year-old daughter. She is a teacher by profession, and studies nursery school education at Eloy Alfara de Manta University in addition to teaching gardening to preschool children. She is 28 years-old and has worked as a teacher for the past 4 years, 2 of which she spent in her current job. For the past year and a half she has been with a man named Richard, and she is his support in everything. Johana splits her time between her studies and her work. She sells jewelry and clothing, which she will allow some responsible clients to purchase on credit. Some of these include friends from work or university. She began in the world of sales thanks to a good friend who motivated her to work. In the morning Johana goes to work and leaves her daughter at school, and in the evening she comes back home to take care of her child before going to her classes. She counts on the help of her mother to look after her child. Johana only has a year left before she finishes her studies and graduates with a decree in kindergarten education. She plans to invest the loan that she is seeking in the purchase of more jewelry like chains, rings, and earrings, and also will invest in the purchase of clothing items such as pants, shirts, blouses, etc. Johana, like many people, also has a dream, which is to one day be able to have her own kindergarten.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Hipatia De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Hipatia es la fundadora del Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora De La Luz de la ciudad de Manta, ella junto a otras socias pudieron lograr que se construya la iglesia lugar donde se reúne el banco, ella nos comentó que no fue nada fácil lograrlo pero con la ayuda de la Fundación  Espoir fue una realidad ese sueño.

En los actuales momentos la señora Hipatia se dedica a la costura (modista) desde hace 20 años, estudio en cursos, aprendió  además los primeros auxilios, como poder  inyectar, poner suero, tomar la presión,  a mas de ello se dedica a la venta de joyas elaboradas en plata .

Todo esto lo realiza desde su propia casa, no tiene necesidad de salir a recorrer con su mercadería pues ella tiene sus clientes fijos que le vistan.

Hace 10 meses ella enviudo y quedo en compañía de sus 4 hijos 3 de ellos profesionales, quienes han sido el apoyo ante la perdida de su esposo. 

Señora Hipatia esta convencida que es una todologa, ella comenta que se levanta a las 6 am para hacerle el desayuno a su hijo Roy el menor de los cuatros, este joven  esta a punto de ser un Ingeniero en Sistemas, eso la hace una mujer orgullosa de sus hijos, dentro de su hogar tiene a un Biólogo, un Ingeniero  en  Comercio Exterior y una Psicóloga, considera que  la mejor herencia que los padres les pueden dar a sus hijos es el estudio.

Hipatia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar no quedarse con los brazos cruzados por ello no descansa, ella muy segura de su trabajo y convencida que obtendrá el crédito que esta solicitando el mismo que lo invertirá en más  telas, sabanas, edredones y joyas. Dice que tiene muchos proyectos a futuro.
texts.en:
Hipatia is a founding member of the Our Lady of Light cooperative bank of the city of Manta. Together with other members, she achieved the construction of the church that is the location where their bank associates meet. She tells us this was no easy task, but with the help from Fundación Espoir, their dream became a reality. Currently, Hipatia works as a seamstress, an occupation she has carried out for 20 years. She took classes and also learned First Aid, how to give injections, IV fluids, take blood pressure readings; in addition to this, she also sells silver jewelry. She carries out all these activities from her own home. She doesn’t have to travel around with her merchandise, as she has regular customers that visit her. She became a widow 10 months ago, leaving her in the company of her 4 children, of whom 3 are professionals. They have been her support in the aftermath of losing her husband. Hipatia is convinced that she can do it all. She tells us she gets up at 6 am to make breakfast for her youngest son, Roy, who has almost completed his degree as a Systems Engineer. This makes her very proud of her children. In her home she has a Biologist, an Engineer, and a Psychologist, and she considers that the best legacy parents can give their children is a good education. Hipatia is a woman who enjoys working, and is never idle or resting. She is very secure in her work, and confident that she will obtain the loan she is requesting. She will use the funds to invest is more fabrics, sheets, comforters, and jewelry. She tells us she has many future projects planned.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, sheets, comforters, and jewelry.

loans.name: Vailea

texts.en:
Vailea L. (0) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has five adult children.

Vailea owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising goats for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 350 WST a month.

In 2009, Vailea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vailea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 300 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Vailea is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Angel Danilo

texts.es:
Ángel es un joven de 25 años que vive con sus padres en la zona de Pósope Alto, en el distrito de Pátapo, ubicado a 40 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo – Perú.

Se dedica al servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi, esta actividad la viene realizando hace un año y es su única fuente de ingreso, además  Angel es el único que solventa los gastos de su hogar debido a la avanzada edad de sus padres.

El joven Ángel está solicitando un financiamiento de 800 Nuevos Soles, debido a que su unidad móvil presenta algunos desperfectos mecánicos y el dinero que gana no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de reparación necesarios que garanticen que su moto funcione de manera eficiente y así seguir ayudando a sus padres sin problemas.
texts.en:
Ángel is a young man, 25 years old, who lives with his parents in the Pósope Alto neighborhood, in the Pátapo district, located 40 minutes from the province of Chiclayo, Peru. He transports cargo and passengers in his motorcycle taxi. He has been doing this work for one year and it’s his only source of income. Furthermore, Ángel is the only one who provides support to his household because his parents are elderly. Ángel is requesting a loan of 800 PEN because his motorcycle has some mechanical problems. What he earns isn’t enough to cover the costs of the necessary repairs that will guarantee that his motorcycle will keep working in an efficient manner so that he can continue helping his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Tauva's Group

texts.en:
Tauva A. (0) is a 57-year-old woman living in the town of Samalaeulu, Leauvaa. She is widowed and has one adult child.

Tauva owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2007, Tauva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Tauva is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 5th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “Siempre Alegres” pertenece al Centro Focal “Los Andes”, se agruparon recientemente por la necesidad de acceder a un crédito que les permita mejorar sus negocios. Las integrantes tienen diferentes negocios como la venta  poleras, ligas, botones, detergente, otras se dedican al tejido de chompas y cartera. Todas necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería o la compra de materia prima como la lana y cola de rata (cordel grueso). Además este grupo se caracteriza por ser señoras amables, simpáticas y alegres.
texts.en:
The cooperative association “Always Happy” belongs to the town center of Los Andes. They joined together recently due to the need to access credit that would permit them to improve their businesses. The members have different businesses such as the sale of t-shirts, elastic bands, buttons, detergent, and others dedicate themselves to knitting sweaters and purses. They all need a loan to increase their merchandise, or to buy raw materials such as yarn and rattail cord (thick string). The ladies in this group are characterized by being kind, friendly and happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en:
Tolotea A. (0) is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Mulivai, Safata. She is single and has one infant child.

Tolotea owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 320 WST a month.

In 2007, Tolotea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

Tolotea is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will again be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena P. A. es una mujer de casada. Tiene 7 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. lo más difícil que María enfrento fue el dedicarle tiempo suficiente a su familia, ya que muchas veces tenía que trabajar, María se levantaba muy temprano para viajar a los departamentos porque todos sus productos eran mucho más favorable. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, calzados, camisetas y cosméticos. Su deseo es seguir trabajando día a día.
texts.en:
María Elena P. A. is married, and she has seven dependent children. She has been selling general merchandise for over 14 years. The most difficult thing for María is devoting enough time to her family because many times she has to work. María gets up very early to travel to the departments because all of their products are much better. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy purses, footwear, shirts, and cosmetics. Her wish is to keep working day to day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta L. (0) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has four adult children.

Ruta owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 350 WST a month.

In 2009, Ruta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ruta is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Las Artesanas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Artesanas Unidas esta conformado por tres mujeres provenientes de  San Juan de Oriente un pequeño poblado localizado a un kilómetro de Catarina. Este pueblo  es uno los más grandes productores de artesanía en barro nicaragüense.

Las integrantes de grupo  son M. Elena López Medina, L. M. B. C. y Gregoria Bernarda V. C. todas ellas son artesanas y necesitan capital para poder comprar materiales para la producción de sus piezas en cerámica y barro.

La coordinadora es la señora M. Elena López Medina de treinta y nueve años de edad de los cuales tiene veinte años dedicada a la producción de artesanía. López quien elabora piezas de cerámica para negocios y turistas  ya ha trabajado con Adim con lo que pudo logran un crecimiento en su negocio y mayor estabilidad para su familia.

Actualmente el mayor desafío de ella es la crisis económica del país que perjudica al negocio sin embargo ella esta segura que esto se combate con trabajo y esfuerzo. Su mayor anhelo es que su negocio prospere y que sus dos hijos de puedan seguir estudiando y prepararse.

Las otras dos integrantes son la señora Gregoria Bernarda V. C. de cuarenta años de edad quien produce artesanías y  la señora L. M. B. C. de treinta años de edad quien tiene su propio taller de artesanía las cuales vende a los turistas. Ella lleva siete años en este negocio junto con su esposo Carlos Sebastián López quien es artesano.  
 
Todas ellas esperan poder seguir  trabajando en esta hermosa y difícil profesión  tradicional e hereditaria para demostrar la belleza nicaragüense.
texts.en:
The United Artisans Group is comprised of three women from San Juan de Oriente, a small town located a kilometer outside of Catarina. This town is one of the biggest Nicaraguan pottery producers. The members of the group are M. Elena López Medina, L. M. B. C. y Gregoria Bernarda V. C., who are all craftspeople and need materials for the production of their ceramic and earthenware pieces. The group leader is M. Elena López Medina, 39 years old. She has spent 20 years working in handicraft production. Lopez creates ceramic pieces for businesses and tourists and has already worked with Kiva partner ADIM, through which she was able to grow her business and create more stability for her family. Right now, her greatest challenge is the country's economic crisis, which has hurt her business. Still, she is sure that she will meet this challenge through hard work. Her main goal is for her business to prosper and for her two children to be able to continue going to school. The other two members of the group are Gregoria Bernarda V. C., 40 years old, who [also] produces handicrafts, and L. M. B. C., 30 years old, who has her own shop for handicrafts that she sells to tourists. She and her husband Carlos Sebastián López, who is also a craftsman, have had this business for seven years. All the women hope to be able to continue working in this wonderful, yet difficult, profession, which is one of tradition that has been passed down through the generations, showcasing Nicaragua's beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for creating ceramic and earthenware handicrafts

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
Antonia F. es una socia del grupo “La Solución” que pertenece al Centro Focal Juan Pablo, ella confecciona fundas hace 8 años, los  préstamos que obtuvo ha invertido en su negocio, comprando máquinas industriales como la OVER ya que antes solo tenía máquinas domésticas. Ahora necesita el préstamo  para comprar tela por mayor. Antonia tiene 4 hijos y  dos nietos y confía en el personal de salud de Pro Mujer para hacer los controles respectivos de sus nietos, además  le gusta asistir a las reuniones porque es un espacio de esparcimiento.
Las demás integrantes  también tienen sus negocios como la venta de muebles, aretes, comida, pasteles, ropa y necesitan el préstamo par ala compra de mercadería ( muebles, aretes, arroz, papa, pasteles) y materia prima ( tela).
texts.en:
Antonia F. is a member of “The Solution” group, which belongs to the center city of Juan Pablo. She has been making coverlets for 8 years, and has invested the loans she’s received into her business. She bought industrial machines such as the OVER, since before she only had domestic machines. Now she needs a loan to buy fabric at wholesale. Antonia has 4 children and two grandchildren, and she has trust in the health of Pro Mujer to provide for the necessary controls for her grandchildren. In addition, she enjoys attending the reunions because it is a place for recreation. The other members also have their businesses, such as furniture, earrings, food, cakes, and clothing sales, and they need a loan to buy merchandise (furniture, earrings, rice, potatoes, cakes) and raw materials (fabric).

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Francisca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Francisca esta conformado  Julia Argentina C. C., Argentina del Socorro G. G., Junieth José T. P.,  Gema Guadalupe Q. C. y Juana Luisa G.. Ellas son provenientes del municipio de Masatepe  ubicado en la parte sur del departamento de Masaya. 

Masatepe es una ciudad muy antigua, su existencia data desde  la época pre-hispana. Este es parte de los llamados Pueblos Bancos o Pueblos brujos, llamados de la primera forma por el predominio de ese color en las casitas de adobe, y de la segunda forma porque algunas personas aún practican la creencia indígena. 

Asimismo en estos predominan las artesanías, las flores, el folclor y los dulces tradicionales. Este grupo es un grupo que trabaja  con la producción y venta de tradicionales postres nicaragüenses como son las rosquillas, las reposterías, queques y dulces pero  para poder seguir con su negocio necesitan de capital para comprar la materia prima.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Julia Argentina C. C. de 45 años de edad quien tiene diez años con la producción y venta de rosquilla, un tradicional bocadillo hecho a base de maíz y queso.

 Esta señora que desde muy temprano elabora las rosquillas en su casa y luego sale a venderlas necesita capital para poder invertir en materia prima (maíz, queso y dulce) para la elaboración de rosquillas y así enfrentar la crisis económica del país  Ella desea que su negocio crezca y que le permita a poyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que se puedan preparar.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Junieth José T. P.  de 28 años de edad desde hace 6 años  tiene una pequeña repostería, Argentina del Socorro G. G. de 62 años que tiene dos años con la venta de golosina y Gema Guadalupe Q. C. de 47 años quien  produce y vende reposterías y queques.
texts.en:
The Francisca Group is made up by Julia Argentina C. C., Argentina del Socorro G. G., Junieth José T. P., Gema Guadalupe Q. C. and Juana Luisa G.. They are from Masatepe Municipality, located in southern Masaya Department. Masatepe is a very old city, dating from the pre-Hispanic era, and is one of the so-called Pueblos Blancos (White Villages) or Pueblos Brujos (Witch Villages); the first because there are many white adobe buildings, and the second because some locals still practice traditional indigenous beliefs. In these villages, crafts, flowers, folkloric music and traditional sweets still predominate. This group produces and sells traditional Nicaraguan desserts like rosquillas (a traditional snack made from corn and cheese), pastries, cakes and sweets. However, in order to continue with their businesses, the group members need money to buy the raw ingredients. Mrs. Julia Argentina C. C. is the group's coordinator; she is 45 years old and has been producing and selling rosquillas for 10 years. She starts making rosquillas at home very early each morning, then goes out to sell them. She needs a loan to invest in raw ingredients (corn, cheese and sugar) to make rosquillas and face the national economic crisis. She wants her business to grow to thus allow her to pay for her children's education. The other group members are: Junieth José T. P., who is 28 years old and has had a small pastry shop for the past 6 years; Argentina del Socorro G. G., who is 62 and has been selling sweets for the past two years, and Gema Guadalupe Q. C., who is 47 and makes and sells pastries and cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make pastries, like milk, cheese, corn, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Loluama

texts.en:
Loluama T. (0) is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has four school-aged children.

Loluama owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 WST a month.

In 2009, Loluama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Grace M. Moelu (0) is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Grace M. owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.
