loans.use: To purchase vehicles for her transportation business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino T., 44, lives in a fairly large village in San Mateo, Rizal.  His wife, Flordeliza, 45, is a freelance writer.  They have five adult children, three of whom are enrolled in college and the other two who are in high school.

Marcelino has a college degree in Journalism and has worked as writer/editor for different local publications for 12 years.  He ventured into videography when the publications business in the country experienced great losses. He trained with a local media outfit and his career in media services started. In 2003, Marcelino began to provide photo/video coverage for his clients and continues to do so now. He has a small studio where he produces and edits raw video footage. Marcelino is earning close to P50,000 a month out of this business. Three members of his family work in the studio.

Marcelino joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the summer of 2008.  He applied for a P13,000 loan from CCT.  He would like to purchase sophisticated gadgets used in video production and post production to enhance the quality of his pictures and videos.      

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase items used in photo/video editing

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson D. is the 45-year-old owner of a general store and lives in Modesta Village, San Mateo, Rizal.  He is married to Lilian Lila, 48, a psychologist. They have two school-aged children.

Johnson has been an entrepreneur for almost two decades. He also has a motorized tricycle. Combined, he earns a monthly income of close to P30,000.  

He joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only in 2008, but is already enjoying many benefits from being a member. He has just finished repaying his previous loan with CCT.  Now on his fourth loan cycle, he has applied for a P9,000 loan, which he will use to purchase additional items to sell, including rice.


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell at his general store

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard M. is a young businessman who lives in Oro Vista Subdivision, Concepcion, Marikina City.  He is 27 years old and single.  

Business runs in the family. Leonard’s parents have been in the business of selling RTW (ready-to-wear) apparel for three decades. Leonard started as an errand boy in their store. He saw that the business was good, so when he came of age and had already saved a few thousand pesos, he established his own general merchandise store selling RTW and other dry goods in 2005. Leonard now earns at least P20,000 a month.

He joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in October 2008.  He has finished repaying his previous loan with CCT and is expecting a new loan in the amount of P11,000.  He will use the funds to purchase  more items to sell, including footwear (flip-flops).

Leonard dreams of owning space inside a shopping mall. 


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase footwear to sell at his general merchandise store

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira C., 33, lives with her husband Elvin, 32, a family driver, and their two grade school children in the heart of a joyful community in Maricaban, Pasay City. Almira owns a general store located just in front of her house. She remembers starting this business five years ago with a handful of items to sell. She now earns close to P10,000 a month from her general store. Almira joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004, the same year she opened her general store. She is applying for a P15,000 loan from CCT which she said she will use to expand her store by purchasing more items to sell. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Oeurn Thy Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan Mrs. Ouern T. belongs to consists of 19 people.  They are located in the Sam Raong village in TaK. province.  Oeurn is the village bank president, and was selected by the members of her group.  She owns a two hectare field of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer and to hire laborers to work in the field.  Her husband, Mr. Min Num, is a hardworking man.  Ouern is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school.  Her third child is still too young for work or study.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste P. is a 42-year-old businesswoman living in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  She lives with her husband Renante, 34, a company driver, and their two children, who are both in grade school.

Celeste has been a fish and hog meat vendor for 20 years now.  She has a stall in the nearby public market.  She makes P10,000 a month income from her business.  

Celeste came from a poor family, but she believes that there is always a way to get out of it.  In the later part of 2006, she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She has carefully invested the proceeds of her previous loans in her business.  It went well, and brought her enough income to augment her family’s daily needs, including her children’s education.

Now on her 12th loan cycle, she is requesting for a loan of P37,000.  She will use the funds as additional capital for her fish and hog meat stand.  Celeste is optimistic that she can bring her family out of poverty because of the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and hog meat to sell at the market

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia L., 49, lives with her husband Renero, 52, a taxi driver, in a small house in Malibay, Pasay City. They have five children, two of whom are already making their own living. Felicia converted a small space in her house as her small general store selling basic household commodities to neighbors like soap, shampoo, biscuits (cookies), soft drinks and other items. She also sells RTW (ready-to-wear) garments. She earns P15,000 monthly. Felicia joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2008. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with CCT and has applied for a new loan of P10,000. Felicia will use the money to purchase more items to sell in her general store. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Janat Beakam Group

texts.en:
Janat Beakam is the leader of Janat Beakam Group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his or her business to purchase more materials for their businesses and make a good income for their families in future. 

Sarow Naz and Bibi Khard want to take a loan for their tailoring business to buy one or two new machines of tailoring. Janat Beakam wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store to complete their stock. Fareba wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business to complete her necessary materials. Also, Pashton Gull wants to take a loan for her husband’s metal shop business. They all want to see expansion and progress in their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families, and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: Expand their various businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals for his farmland

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante S. is a 42-year-old entrepreneur from Maricaban, Pasay City. He lives with his wife Anna, 44, and their two children. Dante owns and manages a computer shop catering to Internet surfers, gamers and even students. He has been in this business for eight years and he has six employees. Dante makes P50,000 a month. He enjoys dealing with customers of all ages and from different walks of life. Customer traffic peaks on weekends, he says. Dante joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 and has since been enjoying many benefits from being a member. He is currently in need of funds to buy computer units for the expansion of his computer center and to upgrade some of his PC units. He applied for a P50,000 loan with CCT to augment his business needs. Dante optimistically claimed that it will not be long before he will be opening his second branch. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy new computer units and upgrade older PCs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon M., 50, may have lost most of her family’s precious belongings to a fire that gutted half of the shanty town in her village in Tramo, Pasay City last year but she did not lose hope. Her family was able to “rise from the ashes”. Despite the odds, Corazon lives happily with her husband, Candido, 51, a repairman. They have five children and three are already married. Corazon manages an appliance repair shop specializing in electric fans and other household appliances. Her husband does the repairs and she handles the sales. They earn close to P7,000 a month from servicing home appliances and selling spare parts and accessories. Corazon joined Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004. She applied for a loan of P9,000 which she will use to purchase spare parts for electric fans and other home appliances. Corazon dreams of establishing another branch in another area. They also have been praying for their own house and lot. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for electric fans and other appliances

loans.name: Mr. Chantha Sek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group which consists of twenty people is located I. Boeng village I. Takeo province. Mr. Chantha S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.

Mr. Chantha is farmer who raises pigs and chickens to earn a living. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens and piglets to raise. His wife, Mrs. Chay Davy, is employed I. a garment factory.

Mr. Chantha is 28 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled I. the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Bopha N. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is presented I. the photo instead. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Sixteen members have EoT loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

EoT loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. An EOT loan allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds for his farm

loans.name: Charmarose

texts.en:
Charmarose M. is the 42-year-old responsible wife of Mr. Gil M. and a loving mother to her five children who age from 23 to 3 years old. Her husband is laborer while she is a woman who runs different kinds of small businesses. Before she had an access to credit through ASHI, sufficient income to cover all her family expenses and business sustainability were the problems she encountered. These were also the reasons why she had been doing different kind of businesses. 

In 2001, Charmarose decided to join ASHI to address the problems she had. Firstly, she wanted to finance the business she thought best capable of generating a bigger profit. Then, the next problem, which is covering her family expense, would be solved once her business became stable.

Therefore, Charmarose’s first and second loans were used to support her rice buy-and-sell business. She has been able to grow the business and has increased their family income. She was able to payback the loans on time and has been attending center meetings of ASHI on time, too. Every week she manages to save through ASHI for her other personal and family needs.

At this point in time, Charmarose is planning to use her loan to purchase a motorcycle as an additional business. Motorcycle-for-hire is one of the most common businesses of people in the municipality of Hamtic where she and her family live. This is the most convenient kind of transportation and people would rather choose it than a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar), since a motorcycle doesn't take long in the parking area waiting for passengers and can easily reach farther and more uphill places which is the typical landscape of the municipality. 

In the future, Charmarose hopes that her businesses will grow more and that she will be able to purchase another motorcycle to have a bigger income. With this income, she wants to send all her children to college so that she will have the capacity to offer them a more worthwhile kind of life.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for a transportation business and to finance her rice buy-and-sell business

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living I. Boeng village I. Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Chantha C. is the 38-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who grows rice on a piece of land that she owns. She also breeds pigs and chickens. Her husband, Mr. Pav Mun, is employed I. a government department. Mrs. Chantha C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and chickens, and to hire laborers to work on the field. She has three children who attend the local school. 

All of the members of this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva. 

The other four people I. the photograph, Mrs. Sok Ny, Mrs. Chan Sopheap, Mrs. Mean Morn and Mr. Yonn Vanna, are the group guarantee and they also presented I. the picture with their group loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chickens, and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Najeba Group

texts.en: Najeba is the leader of Najeba Group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for expanding their businesses. Najeba wants to take a loan for her husband who has a metal working shop. Malali wants to take a loan for an embroidery business. Manizha wants to take a loan for a tailoring business. They are requesting a group of loan 38,000 AFN. And they are very happy for AFS and Kiva lenders who can support the world.

loans.use: To expand a metal working shop, embroidery business and tailoring business

loans.name: Lotu

texts.en:
Lotu K. is a 54-year-old man living in the town of Eva 3. He is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lotu owns and operates a business making and selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Lotu has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lotu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lotu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lotu is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Lotu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand his business.

About SPBD

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

Epenesa has had this business for over six years and earns approximately 2000 WST a month.

Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epenesa is now requesting a new loan of 3950 WST for the same purpose.  The loan will her seventh loan from SPBD.  Epenesa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
In 2007, Joana R. started a variety store through her membership in ASHI. She had the opportunity of accessing a loan then. Her variety store operates in her own village, providing convenient service to people and access to credit for the things they need.

Joana is 31 years of age while her husband, Reynaldo, is 36 years old. The two have three children, ages 9 months to six years old. As a mother, Joana wants her children to experience the best things that life can offer. She wants to invest for their future by establishing a stable source of income. As a wife, she wants to maximize her productive role by starting her own business in order to augment her husband's small income.

After a year of paying back her first loan, Joana's business has progressed, especially with the addition of her second loan. She has savings with ASHI and has gained avid customers. Now that Joana is on her third loan, she wants a larger amount, to increase the variety of items she can sell in her retail store. Her plan of enhancing her business is supported by ASHI, since she has shown a good credit rating: meaning a good attendance rate, a good repayment rate and – most especially – she has made her business grow.

With Joana's opportunity to borrow, she is striving for the success of her business and aspiring for personal growth by dealing with the different kinds of people who become her customers. For her children, Joana wants to be able to supply nutritious food to make their bodies and minds healthy. She dreams of sending them all to college.

loans.use: To increase the variety of items for a retail store

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios D. has been an entrepreneur for decades. She’s into buying and selling of goods that are in demand in any given season. She is now 58 years old and she lives in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City, with her husband, Victoriano: also 58 and a salesman. They have five children: three of whom have their own families already and the two youngest remain under their care.

Remedios is now concentrating on buying and selling fresh chickens, eggs and edible oil. She has a home-based business. She earns more than 2,000 PHP every week.

Remedios just joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the first quarter of this year but she is already enjoying the warm ambiance of the weekly gatherings of her fellowship group. Now on her third loan cycle with CCT, she's applied for a 8,000 PHP loan which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline E. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Safaatoa Uta.  She is married and has six adult children.  To make a living, Karoline owns & operates a sewing business, selling a variety of clothes in the local community.  Karoline has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

Karoline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Karoline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2750ST WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase a new sewing machine.  Karoline is now requesting a new loan of 3250ST WST, which will be used to purchase additional cotton materials and fabrics to make clothes.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by her from SPBD.  Karoline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and cotton materials to make more clothes

loans.name: Farhad Group

texts.en:
Farhad is the leader of Farhad Group. There are four members in this group. Each of them requests a loan to make progress in their businesses and make their businesses larger. Farhad requests a loan for his general store. Seveta and Zarghna request a loan for the business of tailoring. Jawad requests a loan for his taxi service. 

They are requesting a group loan of 20,000 AFN and they are very happy with this process of obtaining a loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses (general store, tailoring and taxi service)

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia L. is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Tiavea 2.  She is married and has one adult child.  To make a living, Leonia owns & operates a business raising cattle for sale.  Leonia has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Leonia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Leonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals.  Leonia is now requesting a new loan of 2200 WST, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Leonia from SPBD.  Leonia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei P. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Saleaumua.  She is married and has five school-aged children.  To make a living, Tinei owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Tinei has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Tinei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tinei has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Tinei is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Tinei plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan F. is a 30-year-old mother of two children ages nine and three years old. Her loving partner and the father of her children, Jerry Gallano, is a fishpond caretaker and sometimes a carpenter. In 2006, Joan joined ASHI in order to have access to credit, which enabled her to put up her own business and own source of income to augment her husband's. 

When Joan started with her fish buy and sell business, she only sold a small volume of fish since her business capital was small. After several loans from ASHI and after showing her good performance in attendance during weekly center meeting, repayment, and business, she was allowed to have a larger loan. Eventually her business grew. The volume of fish she bought and sold increased. She also saved with ASHI every week. 

With Joan's new loan, she plans to add crab, shrimp, and prawn to the variety of fish she sells. Jerry has been very happy for Joan's business since they can work together and have the opportunity to run their own business. Joan and Jerry can't wait for their business and their savings to grow because they want to have a fishpond of their own. Joan is praying that her business will be successful and that she and Jerry will be able to sustain their family's financial needs.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Josephine is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn and bananas for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 66 years old. Florencia is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Florencia owns & operates a pedicab transport service. Florencia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Florencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a secondhand pedicab. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mr. C., age 52, and his wife, Mrs. Mach Reun, age 51, live along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have three children, one son and two daughters. Two of the children are garment factory workers and another one is in school.

C. and his wife have been selling fish for three years. They buy fish from a fishing lot and fishermen, and then  resell the fish in the village where they live and at the market in Phnom Penh. He is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike. He will also use his loan to expand his fish business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and expand his fish business.

loans.name: Olya

texts.en: Olya M. was born in 1953 in Sevan, which is a beautiful town not far from Yerevan. Her family consists of two members: her 87-year-old mother, whom she takes care of, and herself. Olya has never been married and has no children. She finished secondary school. Before 1995, Olya worked as a shop assistant at the big local store, but then she decided to organize her own business with personal funds. Now she is busy selling ladies', men’s and children’s clothes at the trade fair. Olya needs a $550 loan to buy and sell children’s school uniforms before the beginning of the school year on the first of September.

loans.use: To buy and sell children’s school uniforms

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Nhem, age 46, and her husband, Mr. Moeun Chea, age 36, have been married since 1985. They have two sons and two daughters. One of them is married, but still lives in the family house. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia.

M. has been selling flowers and bananas since 1997. She grows the flowers by herself and buys banana in her village. One day a week, she transports the flowers and bananas to the Phnom Penh market to sell, except for holyday, which is a day set aside for the observance of Buddhist precepts. She receives a gross profit of 250,000.00 riel (about $62.50) for each journey. Her husband, Mr. Moeun Chea, is a construction worker. He works in his village and in the nearby village. 

The couple wants to build a kitchen and a restroom for the family to use, but they don’t have money. Thus, M. is requesting her second loan of $1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To build kitchen and a restroom for her family

loans.name: George Njoroge

texts.en:
George N. is a 26-year-old gentleman, married to Diana Wanjiru. He has been operating a taxi business for the last five years from Naivasha town.

This is George's second loan with KADET and he intends to buy a new engine for his taxi for better services and to also add a competitive edge.

He used his first loan to service his taxi and buy spare parts, which enabled him to boost services to his loyal customers. George learned about KADET from a friend who is already a client. 

His future aspiration is to own a fleet of taxis and register a tour and travel company.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Sann, 49, and her husband, Mr. Phen Mao, 50, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1980 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of their sons are in college. 

Y. has run beauty salon at her house for 3 years and her daughters assist her in the business. Mr. Phen Mao is a farmer. He grows jasmine and many kinds of flowers. Y. doesn’t have enough materials to operate her business, so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to buy more materials for her beauty salon and to use as capital for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Mao, 32, and her husband, Mr. Sophea Sao, 29, have been married since 2002 and have two young daughters. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

S. has been selling jasmine flowers and longan for 5 years. She buys them in her village and transports them on her motorbike to the Korky Market, about 5 kilometers from her house, to sell. Her motorcycle is old and breaks down very often, so she is applying for her first loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to replace the old one and to buy longan on contract to resell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one and buy longan on contract.

loans.name: Ahmatchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ахматчон Чурабоев мужчина 53 лет,образование среднее,женат и имеет четырех детей.Его жена Суюдиева Мухаббат присматривает по хозяйству и её основным делом является присматривать за скотом,которых покупает ей её муж.Ахматчон любит своё дело,которым занимается больше 20 лет.Узнав про нашу организацию, эта семья став нашим клиентом, купила дойную корову на первый займ.С тех пор они работают с нами благодарны нам за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Ahmatchon C. is a 53-year-old man with secondary education. He is married and has four children. His wife, Muhabbat Suyudieva, looks after the household. Her primary task is to take care of the livestock that her husband buys for her. Ahmatchon loves his business, which he has been involved in for over 20 years. Having learnt about our organization, this family became our client and purchased a dairy cow with the first loan. They have been working with us since then and are grateful to us for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Geofrey Chumba

texts.en:
Geofrey K. is 34-years-old and married to Beatrice Chumba. Together they have six children who are all going to school. He has been employed as a motorbike rider for the last three years in Naivasha town.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who is already a member, after unsuccessfully being unable to access a loan from any other financial institution. This will be Geofrey's first loan. 

With this loan Geofrey intends to purchase his own motorbike and run his own business.

He also has a long term goal of expanding his business and owning his own taxi and a public service van commonly known as matatu.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy his own motorbike.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
36-year-old Lorna M. is a mother of two children, ages 13 and 17 years old. Both are high school students and are sincere about studying. Salvador, Lorna's husband is a delivery helper for gas tanks, while Lorna is an entrepreneur. She is as hard working as her husband because she is determined to give her two children the opportunity of going to college - an opportunity which she and her husband never had when they were young because of poverty.

Lorna had different kinds of businesses when she had an access to credit for business capital through ASHI in 1997. However, none of those became successful until 2004. Lorna never thought of fish to buy and sell as a business, although the village where she and her family lives is surrounded by the sea and fish ponds. It was after several failures that she tried the said business. In 2004, Lorna's loan from ASHI was Php20,000. She used the loan to finance her first endeavor with fish to buy and sell. After years of doing such business activity, she found success and contentment. She has been a vendor of fish since then until now. With her previous loan she planned to buy crab, shrimp and other varieties of fish for her avid costumers to have many choices in buying. Lorna rents a space in the market where she sells her fish. 

Despite her busy schedule in attending to her business, Lorna gives time to attend to her weekly center meeting in ASHI and pays her weekly amortization from the loan she has taken out. Through ASHI, Lorna was able to realize the importance of savings thus making her save weekly in preparation for her other personal needs.

loans.use: Variety of fish and seafood to be sold.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Mr. M. Veng, age 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-oeun Pen, age 47, live along National Road Number One about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have four children, three sons and a young daughter. One of their children attends school; the other three are still too young.

M. has been selling cows for 21 years, a skill he learned by himself.  He buys cows in his village and in other villages and sells them to customers who come to his house. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. 

M. wants to expand his business, so he is applying for his first loan of $500 to purchase cows to raise and sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise and sell

loans.name: Rookhsar Group

texts.en:
Sadaqat, the leader of Rookhsar Group, is married and has three children. With hard work he formed a group of three members, each one of them busy in different tasks: Sadaqat has a metal working business, Abdull Habib has a fuel shop and Muhib has a tailoring shop. They want to become stronger in their businesses. Therefore, they formed a group and requested a group loan. Each member requests 14,000 AFN to further their work and be a good client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company). 

Sadaqat is sure that they can repay the loan on time and that he can lead the group. He would like to thank everybody who is helping with this process of obtaining a loan in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults

loans.use: To complete stock in their businesses (metal working, fuel sales and tailoring)

loans.name: Mrs. Sokvorn Chhom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvorn C. is 27 years old and the mother of two children wH. are too young to work or study. The village bank which consists of eighteen members is located in Kampong Trea village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Sokvorn C. is the village bank president wH. has been selected by the members. She is a farmer wH. owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In her vegetable growing she faces an obstacle because she does not have vegetable seeds for growing. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds to grow on the field. Her husband, Mr. Nget Thy, is a driver for a garment factory. Mrs. Srey O. did not come to take a loan but her husband was, so he is presented in the picture instead. 

One member in this group loan is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed to grow on the field.

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Аскар Доноев-47 летний мужчина, с высшим образованием.Семейный и имеет 3х сыновей и 2х дочек.Сам Аскар является бригадиром в колхозе и имеет большой опыт в скотоводстве.Дома держит много овец и коров.За ними присматривают дети и жена Машхура.Этим Аскар кормит и содержит семью.По наслышке он узнал о Микроинвест и решил взять кредит.На эти деньги он закупил корм для своего скота.Второй займ уже в большой сумме он потратил на дойную корову и получил выгоду погашая частично.Ему понравилось и рад нам.Слендующий кредит он берёт на дойную корову, так как получил двойную выгоду.
texts.en:
Askar D. is a 47-year-old man with higher education. He is a family man and has three sons and two daughters. Askar is a foreman at a collective farm and has an extensive experience in animal husbandry. He keeps many sheep and cows at home. His children and wife, Mashkhura, look after the livestock. This is how Askar feeds and supports his family. He heard about MicroInvest and decided to obtain a loan. He used that money to purchase livestock feed. He took out a second, larger loan and spent it on buying a dairy cow, and made profit, while repaying the loan. Askar liked the terms and was happy with us. He wants to use his next loan to purchase a dairy cow because he got a dual benefit from such purchase before.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda L. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Raymunda is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Raymunda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Raymunda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Raymunda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raymunda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Raymunda is requesting a new loan which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Raymunda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: Natig was born in 1984. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Khirdalan town. He is single. Three years ago, he started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Claire

In 2009, Claire joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claire is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Claire from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam is applying to Kiva for a second loan. He would like to buy tires and other necessary things for improving his business and he needs a loan of 2000 AZN for bringing about his plans.

loans.use: To buy tires and other necessary things

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.en:
Godofredo F. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old. Godofredo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Godofredo operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn and cassava for sale. Godofredo has been engaged in his business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (about $84) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Godofredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Godofredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Godofredo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Godofredo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Нури успешно продолжает свою деятельность. Расширила ассортимент товара и привлекла много клиентов. Улучшила качество товара и повысила уровень семейного положения. В учебный сезон она хочет закупить мужские сорочки.
texts.en:
Nuri successfully continues her business. She expanded her merchandise selection and attracted many customers. She improved the quality of the merchandise and increased the level of her family living situation. Nuri wants to purchase men's undershirts during the school season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's undershirts

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia N. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old. Irenia is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Irenia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Irenia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $168) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Irenia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Irenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Gloria: Group 4

texts.en:
Gregoria D. L. C., pictured second from the left, is the coordinator of this five-person group. She is a single mother of four children, and resides in the sector of Guaricanos, in Santo Domingo Norte, along with two of her daughters and a one-year-old granddaughter. One of her daughters, 41 years old, is deaf-mute, and Gregoria maintains her in her home. Gregoria loves her intensely and has her help out with her business. She has been selling silver jewelry in the streets for the last year, though she used to sell similar things for many years up until five years ago, when her business slowed to a stop, and she had to find a waged job.
	This will be Gregoria’s 3rd loan, and with it she plans on purchasing a good amount of inventory at a great price from wholesalers. Specifically, she hopes to invest in silver chains, bracelets, rings, and earrings, which are always in high demand. By the end of this loan, she hopes to have multiplied her profits over what she borrowed, and increase her customer base. One of her goals for the near-future is to be able to invest in a display case to increase business. 
	One of Gregoria’s dreams is to eventually be able to establish a large business. She hopes to further herself and her family, and proviD. a bright future for her 1-year-old granddaughter. Gregoria also spoke emotionally about how she prays her deaf-mute daughter will find a husband and create a family of her own.

loans.use: silver chains, bracelets, rings, and earrings

loans.name: Mr. Ream Phurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people living in Kampong Trea village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mr. Ream P. is a 34- year-old village bank president. He is employed in a garment factory. He has four children, three of whom are attending the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Choek Roung, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In the vegetable growing, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough seeds to grow onions on the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Ream P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to grow onion on the field.

loans.name: Mrs. La Si Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of twelve members, is located in Kampong Trea village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. La S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study. She is a hard working woman who has been hired by the villagers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Chork Cheng, is a fisherman. With his fishing, he can earn a little income to support his family living.  In order to improve the living, Mrs. La S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets to improve her husband's fishing.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Delia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a retail store buying and selling rice in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif was born in 1956. He is married and has five children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, now settled in Absheron region. He has five years of experiences in the consulting business.
Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a computer, printer and necessary things for improving his consulting business.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela T. is from the village of P-5, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Miguela is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Miguela owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Miguela has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Miguela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Miguela is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Miguela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bihosiyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Сангинова больше трех лет кредитуется в нашей организации. Ей очень нравится условия кредитования нашей организации. Период кредитования она не только расширила товарооборот но и улучшила финансовое положении семьи. Хосият просит очередной займ для закупки  пряников, сахара, сгущенного молока, яиц и тд.
texts.en:
S. has been working with our organization for over three years. She likes our organization's credit terms very much. After obtaining credit, she not only increased her product turnover, but also improved her family financial situation. Hosiyat is requesting her next loan for the purchase of pryaniks (ginger honey cakes), sugar, condensed milk, eggs and etc.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pryaniks, 20 bags of sugar, condensed milk and eggs

loans.name: Christopher Makanga

texts.en:
Christopher is married to Joyce Khehaya and they have four school going children. For the last three years, Christopher has been transporting small goods around Naivasha town with a motorbike.

A friend introduced him to KADET and this will be his first loan. With the proceeds from the loan, he is planning to buy his own motorbike. This will make him self employed and will begin his journey to financial freedom.

In the future, Christopher wants to venture further into the transport business eventually owning a minivan for public transport and increasing his income.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir was born in 1969. He is married with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region and is now settled in Absheron region. He has been a school teacher for ten years.  He is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy computers, printers and a scanner to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy computers, printers and a scanner

loans.name: Mahsad

texts.ru: Бободжонова, целенаправленно используя займ увеличила товарооборот. Она хочет улучшить внешний вид торговой точки, для привлечение еще больше клиентов. На запрашиваемый займ она сделает мелкий ремонт места деятельности.
texts.en:
B. increased her goods turnover by using her credit purposefully. She wants to improve the outside appearance of her retail store in order to attract even more customers. She will use this loan to make minor repairs to her place of business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Minor repair of retail store

loans.name: Uguloi

texts.ru: Умарова Угулой 1974 года рождения замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж работает таксистом.Она год кредитуется в Микроинвесте. Угулой занимается продажей женских платков. Она торгует в магазине «Нури Худжанд». Товар она привозит из оптового рынка г. Истаравшана. Спрос на её товар большой из за национального обычая. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить новый вид платков.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Uguloi U. is married and has three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She has been working with MicroInvest for one year. Uguloi sells women's scarves at the Nuri Khujand store. She brings her merchandise from a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Her merchandise is in high demand due to the traditional customs. Uguloi wants to use this loan to purchase new type of scarves.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's scarves

loans.name: Mose

texts.fr: Mose N. est depuis 2005 dans le monde de micro-entreprise. Son activité initiale consistait à vendre des bidons d’huile de palme et du pétrole. Le temps et l’environnement l’ont amenée à ouvrir une boutique qu’elle gère jusqu’à ce jour. Pour réaliser son rêve Mose a décidé de se faire cliente de l’IMF Hope RDC. Elle a reçu 7 fois les prêts de cette Institution qu’elle a remboursés correctement. Le prochain crédit lui servira d’acheter des articles tels que des boites de conserve, tomates, sardines, cartes prépayées, etc. … pour renforcer le stock de la marchandise de sa boutique. Son affaire se situe sur une montagne à l’est de la ville de Kinshasa. Mose a 53 ans, veuve et mère de 3 filles et 7 garçons âgés entre 12 et 35 ans. Huit de ces enfants vont à l’école et deux sont indépendants. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour un dépôt de ciment et de farine de froment.
texts.en:
Since 2005, Mose N. has been in the world of micro-enterprises. Her initial business involved selling drums of palm oil and kerosene. The times and the environment have lead her to open a shop, which she still manages today. To realize her dream, Moses decided to become a client of the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. She has received seven loans from this Institution, and she repaid them correctly. The next loan will be used to buy goods, such as canned food, tomatoes, sardines, prepaid cards, etc….for bolstering the stock of merchandise in her shop. Her business is located on a mountain, east of the city of Kinshasa. Mose is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of three girls and seven boys, ages 12 to 35. Eight of these children go to school, and two are independent. Her ambition is to open an outlet for cement and for wheat flour.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Pulot

texts.ru: Пулот успешно закончил первый займ в МЗФ Микроинвесте. Он занимается откормом скота. У Пулота есть большой участок земли где растет корм для скота. Он планирует купить баранов откормить их и продать перед святым праздником «Курбан» (Курбан - это святой праздник где приносят жертвоприношения овец).
texts.en:
Pulot successfully repaid his first loan with MLF MicroInvest. He is involved in raising livestock. Pulot has a large plot of land where livestock feed grows. He plans to purchase rams, raise and sell them prior to the sacred holiday of Kurban (Kurban is a sacred holiday for which sheep is sacrificed).

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Махбуба продолжает  свою деятельность. Целенаправленно используя займ она увеличила товарооборот и ассортимент товаров. В этом году она отправила свою дочь в летний лагерь. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить хозяйственные товары и благодарит кредиторов.
texts.en:
Mahbuba continues her business. She increased her goods turnover and selection by purposefully using credit. This year, she sent her daughter to a summer camp. Mahbuba wants to use this loan to purchase household goods and thanks the creditors.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household goods

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en: Rami is a 31-year-old married man with one child. He has owned a car repair shop since 2005 and has 10 years of previous experience in this field. Today, Rami is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to buy additional tools for his shop and to better satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en: Nizar is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a barber shop since 2004 and earns income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Nizar is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to buy additional supplies for his shop so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Умаров Рахимчон 1969 года рождения. Женат, имеет одного ребенка.Жена торгует на базаре прохладительными напитками. Рахимджон торгует на базаре «Панчшанбе» галошами. Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. Он хочет получить займ на расширение ассортимента товара и закупить в летний сезон мужские сланцы
texts.en:
Rahimchon U. was born in 1969. He is married and has one child. His wife sells refreshing drinks at a market. Rahimchon sells galoshes at the Panchshanbe market. He buys his merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. He wants to obtain a loan to expand his merchandise selection and buy men's flip flops in the summer season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer flip flops

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2008, he decided to open his own barber shop.

Today, Khaled is requesting to borrow $800 to buy new tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his barber shop

loans.name: Wahibe

texts.en:
Wahibe is a 46-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2001 and has twenty years of previous experience in this field.

Today, Wahibe is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to buy a sewing machine to provide a variety of products for her clientele.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Khamida

texts.ru: Холикова Хамида 1955 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж Хамиды работает маляром в частной фирме. Хамида 15 лет занимается продажей кондитерских изделий и больше года является активной клиенткой МЗФ Микроинвест. Она ездит продавать товар в Мастчинский район. Спрос на её товар большой, потому что у неё очень вкусные печёные изделия. Хамида планирует в свой ассортимент добавить мясные изделия; колбасы, сосиски, ветчину и тд.
texts.en:
Khamida K. was born in 1955. She’s married and has three children. Her husband works as a painter for a private company. For the past 15 years, Khamida has earned her living selling pastries, and she’s been a client of MLF Microinvest for more than a year. She travels to the Mastchin region to sell her products, which are in high demand, because she makes really delicious baked goods. Khamida plans to expand her offerings to include meat products, sausages, hot dogs, ham, etc.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pastries and meat products

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 44-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has been working as a tailor since 1994. Over the years, thanks to her business income, she has been able to meet her parents’ needs.

Today, Nada is requesting to borrow $800 to purchase a sewing machine so she can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. She has been working as a tailor since 2000 to provide, along with her husband, good living conditions for her children.

Today, Houda is requesting to borrow $800 to buy a new sewing machine to better satisfy the needs of her clients.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Вохид

texts.ru: Вохид продолжает  свою деятельность . После использованного займа в МЗФ Микроинвесте он увеличил товарооборот и прибыль. Теперь он поставляет рыбу не только покупателям базара Фаровон но и населению города Худжанда и Душанбе. Отсюда спрос на его товар стало еще больше.На запрашиваемый займ он хочет закупить  рыбы.

loans.use: На закупку рыбы.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 25-year-old married man living with his wife. In 2002, he decided to open his own phone-accessories shop.

Today, Wissam is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy additionA. supplies for his shop to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for his shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old married man with three children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1999 servicing the neighboring villages.

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Хосият

texts.ru: Одилова Хосият 1948 года рождения. Замужем имеет семерых детей. ЕЕ муж пенсионер.Хосият 3 года является активной клиенткой в МЗФ Микроинвест. Она закупает рыбу и в домашних условиях коптит, сушит, засолевает затем готовую продукцию сдает продавцам на рынке. В этом ей помогают дети и муж. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить рыбу.

loans.use: На закупку рыбы.

loans.name: Houssam El Dine

texts.en:
Houssam is a 30-year-old married man. He has been working as a farmer for the past ten years to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family.

Today, Houssam is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additional supplies in order to satisfy the needs of the market.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 20-year-old man living with his parents. He has been working as a construction worker since 2006 to provide, along with his brothers, adequate living conditions for the family.

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more tools so he can develop his work and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more tools to develop his work

loans.name: Азизахон

texts.ru: Исоева Азиза 1976 года рождения. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж работает дальнобойщиком.Азиза 3 года является активной клиенткой в МЗФ Микроинвест. Исоева занимается торговлей рыбой. Она торгует на базаре Фаровон и в Кайракуме. У неё много покупателей так как рыба полезный продукт. Рыбу ей поставляют поставщики.  Она планирует разнообразить вид рыбы и этим привлечь еще больше клиентов.

loans.use: На закупку рыбы

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 54-year-old married man and father of four children. He has owned a mini-market called "Y. Market" since 1999. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs.

Today, Khalil is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his mini-market

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion S. is 49 years old, is married with five children and one adopted son, all of whom are in school. She and her family reside in Brgy. Miranda, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental.

Mrs. S. helps her husband support their family by engaging in a buy and sell business, selling fish and rice to the local community. She has done this for the last six years has earned a net income Php 1,500 per month. Aside from this, she also accepts laundry to add to their family income and help her husband pay for the family expenses and for the schooling of their children.

Mrs. S. is at present on her 13th loan and is borrowing Php 12,000. She will add this to her own funds to purchase a transport vehicle that will make her fish deliveries to the market easier and faster.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.
