loans.use: To purchase a vehicle for her business

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en: Ofelya S. is a 50-year-old widow. Her husband was a volunteer soldier who died in the Artsakh war. Ofelya has a daughter and a son who are helping her run her business. She has a private house where she has built a bakery. Here she bakes and sells her product. Now Ofelya needs $2300 to repair her bakery and buy modern equipment for her business.

loans.use: To repair her bakery and buy modern equipment for her business

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel B. is a 35-year-old married woman with four school-age children. For the past eighteen years she has contributed to the family income by raising livestock like pigs and chickens in her backyard, and by running a "sari-sari" or general store.

Marivel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 so that she and her children would not be totally dependent on the income that her husband earns.The loans, that she invested wisely in her business ventures, have improved the quality of life of their family.

Now, for her 19th loan, Marivel is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can purchase more pigs to raise and sell. The income from her business helps in the day-to-day expenses of their household and partly funds the education of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en:
Bolale is happily married with four children and she is 40 years old. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past twenty years.

Bolale is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zahanati Group

texts.en:
Rhoda is a member of the Zahanati borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is 33 years old and separated from her husband. She is the mother of two children, ages three and 10.

Rhoda started her own tailoring business 10 years ago. She works six hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rhoda's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more material for her business.

With the profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Rhoda hopes to save money and expand her business.

Magreth and Neema are the other members of the same borrower group. Like Rhoda, they have requested loans from BRAC Tanzania in order to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring material

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona S. is 37 years old and is married to Mr. Jun S.. She has five children and lives in Brgy. Canroma, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She is a dedicated wife who is determined to help her husband improve their life situation. Mrs. S. has been engaged in food production for the past fifteen years. She and her husband, with the help of their older children, sell snack food, corn, vinegar and other food products to the neighboring towns, especially where there is a fiesta going on (and there is always a fiesta going on somewhere in the island of Negros). This is not easy work because they need to wake up early to travel and set up their station, stay up late selling their product, and when the crowds are gone, pack up and go home. However, it earns a good income of about PHP 9,800 per month, so they persevere because it sustains the education of some of their children, and the needs of the family. Hard work, patience and discipline are the key elements to Mrs. S.'s continuing success. Mrs. S. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 and the unsecured loans she has borrowed over the last ten years have enabled her to make her business a sustainable endeavor which is a great help to their family. At present, Mrs. S. needs to purchase a transport vehicle to facilitate the delivery of her products and transport them from town to town as they transfer selling locations. This is why, for her 17th loan, Mrs. S. is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that, with her own transportation, she will be able to reach farther and stay longer in the towns and not be dependent on the availability of public transportation. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to facilitate delivery

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Juliet, 31, lives in Agbara, where she is a married mother of two children. Juliet sells foodstuffs and is requesting a loan of N150, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is grateful to LAPO-KIVA for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma M. is a woman with a M.. This 63-year-old married mother of six adult children works very hard to help support her family by selling fish door to door in her community. Norma has been running her business for the last twenty years. Although she is getting old, she persists as long as she is able to carry her baskets of fish because it is a great help to their family as it earns her an average profit of PHP 3,000 per month. The PHP 15,000 that Norma is borrowing for her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon will allow her to buy more fish to sell around her community. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Salam Plus Kis Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Salama Plus est la deuxième banque communautaire de Kisangani d’avoir bénéficié des prêts de Kiva. Il est constitué de 26 micro-entrepreneurs dont N’sila B. est membre. Cette ville de Kisangani située au nord de la ligne de l’Equateur, est dans la province Orientale de la République Démocratique du Congo et est frontalière au nord-est avec le Soudan et l’Ouganda. Elle a été victime des guerres entre deux armées étrangères en 2000 an.
N’sila vend de l’huile de palme, du riz, du maїs au marché I.A.T dans la ville de Kisangani. Il a depuis 2000 an gagné assez d’expériences dans le petit commerce. La vente du carburant fut sa première activité avec un capital initial de $20. Au fil des ans, N’sila a changé d’activité et est parvenu à se constituer une clientèle fidèle pour l’avancement de son affaire. Ses ambitions sont, premièrement, effectuer des voyages d’affaires à l’avenir en vue de fournir à la population de la ville des produits sollicités. Deuxièmement, construire une maison pour sa famille. Il a obtenu 5 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et a remboursé correctement. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $40 par semaine. Vu la demande qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le prêt qu’il recevra prochainement lui permettra de renforcer le stock des marchandises en achetant des produits alimentaires du même genre. N’sila est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 2 filles et 2 garçons âgés entre 8 et 16 ans dont trois d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
The group Salama Plus is the second community bank of Kisangani to have benefited from Kiva loans. The group is composed of 26 micro-entrepreneurs, including a member named N’sila B.. This city of Kisangani, located north of the equator, is in Orientale province of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and it’s on the border with Sudan and Uganda to the northeast. The city was the victim of wars between two foreign armies in 2000. N’sila sells palm oil, rice, and corn at the I.A.T market in the city of Kisangani. Since 2000, he has gained a fair amount of small business experience. Selling fuel was his first business with $20 in initial capital. Over the years, he changed businesses and has managed to establish a loyal customer base for advancing his business. His ambitions are, first of all, to take business trips in the future with the aim of supplying the people of the city with sought-after goods. Secondly, it’s to build a house for his family. He obtained five loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC, and he repaid them appropriately. Right now, his business generates a profit of $40 a week. Given the ever-increasing demand, the loan he’ll receive next will allow him to bolster his inventory of merchandise by purchasing food items of the same type. N’sila is 36 years old, married, and the father of two girls and two boys, ages 8 to 16. Three of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his inventory by buying goods to sell for increasing his revenues

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Iniciadores De Ameca Group

texts.es:
La señora  Lidia C. pertenece al grupo INICIADORES DE AMECA  en la comunidad de Santiago en el municipio de Ameca Ameca,Estado de México  que se encuentra a pies de los volcanes.
La señora Lidia es viuda  vive a orillas del volcán Popocatepetl, ella tiene una pequeño criadero de pollitos; el clima del poblado es frío lo que ocasiona que tenga pequeñas perdidas  por que no todos los pollitos sobreviven, ella no cuenta con los suficientes recursos economicos para poder equipar el criadero de pollitos, razón por la cual se une con otros compañeros que tambien tienen las mismas necesidades, por lo que se unes y forman un grupo, para poder solicitar un credito atravez de fundación realidad A. C. con el crédito comprara una  cámara de gas y mantener un clima calido logrando una mayor producción ya que de esta actividad depende ella y su nieto, su nieto viaja al Estado de Hidalgo para hacer la venta de dichos pollitos. Ellos sueñan con tener una mayor producción de pollitos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. 
El grupo Iniciadores de Ameca esta conformado por 4 integrantes:
Maria Graciana, la cual tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Marlen R., Da mantenimiento a equipo de computo y el Señor Gervacio B. que cuenta con un puesto de antojitos y comida corrida. 
Solicitan un crédito grupal de $20,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Lidia C. belongs to the Iniciadores De Ameca group in the community of Santiago, municipality of Ameca, Mexico, at the feet of volcanoes. Lidia is a widow who lives at the bank of the Popocatepetl volcano. She has a small chick farm, and because the village's climate is cool she occasionally loses a few of them since not all the chicks are able to survive. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so she can purchase a gas coup and maintain a warm climate, which will give her a better production in the business she and her grandson depend on. Her grandson travels to the state of Hidalgo to sell the chicks. They dream of having better production from their chicks so they are able to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a gas coup

location.town: Santiago, Municipio de Ameca Ameca, Estado de Mexi

loans.name: Yilian Group

texts.es:
La señora Josefina G. es Viuda tiene 60 años, vive dede hace 20 años en la Colonia Santa C., la cual pertenece al Municipio de Valle de Chalco, esto en el Estado de Mexico es una zona semiurbana. La Señora Josefina emprendio una actividad, elaborando ricos buñuelos para vender casa por casa,  gracias a esta actividad le ha dado estudios a su hija que a un vive con ella y que se apoyan para los quehaceres de la casa y gastos que se tienen, como alimentación y vestido entre otros. Su necesidad es comprar la harina por bulto, para la elaboración de buñuelos ya que actualmente lo ha comprado solo por kilo, ella sabe que si lo compra por bulto le origina mayor ganancia que le ayudara para poder comprar un triciclo para poder seguir vendiendo sus buñuelos y cansarse menos,ya que asi ella no cargaria sus buñuelos, sino que tendria un medio para poder transportar sus buñuelos, asi mismo vender pan por las tardes en su casa y contar con ingresos que le ayudaran a tener una mejor calidad de vida, por esta razón se une a otros compañeros con los mismos deseos de Emprender o seguir desarrollando su actividad, por lo que se unen para solicitar un crédito a travez de Fundación Realidad A. C. El grupo se conforma por 5 integrantes. las cuales son: Monica D. que se dedica al bordado de bolsas de manta, Sarai Susana M. tiene una estetica, Mario B. vende paletas y helados y la señora Teresa C. que se dedica a la venta de nieve. 
Monto que Solicitan 14000 pesos.
texts.en:
Josefina G. lives in the semiurban zone of Santa C. colony, municipality of Valle de Chalco. She belongs to the YILIAN group, which consists of five members. Josefina lives with her son, and they support each other in covering household expenses. Not able to find permanent work, Josefina started making doughnuts to sell door to door in the mornings, and in the afternoons she sells bread outside of her home. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase a tricycle so she will be able to offer her products more comfortably. This way she can also purchase flour by the sack, which would be cheaper than buying it by the kilo, which is what she currently does, and she wouldn't get tired as much.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar harina por bulto para elaborar buñuelos, materia prima para la elaboración de helados y paletas entre otros.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: New restaurant space

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina T. is a 50-year-old woman who is determined to improve the way her family lives. She is married to a farmer, Mr. Domingo T., and blessed with 11 children. The Tilanes family resides in Brgy. Batuan, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. 

Ma. Cristina T. admits that it is very hard to raise 11 children, especially when the family income cannot support the needs of the family. But determination, and being armed with her knowledge of handling a business, has helped her to survive the difficulties.

Mrs. Cristina T. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 and used her first loan of Php 3,000 to open a "sari-sari" or general store. She slowly expanded her business with each loan until she was able to add new lines to her business like selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes. Her general or "sari-sari" store now earns her a monthly income of Php 6,000. The income she earned in her business has enabled her to make a down-payment on a motorcycle for her husband which will also be used in her business.

At present Mrs. T. is on her 10th loan and is borrowing Php 17,000 which she intends to invest in expanding her business.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a mother of two and lives in Makongeni in Thika, a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Nairobi. Mary owns a retail shop which sells household items, drinks and local snacks such as mandazis (flat doughnuts). She has been doing this for the last three years. Mary uses the business to support her family and now wants to borrow KES 50,000 to increase the stock in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock of glass

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a vegetable trader in an open-air market in Thika. He specializes in wholesale trading in vegetables such as cabbages, potatoes, onions, carrots and cucumbers. He buys the produce directly from farmers in the rural areas of Matuu, a rich agricultural area, transports them and then sells them to residents and small-scale retailers in Thika, Nairobi and the coastal region. He has been doing this for the last four years but the declining rainfalls are threatening crop production. Paul has requested a loan of KES 50,000 in order to increase his stock of potatoes, cabbages and carrots in readiness for the holy month of Ramadhan, as demand for these products is quite high then.

loans.use: To increase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 38-years old, married with two children and lives in Lagos.  She sells drinks and has been in this business for the past five years. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Norita Ayme

texts.en:
Señora Norita has a variety of different business ventures. She is pictured here with her car which she puts to work as a taxi transporting people between the small town of Yarinacocha and the nearby city of Pucallpa. Norita is 29 years old and lives with her family in Yarinacocha. She and her husband have a three-year-old son. In addition to her business ventures, Norita works as an elementary school teacher. Her husband is a policeman.

Norita has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about three years and belongs to the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (The Little Mangoes). She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase shoes for sale. Norita plans to use this loan of 3000 soles for several purposes. She will have maintenance work done on her car, invest in a fish pond that she owns and purchase more shoes for sale.

Norita has many plans for the future and additional ideas for business ventures. She wants to have a spare parts shop for cars, build a home for her family, rent out some of the rooms in this home, and also construct an event hall which can be rented out. Norita is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos, in part because it is an organization specifically dedicated to making credit available to women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Maintenance work on a taxi, investment in a fish pond, purchase of shoes

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta lives in Lagos and runs a restaurant business. Modesta has three girls that assist her in her food business and she pays them on a monthly basis. She has been in the business for the past two years. Modesta is 31 years old and married with three children. She is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells clothes and is also a fashion designer. She has been in this business for the past five years. Christiana is 37 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of  NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes and a sewing machine so that she can better meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Josabeth

texts.en:
Señora Josabeth, pictured here showing some of the merchandise that she sells, is 53 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  She has one 18-year-old daughter whom she loves very much.  

Josabeth has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about seven years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in the sale of beauty products.  With this loan of 1500 soles, Josabeth plans to buy merchandise such as shoes and clothing to sell.  She will also invest in a printing machine.

Josabeth's goal is to construct a locale in front of her home where she can set up a printing shop.  She is grateful for the financial assistance she has received from Manuela Ramos, assistance that has enabled her to invest in her very own business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothing for sale, as well as a printing machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: For the past 12 years, Elizabeth has been selling sarongs, shoes, bags and ready-made clothes.   She is requesting a  loan of N100,000 to purchase more of this merchandise to sell. Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support in these hard times.

loans.use: To purchase more cloths, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah, a clothing seller and a fashion designer, has been in business since 1998. Thirty-three years old and married with four children, Sarah is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more clothess and a sewing machine in order to meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dania Milagros

texts.es:
La socia Dania, es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ella vive en 1ro de mayo D-8 en el barrio de pintacha, situados a 1 hora con 20 minutos desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es soltera, no tienen hijos ella tiene 25 años de edad y es empleada de una panadería ubicada en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, ella ayuda a la elaboración de panes y también vende los panes que la misma produce, la socia desea el préstamo para uso personal, ella quiere comprar algunos pequeños artefactos para su hogar y cumplir con los pagos mensuales, con lo que le pagan a ella en su trabajo.

Nuestra socia agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Dania is a native of Urubamba province and lives in neighborhood of Pintacha, an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 25 years old, single and has no children. She works at a bakery located in the main market of Urubama, helping bake the breads and also selling the products. Dania is requesting the loan for personal use. She wants to buy a few small items for her home and will fulfill her monthly payments with what she makes for her job. She is thankful for the support and promises to fulfill her payment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items for her home

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en: Fusena, 23 years old and married with two children, lives in Lagos where she sells cooking pots. She has been borrowing from LAPO for a year, and the loans have boosted her business. She is now requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cooking pots to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking pots to sell.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia Margot, es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene su domicilio en mariscal castilla s/n, situados a 1 hora con 20 minutos desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es viuda, y tiene  1 hijo, ella tiene 62 años de edad, actualmente trabaja vendiendo ropa en el mercado central de Urubamba, ella trae ropa al por mayor de la ciudad de Lima o Juliaca y lo vende en la feria del mercado, ella viaja cada 15 días aproximadamente a traer mas mercadería, nuestra socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y educa a su hijo que está a punto de terminar sus estudios superiores, ella solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio.
 
Nuestra socia valora y agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Margot is a native of the province of Urubamba, and lives in Mariscal Castilla, an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco, Peru. She is a 62-year-old widow with one son. She works selling clothes at the central market of Urubama. She brings in clothes at wholesale from the cities of Lima or Juliaca and send them on the markets main days. She travels approximately every 15 days to bring in more merchandise. Margot is a very hard-working woman and she educated her son, who is about to finish his higher education. She is requesting the loan to be able to reinvest in her small business. She values and is thankful for this support and also promises to fulfill her payment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing at wholesale to sell

loans.name: Leydi Noelia

texts.en:
Señora Leydi, 29 years old and married with two young children, sells eggs. Leydi and her family live in the city of Pucallpa, where her husband works as a driver.

Leydi has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about 1.5 years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends). Leydi used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase eggs at wholesale prices, and she plans to use her new loan of 1000 soles for the same purpose. She works independently and distributes her eggs throughout the city of Pucallpa.

Leydi's goal is to engage further in the market for eggs by eventually obtaining her own post in the commercial area where eggs are sold wholesale. She is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos because the organization has enabled her to invest in her own business.

loans.use: To purchase eggs for sale.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia, nació en la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene su domicilio en av. mariscal castilla s/n, situados a 1 hora con 20 minutos desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad viuda,  es madre soltera, ella  tiene  3 hijos y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la provincia de Urubamba, exactamente en el mercado antiguo en el puesto nº 5, ella tiene este negocio desde hace 11 años, conoce muy bien su negocio, por lo que tiene el éxito asegurado en las épocas de declive, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería y abastecer su negocio.

Nuestra socia valora y agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Celia is a native of the province of Urubamba and lives in her home in Mariscal Castilla, an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco, Peru. She is a 43-year-old widow and mother of three. She alternates her household obligations with work in retail. She has a small convenience store in Urubamba, exactly in the old market at the fifth sales post. She has had this store for 11 years and knows her business very well, which has ensured her success even in times of recession. She is requesting the loan so she can purchase more merchandise and stock her store. Celia values and is grateful for this support and also promises to fulfill her payment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke sells provisions and frozen food like fish, chicken and turkey. She has been in the business for the past two years. Jumoke lives in Lagos. She is thirty-five years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100000 to purchase more provisions and frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose sells hair extensions and hair creams. She has been in the business for eight years and she is very happy with the growth of her business. Bose is thirty-nine years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair creams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To re-stock her shop

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 28 años se dedica a venta de cosméticos por catálogo, actividad que realiza todos los días, recorriendo las casas de sus clientes potenciales. Los productos que ofrece son de una línea de belleza de prestigio, y esto garantiza sus ventas. Hermelinda siempre lleva a la mano uno de sus catálogos y muestrarios para que de esta manera pueda captar nuevos clientes en toda ocasión. Durante todo este tiempo ella ha notado que la venta de cosméticos es un negocio rentable, pero que también tiene riesgos cuando da al crédito. Para el futuro, Hermelinda planea continuar vendiendo productos de belleza y adquirir más clientela para incrementar sus ventas. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más activas y puntuales de su banco comunal, y además se siente muy bien de pertenecer a su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más productos de belleza que servirán para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in a home they own. For over 28 years she has sold cosmetics by catalog. She does this daily, going from house to house of potential customers. She sells products from a high-end beauty brand, and this guarantees sales. Hermelinda always has her catalog and samples on hand so that she can attract new customers at any moment. Throughout the years, she has noticed that cosmetics sales are profitable, but risky when sold on credit. In the future, Hermelinda plans to continue selling beauty products and acquire new customers to increase sales. This is her fourth loan through MFP. She is one of the most active and punctual members of her communal bank, and she enjoys being part of her group. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase more beauty products to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene19 años y vive con sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a dos negocios de manera paralela: vende jugos por las mañanas y por las tardes atiende un centro de video juegos que instaló en su propia casa. En este último es con el que obtiene mayores ganancias, por lo que está muy contenta con el progreso rápido que ha tenido. En algunas ocasiones sus padres la apoyan, pues todo este esfuerzo lo hace para solventar sus estudios. Janeth desea para el futuro implementar ambos negocios, tanto con mejores utensilios para la venta de jugos, como equipos de video juegos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una nueva integrante en su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de una nueva licuadora, vasos y el pago del mantenimiento de los televisores que usa para los video juegos.
texts.en:
Janeth is 19 years old and lives with her parents. For the past year she has been running two businesses simultaneously: in the mornings she sells juices, and in the afternoons she manages a video game center set up in her home. She earns more money with the latter, and is very happy with the rapid progress that she has made. Her parents sometimes help her, because she is doing this to pay for her studies. In the future, Janeth hopes to purchase equipment for both businesses, with better utensils for the sale of juices and video game consoles. This is her first loan with MFP. She is a new member of her communal bank and has promised to be punctual with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase a new blender and glasses, and to pay for the maintenance on televisions used for the video games.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.en:
In this photo, Señora Lizbeth shows her jewelery catalogs and the few products she has left after having had a month of good sales.  Lizbeth sells clothes, costume jewelry and other merchandise.  She works independently with the loans she receives from the Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos.  Lizbeth is thirty-three years old and is married with two young children.  Her husband is a high school teacher.  The family lives in the city of Pucallpa.  

Lizbeth has been working with Manuela Ramos for about ten years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  With her first loan of 300 soles (about $100), she purchased regional farm products such as plantain and chickens to later resell in the city.  Lizbeth will use this loan of 1600 soles to purchase clothing and costume jewelery to sell.  All of her merchandise is ordered in advance by her customers.

Lizbeth's goal is to construct a second story for her house.  Once this construction is finished, Lizbeth plans to convert the first floor into a store where she can display her merchandise and hopefully increase her sales.  Lizbeth is grateful for the financial assistance she has received from Manuela Ramos.  She also appreciates the educational sessions (about how to expand and improve one's business) given by Manuela Ramos' loan officers at each monthly meeting of her communal bank.

loans.use: To buy clothing and costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Awawu

texts.en: Awawu sells fried groundnuts and popcorn, supplying her customers within her locale. She has been in the business for the past ten years. Awawu is forty-five years old and married with five children. She is very grateful for the financial assistance rendered to her by Kiva lenders in these hard times. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more groundnuts and guinea corn to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts and guinea corn

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 61 años, vive en una casa alquilada con una de sus hijas. Hace un año y medio decidió dedicarse a la venta de diversos tipos de productos, según la temporada. Actualmente vende frazadas, para ello, sale todas las mañanas, de casa en casa, ofreciendo su mercadería. Para Juana, esta actividad es muy relajante y aunque camine cuadras  innumerables consigue las ventas que se propone. Con sus ganancias y ahorros, hace algunos meses atrás, pudo incursionar en la venta de comida los fines de semana. Y debido al constante crecimiento en sus negocios Juana ha decidió continuar trabajando de esta forma e implementar sus negocios. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está contenta porque este préstamo es una oportunidad de progreso, además que se siente comprometida con el banco comunal al que pertenece. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de frazadas para la venta y tazones nuevos para su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Juan is 61 years old. She lives in a rented house with one of her daughters. A year and a half ago she decided to begin selling various products, depending on the season. Currently she sells blankets, going out every morning from house to house, offering her merchandise. For Juana, this is very relaxing activity although she walks innumerable blocks to make sales. With her earnings and savings, she was able to start a business selling food on the weekends a few months ago. Due to the constant growth in her businesses, Juana has decided to continue working in this manner. This is the first time she has requested a loan through MFP. She is happy because this loan is an opportunity to make progress, and she feels committed to the communal bank she has joined. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase blankets for sale and new bowls for her business selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y debido a sus ventas exitosas tiene a disposición otras personas que venden por ella en otras zonas de la ciudad, expandiendo así, sus márgenes de ganancia. Por su parte, ella recorre muchas calles para adquirir nueva clientela y con todos estos años de experiencia, ha visto crecer su negocio, por lo que posee, en la actualidad, una buena cantidad de mercadería disponible que ofrece al crédito. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda de cosméticos en una zona comercial de su localidad, donde pueda exhibir sus productos y vender con mayor comodidad. Esta es cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más activas de su grupo y quien persevera en momentos de conflictos, por lo que es muy querida por sus compañeras. El dinero que viene solicitando será para invertirlo en la compra de grandes cantidades de mercadería al por mayor.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. For 12 years, she has been selling cosmetics by catalog and is successful with her sales. Her abilities rival other sales representatives who work in other parts of the city, which help her expand her profit margins. For her part, she has traveled through the streets in search of new customers and with her many years of experience, has been able to grow her business. At the moment she has a significant amount of merchandise available that she offers on credit. In the future, she hopes to have her own cosmetics store in a commercial area of town where she can exhibit her products and sell them with greater ease.

This is María’s fourth loan with MFP. She is one of the most active members of her group and always perseveres during difficult moments. She is well-loved by the other group members. The money she is requesting will be used to buy larger quantities of merchandise at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 20 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace un año tiene un locutorio (centro de llamadas telefónicas), el cual instaló en su misma casa, invirtiendo de los ahorros que había reunido con mucho esfuerzo.  De esta manera, inició su propio negocio, el cual administra y atiende todos los días. En este tiempo ha visto resultados positivos en la preferencia de los clientes por su establecimiento, debido a que está ubicado en una de las calles principales de su ciudad, esta significativa ventaja es la que la anima a aspirar mejoras para su negocio en el futuro; siendo una de ellas, la modernización de sus equipos telefónicos y la venta de repuestos y accesorios para celulares. Esta es la segunda vez que Pilar tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha de formar parte de un banco comunal que ha superado muchas dificultades, por lo que renueva su compromiso de seguir participando activamente. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas prepago y la reparación de alguno de sus equipos.
texts.en:
Pilar is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the family home. One year ago, she used her hard-earned savings to start a locutorio (call center) out of her house. She manages and attends to her business every day. Pilar is seeing positive results at the moment because her customers prefer her business because of its location on one of the main streets of the city. She hopes to capitalize on this advantage so that she can make improvements to her business. Some of the things that she wants to accomplish in the future are to modernize her phone equipment and begin selling mobile phone parts and accessories.

This is the second time Pilar has taken a loan from MFP. She is very pleased to be part of a communal bank that has overcome many difficulties. This has renewed her commitment to stay actively involved. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase prepaid phone cards and repair her existing equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prepaid phone cards & make equipment repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Señora Ethel has a hardware store which offers a wiD. range of goods.  Ethel is sixty-three years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  She is widowed and has ten adult children.  Ethel is pleased that all of her children have professional careers.  

Ethel has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past five years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in her hardware store.  Ethel plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to invest in a welding workshop.

Ethel's goals have been achieved with respect to the education of her ten children; nevertheless, Ethel still has a few goals for the future.  She wants to finish constructing a family boarding house/hostel on a plot of land that she owns six kilometers outsiD. the city.  Ethel is happy to be working with Manuela Ramos and is pleased with the financial support she has received from the organization.  Ethel also enjoys the social aspect of being a member of a communal bank: many of her neighbors are also members of "Nuevas Amigas."

loans.use: A welding workshop

loans.name: Anabel Jaclin

texts.en:
Señorita Anabel works independently selling clothing.  Anabel is twenty-six years old.  Though she has a partner, they do not yet have children.  Anabel lives in the city of Pucallpa.  

Anabel has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about three years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  Anabel invested in shirts and shoes for women with her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100).  She hand-decorates her items before selling them.  Anabel plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to purchase clothing, shoes and materials which she will decorate and sell.  She feels that the extra effort she puts in to decorate her goods has increased her sales.  

Anabel's goal is to build a home and a shop where she can display her hand-decorated shoes and clothing.  Anabel is pleased to receive capital from Manuela Ramos to invest in her business .  She also appreciates the business education talks given by the organization's loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.

loans.use: Clothing and shoes to sell and decorative materials

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice operates a printing business in the busy, densely-populated area of Nairobi. She has two little girls who are both in school.  Beatrice started this business in 2006, and has developed it to its current level. Her main focus is printing DVD cases. Due to rapid expansion, she has requested a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to satisfy the increased demand.

loans.use: To purchase more printing paper

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and has one child. She operates a printing business in the downtown part of Nairobi, in a thriving small-business center. The printing business is highly fragmented, comprised of both big and small players. Lucy's business involves typesetting, printing and filling ink cartridges. Most of her business comes from printing exams for private schools. Due to the increased number of schools, business is doing well, and Lucy has requested a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to buy another printing machine. She would like to relocate to another part of the city, to be closer to her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase another printer

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is married and has two children. She operates a cyber café in the town center of Nairobi. Her target market is walk-in clients and students. Before she started this business, Charity sold clothes in a market on the outskirts of Nairobi. Due to declining demand for clothes, she decided to open a cyber café in April of this year. The cyber-business has been good, and she has requested a loan of Ksh. 20,000 to redo the cabling and wiring in order to improve the ambiance of her business. With increased traffic, she hopes to relocate her business from the third floor to the more accessible ground floor.

loans.use: Improve wiring/cabling

loans.name: Irma Esther

texts.en:
Irma sells undergarments and also works as a teacher in the small town of Masisea, located along the shores of the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  In this photo, Irma appears with her little daughter, Daniela, showing the few pieces of clothing that remain after a recent period of good sales.  Irma is twenty-five years old and is a single mother.  She works hard for the sake of her young daughter.  

Irma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about five years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  Irma invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in the business of selling beauty products.  This business partially financed her university studies. She plans to use this loan of 2500 soles to purchase undergarments and basic grocery products to sell in Masisea, where she works. Irma spends most of her time in Masisea but returns to Pucallpa at the end of every month to collect her teacher's salary.  

Irma's goal is to design undergarments and to have her own boutique from which to sell them.  She is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos because the organization gives loans without much bureaucracy and paperwork, unlike most other banks.

loans.use: Fabric and sewing notions for making undergarments; basic grocery goods to sell

loans.name: El Valle (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal el Valle esta conformado por un grupo de 9 personas, esta ubicado en la  parroquia del Valle a treinta minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, sus socias se dedican al comercio y la agricultura,  la mayor parte se dedica al cultivo de las tierras y una parte de la población a emigrado por la falta de empleo y para dar un futuro mejor a sus familias.Por ejemplo citamos a unas de las socias las cuales cumplen diferentes actividades como: 

María vive en el Valle comunidad Paraíso Bajo, es soltera tiene 4 hijos de 24, 22, 19 y 4  años de edad, los tres primeros hijos ya no viven con ella ya que cada uno tiene su propia familia, ella sola ha podido sacar  adelante a su hogar trabajando en diferentes actividades, vive en una  casa arrendada en el sector. Trabaja como empleada domestica en la ciudad de 9 AM a 1 PM, en casa por la tarde se dedica al cultivo de sus tierras y crianza de animales (chancho, pollos, cuyes), en el desarrollo de sus labores no ha tenido dificultad ni con sus jefes ni con sus vecinos, más bien se lleva con todos ya que es una mujer muy agraciada.

Tiene 5 años siendo socia y esta muy agradecida con  la FUNDACION ESPOIR ya que le ha brindado mucha ayuda con los prestamos que le ofrecen, nos cuenta que el grupo es muy unido y se llevan muy bien entre todos, tratan cada vez de integrar a más mujeres para que se beneficien de los créditos.
  
María es socia de la Fundación ya muchos años, el préstamo que hoy solicita lo invertirá  comprando mas chanchos, cuyes y el alimento (chanca y hierva) para la crianza de los animales, su meta seguir trabajando para llegar a tener una casa propia.

Zoila vive en la ciudadela Jaime Roldós ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, es soltera tiene 22 años vive con sus padres, ellos viven en una casa propia, los estudios los realizo en una academia de belleza, llegando a cursar  hasta el segundo año y tiene en planes la culminación de  sus estudios. 

Trabaja en el mercado 27 de febrero comercializando frutas y verduras, Su negocio es propio y lleva trabajando 13 años, el horario de trabajo es de 7 am a 7 pm todos los días y trabaja conjuntamente con su hermana.

Viendo los beneficios de los préstamos otorgados y la facilidad de entrega y pago de los créditos pasó a ser parte de la FUNDACION ESPOIR, su prima Maria Z. que también es socia la invitó, nos cuenta que es su primer crédito y espera seguir integrada por mucho tiempo ya que el grupo es muy unido y solidario.

Zoila solicitó el préstamo y lo invertirá para ampliar su negocio comprando más frutas, verduras y productos que le hacen falta y así poder tener un gran surtido y variedad  para mantener a su clientela.

Esta comprometida a pagar puntualmente y no quedar mal con su banco comunal, su sueño es poder terminar sus estudios y ampliar mucho  más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Valle Community Bank is comprised of nine people. It is located in the Valle parish, which is 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. Its members work in sales and agriculture. Most of them are farmers. Part of the population has emigrated due to lack of employment and the desire to give their families a better future. For example, we mention a few of the members who are involved in different activities. María lives in the Paraíso Bajo commity of the Valle. She is single. She has four children ages 24, 22, 19, and 4. The first three children do not live with her; they have their own families. By herself she has been able to get ahead with her home by working at different activities. She lives in a rented house in the sector. She works as a domestic employee in the city from 9 a.m. until 1 p.m. At home in the afternoon, she works at cultivating her land and raising animals (pigs, chickens, guinea pigs). In the development of her work she has had no problems with her bosses or her neighbors. She gets along well with everyone, and she is a woman who is very blessed. She has been a member for five years. She is very grateful to the Fundación ESPOIR because they have given her a lot of help with the loans they offer. She says the group is very united and they all get along very well. Each time they try to integrate more women to benefit from the loans. María has been a member of the Fundación for many years. The loan she is now asking for is to buy more pigs, guinea pigs, and food (small shrubs and grass) for taking care of the animals. Her goal is to keep working to be able to have her own house. Zoila lives in the Jaime Roldós residential area, which is located in the city of Cuenca. She is 22, single, and she lives with her parents. They live in their own home. She studied in a beauty academy until the second year. She plans to complete those studies. She works in the 27 de Febrero market selling fruits and vegetables. The business is her own, and she has been working for 13 years. Her work schedule is from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. Her sister works with her. She became part of the Fundación ESPOIR because she saw the benefits of the loans given and the ease of getting and repaying them. Her cousin, Maria Z., who is also a member, invited her. This is her first loan, and she expects to continue as a member for a long time because her group is very united and supportive. Zoila will use the loan to expand her business by buying more fruit, vegetables, and products that she needs. That way she will be able to have a large stock and a variety to keep her customers. She promises to make her payments punctually and not adversely affect her community bank. Her dream is to be able to finish her studies and to greatly expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more animals (pigs, guinea pigs), food for them, vegetables and fruits to expand their businesses

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 21-year-old father of one, living and operating his music and movie store as well as a fruit and vegetable stand in the Mukuru slums. He also works as a pastor in a local church. He is asking for a loan of Ks. 20,000 to add to his inventory of music and movie CDs. He hopes that he will raise a successful family and offer quality education to his children. He describes himself as hard-working and also a leader.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Increase stock of music and movie CDs

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is a 26-year-old mother of two children, aged 6 and 2 years. She lives and operates a salon in the Mukuru slums.  She was previously employed as a hairdresser until she started her own salon 3 years ago. She is asking for a first loan of Ksh.20,000 to purchase more business assets like blow dryers and also add stock. She hopes to start a hairdressing school one day and become a supplier of cosmetics. She describes herself as hard-working, ambitious, and aggressive as a businesswoman.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more business assets and add stock

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua is a 37-year-old father of 3 who lives and operates his carpentry and woodworking business in the Mukuru slums. He was previously employed as a carpenter until he started his own carpentry business 9 years ago. Mutua has requested his first loan of Ksh.10,000  to add stock of timber and other raw materials. He hopes to start a training school and buy a home. He describes himself as hardorking, focused and an aggressive businessman.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of timber and other raw materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 38-year-old mother of 3 who lives and operates her boutique in the Mukuru slums. She  was previously employed in a sewing company until she started her own boutique 3 years ago. She has requested a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to add stock of ready-made clothes so that customers may have a variety. She hopes that one day she will buy a home, become an importer, and ensure that her children get quality education. She describes herself as focused and hard-working.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of ready-made clothes

loans.name: Nelida Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora NELIDA YESENIA S. M., tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de contabilidad, ejerció durante 8 años, pero al casarse se dedicó a su hogar y a estudiar la carrera técnica de costura, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 5 años quines depende económicamente de ella, porque aun se encuentran en el colegio.
NELIDA se dedica a la confeccion, venta y alquiler de disfraces en su domicilio.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertio en la compra telas, hilos, broches, cierres, sombreros, etc para elaborar sus disfraces.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas materiales para la elaboración de sus disfraces
texts.en:
Nelida Yesenia Sánchez M. is 41 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to Las Delicias II community bank. This entrepreneur completed 8 years of accounting college but after getting married decided to dedicate herself to her home and to studying dressmaking and tailoring. She has 2 children, ages 5 and 14, who are still in school and dependent on her. Nelida is a seamstress; she sells and rents costumes from her home. She used a loan of 300 PEN to buy cloth, thread, clasps, zippers, hats, etc. for producing costumes. This loan of 500 PEN will be used to buy more materials for making costumes.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make costumes.

loans.name: Maria Giovana

texts.es:
La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Siglo XXI”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios superiores (profesora de Educación primaria), vive en Barrio San Juan.

Este es su primer crédito, ella es socia nueva del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  para aumentar el capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir  para niños y artículos de librería. Con este dinero podrá comprar más artículos para tener en stock.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y así  seguir creciendo.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria belongs to the community bank “Mujeres del Siglo XXI” (Women of the 21st Century), which is located in the Juli district, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 38 years old, has a live-in partner, is the mother of two children, and has higher education (as a primary school teacher). She lives in the Barrio San Juan.

This is her first loan. She is a new member of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos and needs a loan of 500 new soles in order to add to the capital of her business. She is engaged in the sale of children’s clothing and book store goods. With this money she will be able to buy more goods to have in stock.

Her wish is to keep working and thus pursue increasing income. She likes the terms of the loans

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of children's clothing and book store goods

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a newly married 27-year-old who lives and operates his water supply business in the Mukuru slums. He has requested a first loan of Ksh.20,000 to start another business in a new location. He previously worked as a household helper until he started his own business 3 years ago. He hopes to diversify into wholesale and retail business one day and also mentor his children into business. He describes himself as sociable, hard-working, self-respecting, and having high self-esteem.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start another business in a new location

loans.name: Maria Demetria

texts.es:
La señora MARIA DEMETRIA, tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3º de primaria porque vivía en el campo, desde niña se dedicó a trabajar. 
MARIA  se dedica a la venta de desayunos, menús y cenas en Trujillo.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles empezó a vender cebiche, para a la huancaína, papa rellena, en su domicilio.
Este crédito de 800 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, menestras, fideos, harinas, etc para la preparación de sus menús.
MARIA suena con construir su vivencia y tener allí mismo su restaurante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Demetria is 54 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to the Sea and Sky II (Mar y Cielo II) Bank. The businesswoman has studied up till the third year of primary school because she lived in the country. Since she was a child, she has been working. Maria sells breakfast, set menus, and dinners in Trujillo. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she started selling ceviche (marinated fish), Huancaina-style potatoes, and stuffed potatoes in her home. This loan of 800 nuevos soles will be invested in the purchase of food products, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, vegetable stews, noodles, flour, etc., to make her set menus. Maria dreams of building her house and having a restaurant there.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, vegetable stews, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add to his inventory

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 29-year-old father of one. He lives and operates his retail business in the Mukuru slums. He has requested a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to add to his inventory of rice, flour, sugar, cooking fat, and sodas. He hopes to educate his children in good schools and leave a slum house for a good house. He describes himself as hard-working and a fast decision maker.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: add to his inventory

loans.name: Erica Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora ERICA CECILIA S. N.   tiene 26  años de edad, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 2hijos de 3 años y 7 meses de edad , quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Se dedica a la producción y venta de calzado .
Los fabrica en su domicilio y sale a venderlos de forma ambulatoria en la compañía de su esposo en el centro de Trujillo pero también tiene una vitrina en su casa  en donde los coloca en exhibición y los vende a sus vecinos .
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro materiales para fabricar zapatos como plantillas, cuero, terocal,cuerina,etc
Este crédito de 1000  lo invertirá en la compra de productos cuero, hormas, zuelas, etc
ERICA  suena con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo y vender su calzado.
texts.en:
Erica Cecilia S. Narváez is 26 years old and lives in the district of Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru.
She belongs to the Mar y Cielo II Bank.
This entrepreneur studied until the fifth year of secondary school. She has two dependent children aged three years and seven months old.
She makes and sells shoes.
She makes them in her home and goes out to sell them in the centre of Trujillo with her husband. She also displays some in her home and sells them to her neighbours.
With her first 300 PEN loan, she purchased materials to make shoes, like insoles, leather, glue, imitation leather, etc.
She will use this 1000 PEN loan to purchase leather, shoetrees, shoe soles etc.
Erica dreams of renting a stand in a Trujillo shopping centre to sell her shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, shoetrees, shoe soles, etc.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 29-year-old father of one who runs a printing and graphic design business. He has repaid three other loans successfully and is now asking for a fourth loan of Ksh. 60,000 to purchase additional computers and printers. He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper and get him and his family a better life. He describes himself as mentally smart, determined, funny and industrious.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy additional computers and printers

loans.name: Elena Julia

texts.es:
La señora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 55 años de edad, estado civil Viuda, es madre de 04 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (transición), vive en el Barrio Vallecito  Av. Alto Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  para la compra productos para su puesto de ventas de artículos diversos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de detergentes, betunes, cepillos, pasta de dientes, cinta de embalaje, lapiceros, bolsas, papel higiénico, etc. Para venderlos en su puesto del mercado.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los préstamos y las facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the 3 de Mayo II Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is a 55 year old widow, and she has four children. She did not complete elementary school (transition). She lives in the Barrio Vallecito Av. Alto Alianza. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years. With her first loan for 300 PEN, she bought products for her stall where she sells different things. She now needs a loan for 2,500 PEN to buy detergent, shoe polish, brushes, tooth paste, packing tape, pens, bags, and toilet paper, etc. She will sell these items from her stall in the market. Her wish is to keep working and to build her house. She likes the loans and the ease of making payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy detergent, shoe polish, brushes, tooth paste, packing tape, pens, bags, and toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Diana Kelly

texts.es:
La señora DIANA KELLY A. C. vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to secundaria , tiene 1 hijo de 2 años quien depende económicamente de ella.
DIANA se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa y también algunos fines de semana vende en el mercado mayorista.
Con su primer crédito de 300 compró frutas y verduras al por mayor y las vendió en su casa y en el mercado mayorista.
El crédito de 500 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios, más frutas y verduras y también en productos alimenticios como arroz, tallarines, papas, utensilios de utensilios y mesas para poder vender platos típicos de la zona elaborados por ella como: tallarín con papa y en las noches salchipapa y salchipollo.
 DIANA, sueña con tener una tienda de productos alimenticios en su casa.
texts.en:
Diana Kelly A. C. lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mar and Cielo II Community Bank. This entrepreneur attended high school up to the fifth year. She has a two year old child who is economically dependent upon her. Diana sells fruit and vegetables in her home. Also, on some week ends she sells in the wholesale market. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bough fruit and vegetables wholesale and sold them in her house and at the wholesale market. The loan for 500 will be used to buy food products, more fruit, and vegetables. She will also buy food products like rice, noodles, potatoes, utensils, and tables to be able to sell dishes that are typical to her region such as noodles with potato. In the evenings she will sell meat and potatoes (salchipapa) and chicken and potatoes (salchipollo). Diana dreams of having a food store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products:  fruit and vegetables, also rice, potatoes, noodles, utensils, and tables

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 38-year-old father of four who sells second-hand clothes on the streets of Nairobi. He has repaid three other loans successfully and is now requesting a fourth loan of Ksh. 50,000 to buy additional trousers for his inventory. He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper and enable him to educate his children. He describes himself as jovial and diligent.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: add to his inventory

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a newly married 28-year-old who operates his tailoring and design business in Nairobi. He has requested his first loan of Ksh. 25,000 to buy more materials. He was previously employed until he began his current business one year ago.   He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper and enable him go back to school, save money, educate and invest for his children. He describes himself as diligent, serious and focused.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: buy more materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 26-year-old who operates a tailoring and design business. He has requested a first loan of Ksh. 25,000 to buy an additional sewing machine and add to his stock of materials. He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper, marry, buy a house and become a designer. He describes himself as God-fearing, diligent, and kind.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy an additional sewing machine and add to his stock of materials

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Siglo XXI”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 17 años de edad, estado civil soltera, sin hijos y tiene estudios superiores de técnico en enfermería, vive en Barrio San Juan de Bellavista.

Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual pudo comprar crochet, tijeras, bayetas, lanas de diferentes colores, para a elaborar  sus bordados en bayeta y ponerlos en venta. 

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para así poder ayudarse en sus estudios.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Rosemery belongs to the Mujeres del Siglo XXI Community Bank, which is located in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 17, single, and she does not have children. She is studying to be a nursing technician. She lives in the San Juan de Bellavista neighborhood. She started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos with an initial loan for 300 PEN. She bought crochet items such as scissors, cloth, and different colors of wool to make her embroideries and put them up for sale. Her wish is to keep working to be able to pay for her studies. She likes the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crochet items such as scissors, cloth, and different colors of wool

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old mother of four who operates her business in Nairobi. She has requested a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to enable her to introduce a M-pesa (money transfer) business to her already existing computer and photocopy services. She worked for Telkom Kenya until two years ago when she began her current business. She hopes to be a stationery supplier one day and to own a good family house and educate her children. She describes herself as diligent, jovial, loving, cheerful and funny.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Introduce M-pesa (Money transfer) business to her established business

loans.name: Hilaria Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora HILARIA VICENTA Z. R., tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 2º de primaria porque vivía en la sierra en el pueblo de Calipuy a donde no llegaban los profesores. Tiene 5 hijos de 23, 21, 18, 15 y 11, solo los dos últimos dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran estudiando. 
HILARIA  se dedica a la venta de menús y cerveza en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro productos alimenticios y utensilios para preparar sus menús.
Este crédito de 1200 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, menestras, fideos, harinas, etc para la preparación de sus menús; también comprará mesas y sillas.  Parte del dinero lo utilizará para remodelar de su local. 
HILARIA suena con ampliar su local y ambientarlo; para alquilarlo a eventos como: matrimonio, bautizos, etc.
texts.en:
Hilaria Vicenta Z. R. is 52 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She is the mother of five children aged 23, 21, 18, 15 and 11. Only the two youngest are in her care as they are still going to school. Hilaria, for her part, studied only until second grade because she lived in the village of Calipuy up in the mountains, where no teachers came.

Hilaria sells meals and beer at her home.

She is a member of the Communal Bank "Mar y Cielo II" (Sea and Sky II). She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy ingredients and utensils to prepare her dishes. This loan of 1200 nuevos soles will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to her meals, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, vegetables, noodles and flour. Furthermore, she will buy tables and chairs. Part of her loan will be used to remodel her premises. Hilaria dreams of expanding her restaurant and making it more attractive, so that she can have wedding, baptism and similar parties.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals; to buy tables and chairs; to remodel her restaurant.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La señora Rita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla de oro II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Urb. Villa Florida.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 años, inició en otro Banco Comunal, descansó 3 años y en el actual esta 2 años como socia.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  dinero que utilizó para implementar el taller de soldadura de su esposo ya que los dos trabajan. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de soldaduras para el taller.  Lo dirigen sus empleados, ya que los dos trabajan en la Universidad Nacional del Altiplano.
La señora Rita también tiene un kiosco de venta de repuestos que abre solo en vacaciones y a veces los domingos.

Su deseo es construir su casa ya que cuenta con terreno propio y luego darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones dice que es una forma de relajarse ya que comparte sus experiencias diarias.
texts.en:
Rita belongs to the Medalla de Oro II Communal Bank which is located in the Villa Florida neighborhood, of the Puno District, in the Puno Province. She is 31 years old, a common-law wife, mother of two children and has completed secondary studies. Rita has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for eight years but started at a different Communal Bank and then took 3 years off. She is currently a member of two years. Her initial loan was for 300 nuevos soles, money that she used to set up her husband's welding workshop since they both work. Now she needs a loan of 500 nuevos soles for purchasing solder for the workshop. Rita also has a kiosk where she sells spare parts which she only opens during vacations or sometimes on Sundays. Her hope is to build her own house since she has her own land, and to later provide her children with careers. Rita likes meetings because she says that it's a way to relax since she gets to share her daily experiences.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing solder

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La señora LUZ MARIA F. D. A., tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6º D. primaria, ya que tuvo que trabajar desD. pequeña, tiene 5 hijos (D. 28, 25, 24, 18 y 16 años), los dos ultimos se encuentran estudiando y depenD. económicamente D. ella.
LUZ MARIA se dedica a la venta D. menus (alimentos) y cerveza en su casa, pero actualmente prepara 20 menus que los reparte a los trabajadores D. una empresa D. transportes.
Este crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertira en la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. sus alimenticios como: papa, arroz, azucar, menestras, fideos, etc.
LUZ MARIA sueña con tener su restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Luz María F. D. A. is 55 years old and lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She is the mother of five children aged 28, 25, 24, 18 and 16. She cares for the two youngest of them who are students. Luz María, for her part, studied until sixth graD. because she was forced to work from a young age on.

Luz María sells meals and beer at her home. She cooks 20 meals a day and sells them to the workers of a haulage contractor.
