She is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Delicias II" (The Delights II). This loan of 300 nuevos soles will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to her meals, such as potatoes, rice, sugar, vegetables and noodles. Luz María dreams of having a restaurant at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 30-year-old father of one who lives and operates his retail kiosk in Nairobi. He has requested his second loan of Ksh. 20,000  to enable him to add stock to his business. He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper and buy a house. He describes himself as diligent, good, and innovative.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Gina Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora GINA ELIZABETH R. M., tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria.
GINA se dedica a la crianza de animales menores: patos, pollos, gallinas, gallos, para venderlos en el mercado de Moche.
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para animales.  También comprará mas animales.
GINA  sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus animales y vender con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Gina Elizabeth Rodríguez M. is 23, and she lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of Las Delicias II Community Bank. This entrepreneur attended high school up until her fifth year. Gina raises small livestock like ducks, chickens, hens, and roosters to sell in the Moche market. She will use this loan for 300 PEN to buy food for the animals. She will also buy more animals. Gina dreams of increasing the number of animals she is raising and of selling more frequently.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for animals and buy more animals

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: A sus 58 años de edad, Amadeo se mantiene muy vigoroso y sano, es casado y padre de 8 hijos, de los cuales, todos de ellos ya tiene su propia familia y viven fuera. Él se quedó en la compañía de su esposa, viviendo en su casa propia del pueblo. Su siembra favorita son las hortalizas como las zanahorias y las espinacas, asimismo en sus chacras temporales siembran papas y arvejas; pero de todas sus cultivos, lo que mayor rentabilidad le genera son las espinacas y las zanahorias, ya que las cosecha son cada tres a cuatro meses. Por ello, Amadeo alegremente riega por las noches, sin importarle el frió ni el cansancio, puesto que gracias a su esfuerzo sus espinacas le son muy rentables, y más aun en los meses de enero a marzo, que llega a vender cada canasta entre 60 y 80 soles, mientras que el precio de la zanahorias no tienen un precio fijo, pero igualmente le deja buenos dividendos. Amadeo está muy contento de ser un hombre de campo y se siente muy orgulloso de dedicarse a sus siembras, y con el apoyo valioso de su esposa pudieron educar y mantener a sus hijos hasta hacerlos hombres de bien, que es su mayor satisfacción en vida. Este es su Q. crédito con MFP y durante estos ciclos viene trabajando responsablemente con su banco comunal, al no piensa fallarle por la confianza depositada. Asimismo, trata de colaborar en todas las actividades de grupo, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades, en gratitud a ello. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus chacras de hortalizas y también para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Amadeo is a very vigorous and healthy 58 year old. He is married and has eight children. The children all have their own families, and they do not live with him. He lives with his wife in their own house in town. His favorite plantings are crops like carrots and spinach. In his seasonal fields they plant potatoes and peas. But, of all of his crops, spinach and carrots are the most profitable because they are harvested every three to four months. To do so, Amadeo happily waters at night without minding the cold or how tired he is. Thanks to his effort, his spinach is very profitable and even more so from January to March. He sells each basket for between 60 and 80 PEN. The carrots do not have a fixed price, but they also bring good dividends. Amadeo is very happy to be a farmer. He feels very proud to devote himself to his crops. With the valiant support of his wife, they were able to educate and support their children until they became successful. This is his greatest satisfaction in life. This is his fifth loan with MFP. During these loan cycles he has been working responsibly with his Community Bank. He does not intend to fail the trust that has been given to him. He tries to collaborate in all of the group activities because he is grateful for the opportunities given to him. The money he is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizes to fertilize his vegetable and potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino tiene 50 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive con la madre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales la mayor falleció enferma de cáncer y ahora vive con los 4 menores en su casa propia. Después de la muerte de su hija tuvo un accidente donde se fracturó su pie derecho y algunos  meses requirió del apoyo de muletas, tiempo donde se sentía impotente de no poder ayudar a su familia en las labores agrícolas. Pero ahora, ya se ha recuperado y ha vuelto a sembrar lechugas, y espinacas en sus chacras de regadío, y papas en las chacras que tiene en zonas altas, donde caminado rápido, llega en 2 horas, por lo que en temporada de cosecha el traslado de los productos es muy dificultoso. Faustino está muy contento de dedicarse a sus propios cultivos y además le son muy rentables, pues con esas ganancias podía cubrir los medicamentos costosos del tratamiento de su hija en vida. Él nos comenta que son las espinacas el producto que le genera mejores ganancias en menor tiempo, permitiéndole así, recuperar su dinero rápidamente. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y durante estos ciclos ha liderado en la responsabilidad, ya que es el presidente de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus diversos cultivos, también comprará funguicidas para erradicar las mosquitas.
texts.en:
Faustino is 50 years old, is a very responsible and hard-working man, and lives with the mother of his 5 children, of whom the oldest passed away from cancer and now the 4 younger children are living in their own house. After the death of his daughter, he had an accident, in which he fractured his right foot, and for a few months, he needed to use crutches. During this time, he felt impotent because he couldn’t help his family in their agricultural work. Now, however, he has recovered and has returned to growing lettuce and spinach in his irrigated fields and potatoes in the high-altitude fields, where, walking quickly, he can arrive in 2 hours. Because of this, in the harvest season, transporting the products is very difficult. Faustino is very happy to dedicate himself to his own crops and, moreover, they are very profitable. With these earnings, he was able to cover the medical costs for the treatment of his daughter. He told us that spinach is the product that generates the highest earnings in the least time. Because of this, he can recover his money quickly. This is his fifth loan with MFP and during these cycles, he has led responsibly, since he is the president of his community bank. The money that he is now requesting is to buy chemical fertilizers to improve his various crops. He will also buy pesticides to eliminate the pests.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy responsable, vive con el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, los 2 mayores viven en Lima y los menores vive en junto a ella en su casa propia (de la que aun no cuenta con su titulo de propiedad). Su siembra mayoritaria es la papa, por ser muy rentable, pero también muy costosa, debido a la inversión de fertilizantes químicos, por ello le dedica todo su tiempo. Cuando está en sus chacras primero contempla minuciosamente sus plantas con la finalidad de detectar los males que pudieran acechar a sus cultivos y de ese modo tratar de contrarrestar en su debido momento con los funguicidas. Sus productos los comercializa en el mercado más grande y concurrido de la ciudad de Tarma denominado “El Mayorista”. La mayoría de sus ventas le han dejado muy buenas ganancias, con las que vienen educando a sus hijos y solventando los gastos familiares. Francisca trabaja armoniosamente con su esposo y eso logra que no sienta cansancio. Ella está muy contenta con MFP, este es su quinto crédito y durante los 4 periodos anteriores demostró ser una cliente muy responsable, asimismo muy entregada a las responsabilidades de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 41 years old, is a very responsible woman, and lives with the father of her 6 children, of whom the 2 oldest live in Lima and the younger ones live with her in her own house (for which she doesn’t have the deed). The majority of her harvest is the potato because it is very profitable, but it is also very costly because she has to invest in chemical fertilizers. As a result, it takes up all of her time. When she is in her fields, she first thoroughly considers her plants with the goal of detecting the problems that could affect her crops. She tries to resist the problems by using pesticides. She sells her products in a very large and busy market in the city of Tarma called “The Wholesale” (“El Mayorista”). Most of her sales leave her with very good earnings, with which she educates her children and takes care of the family’s expenses. Francisca works well with her husband and does not get tired of it. She is very happy with MFP; this is her fifth loan and during the 4 previous cycles, she showed that she is a very responsible client. She is also very involved in the responsibilities of her community bank, to which she is very thankful. She plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Alianza .
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de maíz y fideos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de una maquina tostadora para el tostado de maíz, fideo, trigo, arroz  que luego los vende el los mercados de Puno.

Su deseo es seguir continuar con su trabajo y construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the “3 de Mayo II” communal bank, which is located in the Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 40 years old, married, the mother of 5 children, and she completed high school studies. She lives in the Barrio Alto Alianza neighborhood. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. She had an initial loan of 300 PEN, which she used to buy corn and noodles. At this time, she needs a loan of 1,100 PEN to purchase a machine for toasting corn, noodles, wheat, and rice, which she sells in the markets in Puno. She hopes to continue with her work and to build her house. She likes the savings and the punctuality at the group meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a toasting machine for toasting corn

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 53 años, es un hombre muy noble y muy trabajador, vive con Lucía, su pareja, por muchos años, pero no tienen hijos. Actualmente viven en su casa de chacra, mientras que la casa que tiene en su pueblo la arriendan. En sus años de juventud se dedicaba a la artesanía, tejía hermosas frazadas y mantas de lana, pero desde que inició una vida marital se ha inclinado rotundamente a la siembra y cultivo de papas y arvejas. Juan está muy contento de sus siembras, ya que le han resultado ser muy rentables en comparación con sus artesanías. Por ello, las veces que tiene que cultivar, acude a sus terrenos muy temprano por la mañana en compañía de su esposa. Para esta pareja, no hay nada más placentero que labrar y cultivar sus tierras. Lamentablemente, en algunas oportunidades, durante los meses de junio a agosto la helada (clima muy frío) ha perjudicado su chacra de papas, por ello últimamente está sembrando alternadamente con arveja, para de ese modo no perder  la inversión de su dinero. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos pasados ha pagado puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir trabajando en su banco comunal y con el resto de los integrantes, a quienes ha llegado a tener mucha confianza y cariño. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y funguicidas, con los que abonará y fumigará sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Juan, 53, is a very noble and hardworking man. He has lived with his life partner, Lucía, for many years. They do not have children. They currently live in the house on their farm, while they rent out their house in town. In his youth he devoted himself to handicrafts. He wove beautiful blankets and wool ponchos. But, since he started married life he has leaned entirely towards planting and cultivating potatoes and peas. Juan is very happy with his crops. They have turned out to be very profitable compared to his handicrafts. When he has to cultivate, he goes to his fields very early in the morning accompanied by his wife. To this couple, there is nothing more pleasant than working and cultivating their land. Unfortunately, sometimes during the months from June to August the cold climate has hurt his potato crops. He is, therefore, alternating his planting with peas in order to not lose his monetary investment. This is his fifth loan with MFP. In past loan cycles he has made every one of his payments punctually. He wants to keep working with his Community Bank and with the rest of the members. He has come to have a lot of confidence and affection for the other members. The money he is asking for is to buy fertilizers and fungicides. He will use them to fertilize and fumigate his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Severino

texts.es: Severino tiene 60 años, es casado y padre de 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos viven fuera y el de 14 años vive con él en la casa de su cuñada. El labrado de la tierra y el cuidado de sus cultivos es la actividad que lo llena de mucha satisfacción, por más de 40 años viene dedicándose íntegramente en lograr buenas cosechas, cuyos frutos envía directamente al mercado principal de la ciudad de Tarma, denominado “El Mayorista”. Él vende cada saco de 60 kilos en 70 ú 80 soles y este precio ha sido muy alentador, generándoles muy buenas ganancias, las cuales lo motivan a seguir trabajando. Severina cuenta con valioso apoyo de su esposa después del medio día, pero en los días de cosecha esta pareja trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana de igual a igual, ya que tienen anhelos de comprar la casa donde viven, por ello se han propuesto en trabajar arduamente hasta conseguirlo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que renueva su compromisos de pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas para seguir trabajando con créditos posteriormente junto al resto de los integrantes de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio y estima. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Severino is 60 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. Of his children, 3 live away from home, while his 14-year-old lives with Severino in his sister-in-law's house. Working the land and cultivating crops is Severino's life's work, and it fills him with great satisfaction. For more than 40 years he has worked entirely on achieving good harvests, sending his fruits directly to the main market in the city of Tarma, which is called "El Mayorista". He sells each 60 kilo sack of fruit for 70 or 80 soles. This price has been very encouraging to him, generating very good earnings, which motivate him to continue working. Severino relies on his wife's valuable help in the afternoons, but during harvest time the two of them work side by side from 7 in the morning onward. They are eager to buy the house in which they live, and are resolved to work arduously until they can do so. This is Severino's fifth loan with MFP, for which he has renewed his commitments to make each of his payments on time, so that he, together with the other members of his communal bank, may continue to rely on the loans to assist them in their work. He has much gratitude and great respect for his communal bank. He intends to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Doris Luz

texts.es:
Doris es una madre soltera de 47 años de edad que vive en el caserío La Zaranda, ubicado en el distrito de Pítipo, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella vive con su hijo de 8 años de edad y posee un pequeño negocio de librería en su domicilio, donde vende artículos escolares, este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso económico de su hogar y es de mucha ayuda a su comunidad debido a que se encuentra ubicado frente al único colegio de su caserío.

Doris está solicitando un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de útiles escolares y libros requeridos por los estudiantes de la zona y así seguir apoyando a las familias de su comunidad.

Ella ha manejado este negocio por más de tres años y es considerada como una excelente cliente de nuestra institución debido a que se le ha atendido con tres créditos, los cuales los ha cancelado puntualmente. 

Su más grande anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio poniendo mas librerías en los caseríos aledaños y así reunir los recursos suficientes que posibiliten una educación de calidad para su hijo.
texts.en:
Doris is a 47 year-old single mother who lives in the town of La Zaranda, located in the district of Pítipo, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Doris lives with her 8 year-old son and she has a small bookstore in her house, where she sells school supplies. This business is the only source of income for her household and it is also very helpful to her community because it is located in front of the only school in the town. Doris is requesting a loan of 2,500 PEN that she plans to use to buy school supplies and books needed by the students in the neighborhood and thereby continue helping the families of her community. She has had this business for more than three years and is considered an excellent client in our institution because she has had three loans and she repaid them punctually. Her greatest dream is to grow her business by opening more bookstores in nearby towns. That way she could have enough income to make it possible for her son to have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and books

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: Ubaldina cuenta con 37 años de vida, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo Faire de 10 años y con su anciana madre, en la casa de esta última. La madre de Ubaldina es propietaria de varias extensiones de tierras, de las cuales, algunas siembra ella y la otra parte, su hermano. Para ello, Ubaldina madruga diariamente a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos para su propio almuerzo y para el de su hijo cuando regresa del colegio.  Esta labor la realiza desde hace muchos años atrás y la llena de mucha satisfacción, sobre todo las veces que comercializa sus productos en el mercado de mayoristas (el más importante de la ciudad de Tarma), donde acumula muy buenas  ganancias, con las que educa y mantiene a su hijo y a su madre. Ubaldina tiene sus anhelos puestos en su trabajo, para que cuando crezca su hijo, ella pueda incrementar sus cultivos hasta alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en los ciclos pasados pagó responsablemente sin dificultades, por ello ha pedido el incrementando de su préstamo con el consentimiento de los integrantes de su banco comunal, donde demostró mucha nobleza y seriedad. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Ulbaldina is 37 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her son, Faire, who is 10 years old, and with her elderly mother. They live in her mother’s house. Ulbaldina’s mother owns several pieces of land; Ubaldina farms some of them and her brother farms the others. She gets up very early each day, at 4:00 in the morning, to prepare her own lunch and her son’s for when he returns from school. She has done been farming for many years and it fills her with satisfaction, especially when she sells her products in the wholesale market (the most important one in the city of Tarma). She makes good income there, which she uses to take care of her son and her mother. Ubaldina has her dreams pinned on her work, so that when her son is grown she can increase her crops until she can achieve a higher standard of living. This is her fifth loan with MFP. In the previous cycles she has paid responsibly and without difficulties. Because of this, she has requested an increase in her loan amount, with the consent of the other members of her communal bank, where she has demonstrated seriousness. The money she is requested is to buy chemical fertilizers for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has owned and run a small retail kiosk for the past two years. A 23-year-old man, David has requested his second loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to buy stocks of sugar, wheat and maize flour. He has successfully repaid one loan of Ksh.20,000 and he hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him start a wholesale business. One day, David wants to buy a plot of land and build his own rental houses. David describes himself as jovial, faithful and sociable.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: add to his inventory

loans.name: Jecinter

texts.en:
Jecinter has owned and run a tailoring business for the past 13 years. A 33-year-old single mother of one, Jecinter has requested her second loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to buy stocks of materials. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to pay school fees for her daughter. One day, Jecinter wants to buy a plot of land and build her own home. Jecinter describes herself as jovial, frank, and friendly.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to her stocks of materials

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has owned and run a small milk distribution business for the past two years. A 30-year-old man, Patrick has requested his third loan of Ksh. 30,000 after successfully repaying two loans of Ksh. 10,000 and Ksh.20,000, in order to add stocks of milk. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to grow his milk business. One day, Patrick wants to get married and raise a strong family. Patrick describes himself as jovial, friendly and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has owned and run a small avocado distribution business for the past three years. A 28-year-old mother of two, she was previously a housewife. Esther has requested her second loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy stocks of avocados. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to buy a small lorry for transporting avocados. One day, Esther wants to buy a plot of land and build rental houses in Nairobi. Esther describes herself as friendly, self confident and positive.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: add to her inventory

loans.name: Verfalia Hilaria

texts.es: Verfalia Hilaria I. tiene es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que asisten a una escuela pública y reciben estudios con mucho esfuerzo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Su negocio está ubicado en las afueras del mercado, en donde circulan un sin números de clientes, por lo que no tiene el suficiente capital para poseer un tramo en el que pueda estar mejor establecida y le ofrezca a sus clientes mayor comodidad además Verfalia tiene que recibir el sol todos los días, pero trata de utilizar los medios necesarios para salir adelante sin que este inconveniente la afecte. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de prensa pelos, ropa interior, shampoo, cremas entre otros productos. Su deseo es de seguir luchando para mejorar la su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Verfalia Hilaria I. is a single mother. She cares for her two children, who attend a public school and receive their education with a lot of effort. She makes a living by selling general merchandise. Her business is located on the outskirts of the market, where a number of customers pass by. She doesn't have enough money to own a spot in the market where she can be better established and offer her customers more comfort. Verfalia also has to stay in the sun every day, but she tries to use the means necessary to get ahead so this inconvenience doesn't affect her. The financing she is requesting is for working capital so she can buy hair clips, underwear, shampoo, creams, and other products. Her dream is to keep fighting to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucrecia Margarita

texts.es:
Lucrecia Q. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica con mucho esmero a su negocio de venta de cosméticos en el departamento de león siendo ella el sustento de su hogar donde requiere llevar el pan diario.

Ella actualmente se ha visto en la necesidad inmediata de obtener los cosméticos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Q. is a very hard-working lady who takes a great deal of care in her business of selling cosmetics in the department of León. The maintenance of her home depends on her earnings. She now sees the immediate necessity to purchase cosmetics, and so she has turned to Ceprodel to apply for a loan to buy said products and continue to operate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Estanislada Petrona

texts.es: Estanislada Petrona R. tiene 50 años. Es una mujer soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que todavía depende de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que todos los días recorre el mercado para ofrecerles a sus, clientes sus productos, ella siempre lleva consigo una maleta en donde carga calzados, ropa, cremas, colonias y pinturas de uñas. Por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan sus productos y de una manera rápida y segura ella se los muestra. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la inversión de nuevos productos. Su mayor sueño es que su hijo finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Estanislada Petrona R. is fifty years old. A single woman, she has one boy in her care who still depends on her. Her business is the sale of general merchandise. Her site of business is mobile; every day she goes to the market to offer her products to her customers, and she always carries a suitcase full of footwear, clothes, creams, perfumes, and nail polish. Because of the way she conducts business, the majority of her customers request her products, and she displays them rapidly and with confidence. This business loan is for investment in new products. Her greatest dream is that her boy finishes his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
Santos Paula M. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas elaboradas por ella misma y ubicada en el departamento de León donde a diario ofrece las deliciosas tortillas las que son vendidas a sus clientes.

Ella requiere de la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz, la cal y la leña y para esto ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y así seguir vendiendo sus deliciosas tortillas en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Santos Paula M. is a very hard-working lady who sells tortillas that she makes. Her business is located in the department of León, where she sells the delicious tortillas daily to her customers. She needs to buy basic materials such as corn, lime, and firewood; therefore she has sought the help of Ceprodel to obtain this loan and continue selling her delicious tortillas in her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Djidé

texts.fr:
Djidé Cissé est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Depuis plus de 6 ans elle s'active dans la vente d'arachide afin de générer des produits financiers et aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille telles que la nourriture et la santé.
Elle demande ce prêt pour augmenter son stock et ameliorer sa productivité. Elle achète des arachides dans des fermes ou chez des grossistes pour revendre chaque semaine sur des marchés de fermiers.
texts.en:
Djidé Cissé, age 55, is married with 3 children. For 6 years she has been selling peanuts to earn extra money to help her family with family expenses, such as food and health care. She is requiring this loan to increase her capital base to improve her productivity. She purchases peanuts at farms or from wholesalers, to resell at weekly farmers' markets.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase peanuts

loans.name: Gloria Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Gloria U. se dedica a la venta de verduras en el departamento de León ofreciéndolas desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace nueve años y anteriormente trabajaba fuertemente en el campo por lo que se ha criado en un ambiente de trabajo fuerte. Su necesidad es la urgencia de comprar las verduras tales como plátanos, chayotes, yuca, entre otros y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y así mejorar su negocio ofreciendo las verduras a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria U. works in the Department of Leon selling vegetables from the very early morning hours until it gets dark. She's been doing this for nine years and before that she was working strenuously in the fields because she was brought up in an environment of hard work. She urgently needs to buy vegetables, such as plantain (bananas), chayotes (squash), and yuca (sweet potatoes) among other things. For that reason she has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan and thus improve her business offering vegetables to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Eddy Enrique

texts.es: Eddy Enrique D. P. tiene 40 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de materiales de construcción. A Eddy siempre le ha gustado el trabajo, este negocio lo obtuvo por su Papa ya que anteriormente era él quien se hacía cargo. Pero debido a su edad no pudo continuar y el enseño a Eddy a manejar el negocio, a él le gusta mucho esta humilde actividad porque es una buena manera de sacar a su hijo adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como cemento, arena, palas y otras herramientas para la elaboración de los bloques. Su deseo es obtener una maquinaria industrializada para facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Eddy Enrique D. P. is 40 years old. He produces and sells construction materials. Eddy has always enjoyed his work, a business that he took over from his father. Due to his age, Eddy’s father could not continue managing the business.

Eddy says his work is the best way for him to help his son get ahead. He will designate his loan as operating capital to buy raw materials such as cement, sand, shovels and other tools needed to make blocks. He hopes to obtain industrial machinery to facilitate his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Huinco Group

texts.es: Está conformado por diez integrantes, ellos residen en la comunidad rural de Huinco-provincia de Huarochirí, en este pequeño pueblo se encuentra la central hidroeléctrica de Huinco, que es la que provee agua potable a la ciudad de Lima. El grupo se dedica al comercio minorista, la mayoría de ellos empieza a trabajar desde temprana edad, sus negocios son: venta de bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, frutas, comidas, ropas, helados; que son la fuente de subsistencia para sus hogares. Sonia quien es la presidenta del grupo trabajó desde los doce años, ella ya no contó con el apoyo de su padre; porque falleció cuando tenía cinco años. Desde entonces empezó a trabajar con sus hermanos vendiendo papa rellena, gelatina, canchita. Sola tuvo que pagar sus estudios de colegio y de instituto de enfermera técnica, no pudo concluir su carrera por la carencia de dinero. Hoy a los veintiocho años de edad Sonia ha recibido su noveno préstamo en la entidad financiera EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, con éstos préstamos lo ha invertido en la compra de mercadería surtiendo así de a poquito su negocio, ella se dedica a vender gaseosas, paltas, chirimoyas, papa rellena, en una pequeña canasta ofreciendo su mercadería a los turistas, a los carros que se estacionan allí por unos minutos para continuar su recorrido a los pueblos de las alturas (sierra del Perú). Ella sabe que con estos ingresos apoya a su esposo, en la educación, alimentación para sus hijos de ocho y tres años. Sonia quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños, algo que no pudo conocer debido a las circunstancias. Con el reciente capital que recibió lo invirtió para comprar otra cesta porque la que tenía estaba maltratada por el uso.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 10 members, who live in the rural community of Huinco, in the province of Huarochirí. The main hydroelectric dam of Huinco is located in this small town, and it provides safe drinking water to the city of Lima. This group works in the retail business. Most of them began working from a very young age. Their businesses include selling sodas, sweets, fruit, food, clothes, and ice cream; these activities are the sources of income for their families. Sonia, who is the president of the group, has worked since she was twelve years old. She didn’t have the support of her father because he passed away when she was 5 years old. Since then, she started to work with her siblings selling stuffed potatoes, jelly, and popcorn. She alone had to pay for her high school education and for her technical nursing education. She couldn’t complete her education, however, because of a lack of money. Today, at the age of 28, Sonia has received her ninth loan from the financial institution, EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD (prosperity). With these loans, she has invested in the purchase of merchandise to supply her small business. She sells sodas, avocadoes, custard apples, and stuffed potatoes in a small basket, offering her merchandise to the tourists and to the cars that are parked there for a few minutes before continuing their journey to the towns in the mountains of Perú. With this income, she supports her husband and the education and nutrition of her children, who are eight and three years old. Sonia wants to give them a better quality of life, which is something that she didn’t have because of her circumstances. With the recent capital that she received, she invested in the purchase of another basket because the one she had been using was in poor condition.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Elsa Johana

texts.es: Elsa Johana M. N. tiene 26 años. Es una mujer muy responsable. Ella da inicio a este negocio con esfuerzos propios. Tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulperia. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su mayor desafío que ha enfrentado es administrar este negocio, y al mismo tiempo cuidar de su hijo que en muchas ocasiones se enferma, a pesar del cansancio siempre mantiene la sonrisa para sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, pan, refrescos, naturales, leche, jugos y gaseosas. En futuro le gustaría proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elsa Johana M. N. is 26 years old. She is a very responsible woman who started her own business with great effort. Elsa has one dependent child. She operates a grocery store and has been in business for 3 years. Her biggest challenge is being able to manage her business while caring for her son, who has gotten sick on several occasions. Despite the fatigue, she always welcomes her customers with a smile.

She will use her loan as operating capital to buy candy, bread, soft drinks, natural beverages, milk and juices. In the future, she would like to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Silvia Irene

texts.es:
La señora Silvia C. se ha destacado por ser una vendedora de verduras y especies en el departamento de León donde tiene su propio negocio.

A diario ofrece sus productos con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia con el mantenimiento. El motivo por el que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar el crédito para la compra de las verduras tales como los tomates, cebollas y repollos e igual con la compra de todo tipo de especies para ofrecerlas en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia C. is known as a saleswoman of vegetables and spices in the department of León where she has her own business. Daily she offers her products in order to make a living for her household and thus to maintain her family. Her motive for approaching Ceprodel is to request a loan for the purchase of vegetables such as tomatoes, onions and cabbages and also to purchase all kinds of spices to offer them in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices for resale.

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Martha R. tiene su propio establecimiento de cafetín donde vende café, bebidas gaseosas, jugos y productos comestibles.

Ella es muy trabajadora y ha logrado salir adelante gracias a su constante esfuerzo en su negocio. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de todas las bebidas y los productos comestibles para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así lograr su satisfacción para obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha R. has her own small café where she sells coffee, carbonated drinks, juice and food products. Martha is a very hard worker, and she has been able to get ahead thanks to the constant effort she puts into her business. She has now come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy lots of drinks and food products to offer to her customers. The customers will be satisfied, and she will get better earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks and food products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lydia Yunieth

texts.es: Lydia Yunieth P. Pérez tiene 27 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mársicos. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que dependen de ella. Es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que todos los días recorre algunas calles y comarcas, porque la mayoría de sus clientes son de las comarcas. A pesar de que todos los días camina muchos kilómetros le gusta mucho su trabajo. Anteriormente su Mama se dedica a este negocio, pero Lydia con muchas ganas de ayudar decide hacerse cargo de este negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camarones, punches, conchas, chuletas, pescado y langostas. Su mayor sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Lydia Yunieth P. Pérez is 27 years old and has 3 dependent children. She is a responsible and hardworking young woman who sells seafood door-to-door. She travels through the streets and neighboring regions where most of her customers are located. Despite the amount of walking she does every day, she enjoys her work tremendously. Her mother was previously engaged in this same business, so Lydia worked as her assistant before taking it over.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy shrimp, shellfish, fillets, fish, and lobsters. Her greatest hope is that her children have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia cuenta con 42 años de vida, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, está felizmente casada y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos viven junto a ella en su casa propia. Diariamente se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para rajar la leña y encender su bicharra (cocina a leña), con la que prepara los alimentos. Posteriormente, a eso de las 6am, “la bodeguita de la esquina”, su tienda, se encuentra muy limpia y lista para la atención y a Anastacia se le ve saludando alegremente a sus vecinos y clientes, quienes le han dado su preferencia. En retribución a ello Anastacia les regala su sonrisa y un buen trato a todos, puesto que valora mucho a sus clientes, ya que le generan buenos ingresos a su negocio. Su bodega está abierta sólo hasta las 9 de la mañana, pues luego de esa hora, conjuntamente con su esposo realizan la faena agrícola en sus cultivos, con cuyas ganancias han adquirido un terreno en la ciudad de Lima y esto la anima a seguir labrando sus tierras. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y durante estos años se ha ganado el cariño y el respeto de todos los integrantes de su grupo, ya que en lo ciclos pasados cumplió con el rol de tesorera en su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio por permitirle trabajar con los créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita es el para el incremento de los productos de su bodega, asimismo el 50% del monto lo derivará a la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 42 and is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She is happily married and has 4 children, 3 of whom live with her in her own home. Every day she gets up at 4 a.m. to split wood and to light her bicharra (a wood stove), with which she prepares her food. Later, at 6 a.m., her "La bodeguita de la esquina" (little corner store), is clean and ready for business. Anastacia can be seen happily greeting her neighbors and customers, who prefer her store. In return, Anastacia gives all of them her smile and good service, because her customers value this a lot and it generates good income for her business. Her store is open only until 9 a.m. because that's when she and her husband do agricultural work in their fields. With the profits from this, they have acquired land in the city of Lima, and this motivates them to keep working their land. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and during these years, she has earned the care and respect of the other members in her group. For previous loans, she has been the treasurer of her communal bank. She is appreciative of her bank for letting her work with her credits. The money she is now requesting will go towards increasing the amount of products she has in her store, and 50% of the loan will go towards buying fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es: Bernabé tiene 31 años, tiene un buen sentido del humor y es muy chistoso, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia hecha a base de madera. Desde que es padre, con el apoyo de su pareja, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, por otro lado, esporádicamente realiza la limpieza de sus chacra y el macheteo de los arbustos con el  afán de que sus plantas se han más fáciles de cosechar. Pero lo que más le gusta y le satisface económicamente, es su negocio de venta de frutas, ya que durantes estos años ha ganado mucha clientela porque se hizo muy conocido en el mercado debido al precio cómodo que vende  sus frutas, pues cada fin de semana lo esperan muy ansiosos sus clientes y eso lo motiva a seguir trabajando en este negocio. Bernabé valora mucho a sus clientes, pues ellos le permiten acumular ganancias y de seguir contando con este negocio espera alcanzar un nivel de vida más cómoda para su familia. Para Bernabé este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y durante los ciclos pasados cumplió con pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas. Asimismo para este crédito promete seguir trabajando del mismo modo, ya que se siente muy comprometido con su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para el incremento su capital para la compra y venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Bernabé is 31 years old and lives with his common law wife and their two children in their own wooden house. He has a good sense of humor and is bit of a jokester. With the help of his wife, Bernabé buys and sells fruit. They also spend time around their farm clearing brush so that it will be easier for them during harvest time.

Bernabé is satisfied that he has done well financially with his fruit business. In recent years, he has gained a lot of customers because of his reputation in the market for offering affordable prices for his fruits. Every weekend, he eagerly attends to his customers and is always motivated to keep his business going. Bernabé values his customers, and in return they continue to do business with him, which allows him to save and achieve a comfortable standard of living for his family.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Bernabé has paid all his previous loans on time. He promises to continue working in the same manner and remain committed to his communal bank group. The money he is requesting will be used to increase his capital for buying and selling fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more fruit

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: César tiene 40 años, es un hombre muy responsable y dinámico, vive con la madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Su actividad principal es la agricultura, cultiva frutas cítricas (mandarinas y naranjas), las cuales le generan ingresos cada 15 días, pero le resultan más rentables en los meses de diciembre a marzo, ya que estos meses el costo de sus productos se elevan y son muy solicitados, por eso los envía directamente al mercado mayorista de Lima. El resto de los meses, cada quincena, adicionalmente vende licores como anisados, pisco y coñac, ya que le deja buenos dividendos a favor de su economía. Dedicarse a estas dos actividades le agrada mucho, ya que le gusta lo que hace y le permite captar ganancias, las cuales invierte en la educación de sus hijos que se encuentran cursando la escuela y el colegio. César espera que sus hijos se forjen una carrera profesional y él se sentiría un hombre dichoso. En este, su quinto préstamo con MFP, reitera su puntualidad en sus pagos, como hasta ahora. Y en su cargo de presidente de su banco comunal ha cumplido con responsabilidad, ganándose el respeto y estima de sus compañeros de grupo, quienes lo respetan por su buen carácter. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y nuevas plantas de cítricos, con las que piensa incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
César, age 40, is a very responsible and dynamic man. He lives with the mother of his 3 children in his own house. His main business is agricultural, raising citrus fruits (mandarin oranges and oranges) which generate income for him every 15 days, but which turn out more profitable in the months of December to March. In those months, the cost of his products rise and they are very sought-after. That’s why he was sending them directly to Lima’s wholesale market. The remaining months, every two weeks, he also sells liqueurs such as aniseed liqueur, pisco, and cognac since these provide him with good profits.

Being in these two businesses brings him a lot of pleasure since he likes what he does and it allows him to gain profits, which he invests in the education of his children who are taking courses at school and college. César hopes that his children forge professional careers, and he would feel like a lucky man.

In this, his fifth loan with MFP, he reiterates his punctuality in his payments until now. He has fulfilled his position as president of his community bank with responsibility, winning for himself the respect and appreciation of his colleagues in the group, who respect him because of his good character. The money that he is now applying for is for the purchase of fertilizer and new citrus plants with which he hopes to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and new plants

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es: Thelma B. Z. tiene la actividad económica de venta de ropa. Es una Señora de 43 años. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Ella da inicio a su negocio porque no tenía un trabajo para sustentar a sus hijos. Por lo que decide incursionar en este negocio, con sus propios esfuerzos decide comprar un poco de camisetas, calcetines y pantalones. Por lo que logro obtener muy buenos resultados y así decide mantener este negocio, a pesar del poco tiempo que tenia para sus hijos. Pero con paso del tiempo logro ordenar su tiempo con el negocio y sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de vestidos, shorts, camisas, ropa interior y faldas. Su mayor sueño es obtener una pulpería.
texts.en:
Thelma B. Z. is in the business of selling clothes. She is 43 years old and has 4 dependent children. She began her business because she did not have a job to support her children. At first she started buying a few shirts, socks and pants. She experienced good results and decided to continue with her business even though it meant spending less time with her children.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase dresses, shorts, shirts, underwear and skirts. She hopes to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María cuenta con 43 años, es una mujer muy noble, está casada hace 10 años con el padre de sus 3 hijos, quienes viven con ella. Hace 2 años viene trabajando como promotora del programa Wawa Huasi (programa gubernamental de niñeras para las madres de bajos recursos). Cuando los padres que tienen faenas pesadas en el día, dejan al cuidado de Maria a sus hijos y ella los cuida con mucho cariño, pues aprendió a quererlos y tratarlos como a sus propios hijos, por ello que todos los nenes la llaman mamá y eso le despierta un fuerte amor maternal. Los fines de semana trabaja en sus chacras, ya que durante toda su vida se ha dedicaba a la agricultura, sembrando frutos cítricos (mandarinas y naranjas) y últimamente siembra cacao con el liderazgo de su esposo. Trabajar y cuidar de sus plantas frutales es una labor que la llena de mucha satisfacción, ya que son muy rentables, sobre todo en los meses de enero a marzo, por ser verano en la ciudad de Lima. Asimismo está muy feliz de cuidar a estos niños, ya que por ello le dan un pago de 210 soles mensualmente. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar como lo viene haciendo hasta ahora, ya que le tiene mucha gratitud a su bando comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus plantas de cítricos, para que de ese modo el próximo verano le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She is a very noble woman. She has been married for ten years to the father of her three children who live with her. For two years, she has been working as a promoter of the Wawa Huaso program (a government daycare program for mothers of little resources). When parents have heavy duties in the daytime, they can leave their children in Maria's care and she looks after them with a lot of love. She learned to love them and treat them as if they were her own. As a result, all of the kids call her "mommy" and this evokes a strong maternal love for her. On weekends, she works on her land since she has been dedicated to farming for her whole life, planting citrus fruit (mandarins and oranges) and finally planting cocoa following the leadership of her husband. To work and take care of her fruit plants is a job that fills her with a lot of satisfaction since it is profitable, especially in the months of January to March, which is summer in the city of Lima. At the same time, she is happy to take care of children since, for her, it provides a wage of 210 soles monthly. This is her fifth loan with MFP, which she will endeavor to repay as she has done up until now. She is thankful to her community. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her citrus plants so that next summer she has a good fruit crop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rafaela Emilia

texts.es: Rafaela Emilia Calderón O.  tiene 26 años. Es una joven soltera. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Rafaela no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios, ya que sus padres están muy mayores. Pero esto no le impidió salir adelante con esta humilde actividad. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo, porque todos sus clientes gratifican su valor porque a pesar de ser muy joven ha logrado salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos. Su mayor sueño es obtener otro negocio para ayudarle lo suficiente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Rafaela Emilia Calderón O. is 26 years old. She is a young, single woman. Her economic activity is butchering pork. She has been dedicated to this business for more than four years. Rafaela did not have the oppotunity to finish her education since her parents are very old. But this has not stopped her from getting ahead with this humble profession. She is a hard-working young woman and she enjoys her work very much since all of her customers reward her guts because despite being young she has managed to get ahead. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital for the purchase of pigs. Her greatest dream is to obtain another business so she may help her parents sufficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro cuenta con 41 años de edad, es un hombre muy noble, vive con la madre de sus 8 hijos, de los cuales, los 2 mayores trabajan ocasionalmente en una zona alejada de su hogar. La sangre de agricultor corre por sus venas, ya que desde su infancia no conoce otra actividad, que no sea labrar y cuidar sus viñas. Por ello, con mucha dedicación y entusiasmo se avoca íntegramente al cuidado de sus plantas cítricas (mandarinas y carambolas) y también, pero en menor cantidad, siembra cacao. Cada cierta temporada, Pedro realiza el macheteo y la limpieza de sus chacras de carambolas, ya que este fruta durante todo el año le resulta muy rentable, mientras que las mandarinas le generan mayores ingresos en los meses de enero a marzo por ser la estación de verano en la capital. Cada vez que habla de sus cultivos, Pedro se llena de mucho regocijo, ya que ama lo que hace y más aún que con estas ganancias puede educar a sus 8 hijos. Ahora, espera que cuando sus hijos alcancen la mayoría de edad, sean hombres de ejemplo en su comunidad, pues eso lo haría muy feliz. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser un cliente muy responsable, por lo que reitera su compromiso de pago para este préstamo, ya que le tiene mucha gratitud a su banco comunal, pues considera que el préstamo es muy valioso para su progreso. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, asimismo piensa incrementar sus plantas de carambolas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 41 years old. He is a noble man who lives with the mother of his eight children, of which the two eldest work occasionally in the an area far from their home. The blood of a farmer runs through his veins since, from his infancy, he has not known a job other than working and taking care of his fields. With much dedication and enthusiasm, he takes care of his citrus plants (mandarin oranges and star fruits) and also, but in fewer quantity, he plants cocoa. Every season Pedro completes the cutting and cleaning of his star fruit crops since this fruit is profitable all year. Meanwhile, the oranges generate greater earnings during the months of January to March since it is the summer season in the capital. Each time he talks about his crops, Pedro is filled with a lot of joy since he loves what he does and, more importantly, with these earnings he can educate his eight children. Now he hopes that when his children grow older, they will be men of example in their community as this would make him very happy. This is his fifth loan with MFP where he has demonstrated that he is a responsible client. He reiterates his committment to pay for this loan since he has a lot of gratitude for his community bank. He considers the loan to be very valuable for his progress. The money that he is requesting now is to purchase chemical fertilizers. He also plans to plant more star fruit plants.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and new plants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida tiene 28 años, de bonito carácter y muy llevadero con todos, vive con el padre de sus 2  hijos, Yasmín de 7 y Estaban de 3 años de edad, por el momento habitan en la casa de sus suegros. Desde muy jovencita se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de arvejas y papas, porque siempre le han resultado muy rentables y más aun, porque trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo, siente que estas actividades la llenan de mucho vigor en su vida cotidiana. Asimismo hace 3 años decidió criar ovejas con la finalidad de obtener ganancias adicionales, para ello, se inició con un par de corderitos y la cantidad se fue incrementando. Ahora que pasaron los años, esta actividad le está generando muy buenos ingresos, porque los vende (vivos) a un precio de entre 100 y 120 soles, dependiendo del tamaño y el peso. Por ello, en horas de la tarde se dedica a pastear a sus animales, pero cuando tiene que trabajar en sus chacras, deja a cada cordero sujeto a una estaca, de modo que avance con su jornada. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante los anteriores ciclos demostró pagar puntualmente, por lo que ganó la confianza y respeto del resto de los integrantes de su banco comunal, donde la nombraron como tesorera y ella muy alegremente juro cumplir dicha responsabilidad. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de animales y otra cantidad para adquirir 10 sacos de fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Nerida is 28 years old and she has a good disposition and is tolerant of everything. She lives with the father of her two children, seven-year-old Yasmin and three-year-old Estaban. They live in the house of her in-laws for the time being. Since she was a little girl, she has worked at planting and growing peas and potatoes because they have always been very profitable. But even more, because she works with the support of her husband, she feels that these activities provide her with a lot of energy in her daily life. At the same time, she decided three years ago to raise sheep with the objective of obtaining additional profits. So she began with a couple of little lambs and then the quantity increased. With the passage of years this activity is providing her with very good earnings because she sells them at a price of between 100 to 120 Sols on the hoof, depending on the size and weight. To do this, she puts them out to pasture during the afternoon, but when she has to work in her fields she leaves each lamb tethered to a stake in such a way that it advances as it grazes. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. During the previous cycles, she has been punctual in her payments and so has won the confidence and respect of the other members of her communal bank, where she has been appointed treasurer and she has happily sworn to fulfill this responsibility. She is planning on investing the money which she is requesting in the purchase of animals as well as in acquiring 10 bags of chemical fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 39 años, es un hombre muy noble y trabajador, vive con la madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Labrar la tierra lo llena de mucha satisfacción, ya que esta actividad la realiza desde muy niño, Teodoro está muy agraciado con sus padres porque le heredaron tierras cultivables, pero estos terrenos son más apropiados para el cultivo de papas, por estar situados a gran altura y la cosecha de este producto es anual. Por ello, también siembra hortalizas, en chacras alquiladas donde paga entre 300 y 800 soles dependiendo de la extensión. Sólo con estas siembras alternadas Teodoro puede dinamizar su economía, ya que los cultivos de las espinacas, lechugas y zanahorias le son más rentables porque le permiten cosechar cada tres meses. Una vez realizada la cosecha la envía directamente al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde tiene muchos comerciantes esperando sus productos. Por ello Teodoro no pasa más de media hora en el mercado, pues coloca sus productos rápidamente, de ese modo cubre la educación de sus hijos y espera seguir progresando para alcanzar una vida decorosa. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, durantes los anteriores periodos ha demostrado ser muy  puntual en cada uno de sus pagos, asimismo se encarga de realizar las cobranzas a los integrantes de su banco comunal, a quienes tiene mucho cariño y aprecio. El dinero que ahora solicita los piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, asimismo pagará el alquiler de su terrenos de regadío para su siembra de hortalizas.
texts.en:
39-year-old Teodoro is a very noble and hard-working man. He lives with the mother of his three children in his own house.
Working the land fills him with much satisfaction, having done this work since childhood. Teodoro is very grateful to his parents because they left him fertile land. These high altitude lands are more suitable for growing potatoes, which have an annual harvest. That’s why he also grows vegetables on rented farmland, paying between 300 and 800 PEN depending on the land area. Only by alternating his crops can Teodoro stimulate his finances. His spinach, lettuce and carrot crops are the most profitable because he can harvest them every three months.
Once the harvest is complete, he sends it directly to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where many vendors wait for his produce. Teodoro does not spend more than half an hour in the market because he distributes his produce quickly. This is how he covers his children’s education and hopes to continue making progress in his pursuit of a decent life.
This is his fifth loan with MFP and he has been punctual in each of his previous repayments. He is also in charge of collecting his community bank’s repayments and has much affection and appreciation for his fellow members. He plans to use the money that he is now requesting to purchase chemical fertilisers and to rent irrigated lands for growing vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers and rent land

loans.name: Milena Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Milena del Socorro tiene 56 años. Su actividad económica es de ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 40 años que se dedica a esta humilde labor, ya que es por medio de este negocio que ha logrado proporcionarles a sus hijos el pan de cada día. Actualmente su negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos la conoce muy bien y les gusta la confección de sus prendas de vestir. A ella siempre le ha gustado su trabajo pues a pesar de ser muy cansado recibe la distinción de recibir halagos de parte de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El mayor sueños de Milena es obtener las condiciones básicas para vivir.
texts.en:
Sra. Milena del Socorro is 56 years old. She is a seamstress who has been offering her sewing services for more than 40 years. Her business has allowed her to provide for the daily needs of her children. She operates her business out of her home, and most of her neighbors know about her work and like the clothes she produces. Despite being tired at times, she has always enjoyed her work because of the compliments she receives from her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy materials. Sra. Milena hopes to maintain her basis living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in operating capital.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou C. est une femme de 52 ans. Elle est veuve et vit à Vélingara avec ses deux (2) enfants. Ce crédit lui générera des bénéfices qui lui permettront de prendre en charge la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bintou C. is a 52-year-old woman. She is a widow and lives in Vélingara with her two children. This loan will generate profits for her that will allow her to meet the food, health, and schooling needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying and marketing five sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Hada Francis

texts.es: Hada Francis M. tiene 45 años. Es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos de su familia, ya que tiene una hija que adopto porque lamentablemente no podía tener hijos, ya si toma esta decisión de ofrecerle a esta niña todo el cariño y las satisfacer las necesidades necesarias. El motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de unas, pinturas de labios, sombras, cremas entre otros productos. Su mayor sueño es seguir apoyando a su familia por medio de este trabajo.
texts.en:
Hada Francis M. is 45 years old. She is a strong-willed and responsible woman. She started her business selling cosmetics more than 4 years ago because she needed to improve her family’s income. Hada adopted a daughter because unfortunately she wasn’t able to have children. Since she made that decision, she needed to offer all the love and fulfill the basic needs that a child requires.

She has requested a loan to buy nail polish, lipsticks, eye shadows, crèmes, and other products. Her greatest dream is to continue supporting her family through her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: Alba Nubia R. M. tiene 28 años. Es una hombre casado tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella es una mujer muy alegre. Alba se dedica a la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque anteriormente su Mama se dedicaba a la venta de ropa. Actualmente es Alba quien se hace cargo de negocio ya que tenía que ofrecerles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación, y como no tenía un trabajo estable decide quedarse con el negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, shorts y chaquetas. Su deseo es establecer un negocio.
texts.en:
Alba Nubia R. M. is 28 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. She is a happy woman who has been selling clothes for more than 5 years. Alba became involved in this line of work because her mother was also a clothing vendor. Now that she is charge of the business, Alba is able to educate and feed her children because she did not have a stable job before.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts and jackets. She hopes that her business becomes well established.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rouguyatou

texts.fr: Rouguyatou B. est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter sa capacité de production et faire des bénéfices afin de mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales
texts.en:
Rouguyatou B. is a 33-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six. She is requesting this loan to increase her production capacity and to make a profit for supporting her husband more with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
ALCANCÍA COMUNAL “UNIDOS POR EL TRIUNFO”

Los once miembros D. esta alcancía participan en la entidad financiera EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD desD. hace dos años y cuatro meses, la gran mayoría se dedica a la confección D. carteras D. cuero y D. hilo, manteles, monederos hecho por ellas mismas vendiéndolos en los mercados, ferias y a sus clientes.
María Luisa es la presidenta del grupo, desD. hace diez años trabaja en costura se dedica a componer prendas, además ayuda a su esposo en la carpintería D. su padre. Utilizó el primer capital que le dio EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD en comprar hilos, cuero, moldes para la elaboración D. carteras D. cuero. Con los ingresos D. estas ventas María Luisa les da una vida apacible a sus dos pequeños hijos quienes todavía estudian en una escuela del estado. 
Ella invirtió el reciente préstamo en materiales (hilos, bisutería, tela, cierres) para empezar a fabricar monederos, bolsos con lindos adornos que es lo que actualmente está D. moda. Piensa seguir trabajando duro a fin D. ahorrar un pequeño capital para que pueda más adelante vender sus productos es un puesto donD. halla demanda.
texts.en:
Community Savings “United for Triumph” (“Unidos por el Triunfo”) The eleven members of this savings group have participated in the financial institution EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD (prosperity) for two years and four months. Most of them make wallets of leather and thread, tablecloths, and purses and then sell these products in markets, fairs, and to their clients. María Luisa is the president of the group. For ten years, she has worked in dressmaking, and she makes garments. Also, she helps her husband in his father’s carpentry business. She used her first loan form EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD to buy thread, leather and molds for the production of leather wallets. With the income from these sales, María Luisa provides a good life to her two young children, who are attending a government school. She invested her recent loan in materials (thread, jewelry, fabric, and zippers) to begin making purses with beautiful decorations that are currently in fashion. She plans to continue working hard with the goal of saving some capital so that she can continue selling her products in a stand where there is a demand for the goods.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Lorena's Group

texts.en:
Lorena Q. is from the village of  Waterfall , Balingasag , Misamis  Oriental. She is 43 years old. Lorena is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lorena operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a videoke machine ( sing-a-long business) in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Forty years old, Susana D. is a rice grower from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has two children, both in school. Her husband, Emelito D. is very supportive of her and helps her manage their small rice field. Currently, they are tilling a 3-hectare farm. The harvest that the couple gets from farming rice has gone far in paying their daily family costs.

Knowing the wide services of Community Economic Ventures in their location, Susana never hesitates to apply for a loan, hoping that this will help improve the size of her harvest. The loan that she will soon be accessing will help a lot in buying fertilizers and herbicides. She also aspires of venturing into another business to help supplement their income.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin S. is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old. Darwin is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Darwin owns and operates a business in the Arts sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing printing T-shirts in the local community. Darwin has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Darwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darwin is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to print his T-shirts. This will be the first loan taken out by Darwin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to print T-shirts

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet and her family are living in the rural community of Barangay Parabba Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is married to Edwin S., a house carpenter in their community. Her husband used to earn a labor fee of 350 PHP a day. They have seven children with ages ranging from 13 to 25 years old. Despite the hardships of life, Juliet is happy to have her family bonded and cooperative.

For her general store business, Juliet is requesting additional business capital of around 22,000 PHP from Kiva lenders in order to develop her business to support her children's education. They will make her proud someday if they are able to pursue and finish college.
