Furthermore, Juliet dreams of developing her business into a grocery store someday, a goal for which, according to her, patience and hard work will be the key. In the meantime, Juliet is going to buy additional supplies of items such as sugar, coffee, mild detergent, fragrance soap, 10 cases of soft drinks, canned goods, sacks of sugar, etc., to retail in her store using the loan she is requesting from Kiva. She hopes to gain lenders' support in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is raising hogs in their backyard. She is a resident of Barangay Villa Marzo in Cordon, Isabela. She is happily married to Eufemio, who is a simple farmer.  They are blessed with six children.  Five of them are already married and only Vergel, who is 27 years old now, is still single.  He just finished a vocational course. Leonila is thankful because she is able to provide the needs of her family through the income she generates in her hog raising business and also through the earnings of her husband from farming. 

She now hopes to avail herself of financial support from Kiva lenders. She wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 19,000 for the maintenance of her hog raising business. She will utilize the loan to buy a supply of feed and also to buy additional piglets if there is still enough money left.  Leonila is grateful to have the chance to raise pigs because, according to her, it was really a big help in sustaining their family's needs.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Zulmy Veronica

texts.es:
Zulmy es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside en el sector El Pescador, ubicado en el distrito de San José a veinte munutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, donde vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos, uno de 6 años que se encuentra estudiando en el colegio de la zona y otro de 3 años de edad.

Tiene en su vivienda un pequeño negocio donde vende productos de consumo diario (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.) así como carne de pollo, verduras, pan y golosinas. Este negocio lo empezó hace un año y ha servido de apoyo a la economía de su hogar, ya que su esposo, como la mayoría de los hombres de la zona, se dedica eventualmente a la pesca artesanal y lo percibido por él no es suficiente para mantener a su familia.

Ella está solictando por primera vez un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual piensa utilizar en la ampliación de su negocio comprando productos que usualmente son solicitados por sus clientes, ya que el poco dinero que percibe en ganancias no le alcanza para comprar lo que ella necesita para hacer crecer su negocio.

El deseo de Zulmy es tener un negocio próspero para brindarle a sus pequeños hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Zulmy is a 28 year-old mother who lives in the El Pescador neighborhood, located in the San José district, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She lives with her husband and her two children, one of whom is 6 years old and is studying in the neighborhood school, and the other is 3 years old. She has a small business in her house, where she sells basic daily-use products (rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.), and also chicken, vegetables, and sweets. She started this business one year ago and it has helped with the family income since her husband, like most men in the area, works occasionally in artisanal fishing and his income isn’t enough to support his family. She is requesting her first loan of 2000 PEN which she plans to use to expand her business by purchasing products that her customers usually buy. The little that she earns isn’t enough to buy what she needs to grow her business. Zulmy’s dream is to have a prosperous business so that she can provide her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grocery products to sell in her store

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
"Endurance and love towards every business is necessary to achieve success," said Carmelita. Carmelita stands as both father and mother to her five children. Three of them are already married and two are still single and live with her. Sometimes her children help her maintain her fruit stand, vending in their simple place at Barangay San Leonardo in Aglipay Quirino Province. Her youngest child is still studying, so she dedicates her hard work and perseverance in her business to grow and earn income for her studies. 

As a fruit vendor, Carmelita is doing her best to make her business fruitful. Because of this, she is requesting financial assistance from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000 for her to have additional business capital as she continuously hopes for the sustainability of her fruit vending business.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine R. is engaged in a fruit-juice processing business located in the rural area of Santos Quezon, Isabela. She makes and processes vinegar, fruit-juice and she also manages a hog-raising business in their backyard. She sells her processed products in stores in their village.

Justine wants to increase her capital and that’s why she is asking for financial support from Kiva amounting to PHP 11,000 as additional business capital to further improve her business. She will somehow expand to a wider selling coverage with the continuous support of the Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) and Kiva loans. She also hopes that her business will be of big help someday to provide jobs for the unemployed.

Justine is married to Renie R. who strives in his tricycle-transport activity. They are blessed with two children who are taking their high school level of education. In the meantime, their children serve as their helpers to deliver their products to stores during weekends. Justine is happy that her family helps together for the fulfillment of their dreams in life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is fifty-three years old and married to Agustin B., who works as farmer. Their family lives happily in the rural community of Parabba Peńablanca, Cagayan. They are blessed with seven children, six of whom are married and the last is attending college in Manila. Josefa said that her family’s current situation is happy, even though they are not all living together. 

Josefa wants to borrow PHP25,000 from Kiva lenders to improve and develop her general store business. She believes that she and her husband need to work hard and patiently endure every challenge that may occur so they will able to give their youngest child their full support. Aside from that they are really striving to make a better life for themselves.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila wants to further develop and improve her business, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP25000 to sustain her pig-raising business.   She needs enough capital to provide the needed food supply for her hogs.  According to her, the business has come to be a big financial help to their family, especially in providing for the education of her children in school. She earns a good profit  from the business and wants to maintain it for the welfare of her family. 

Leonila is forty-eight years old. She is married to Pascual who works as a house carpenter. They are presently residing in the rural village of Barangay Annafunan East Tuguegarao, City. She has two children: Walter and Lilibeth. Leonila believes that by maintaining her hog-raising business, they will be able to cope  with whatever financial difficulties they might encounter in the future, because it is a profitable enterprise.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander A. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is thirty-two years old. Alexander is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Alexander owns and operates a service-based business, providing vulcanizing services to local community members. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $67 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alexander joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. He has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC. Alexander is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his eleventh loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the expansion to further improve his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Celenia

texts.en:
Celenia, at the age of forty-six, is a woman full of dreams that remain unrealized due to unceasing hardships prevalent in the country. She hopes that someday she can achieve her goals and desires in life through her perseverance in her business. Celenia also believes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan request of PHP 7,000 for business capital. 

Celenia is married to Romeo, who works as a farmer in the village of Santos Quezon, Isabela. They are blessed with three children: Romeo, Nino Roeland and Rocel Ann Mae. With her general store business, Celenia is able to help her husband support the education of their children and provide their daily needs. Learning about Kiva loans is an opportunity, says Celenia, because she will be able to generate additional capital for her business to grow.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is engaged in a duck-raising business in the village of Annafunan East Tuguegarao City. She is forty-seven years old and has five children. They are: Carlito - 21, Jayson - 18, Jonathan - 16, Andy – 15 and Donna – 6 years old. All of them are currently enrolled in a public school. 

She wanted ask for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP6,000 for the maintenance of her duck-raising business that is a great help in sending her children to school. Her ducks are also producing eggs that serve as a source of food. She hopes that her loan request will be granted in order to generate more income and have a better way of life.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda V. is seventy years old. She is a widow and has eight grown children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  5000 PHP is enough to purchase the additional products she wants, and that is why she chose that amount. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili T. is forty-two years old and married with eight school-age children.  To make a living, Saili works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas to sell.  Saili has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately $170 a month from these activities.

In 2003, Saili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  Saili has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2650 WST from SPBD.  That loan was used to rent land to raise additional crops.  Saili is now requesting a new loan of 3400 WST which will be used to purchase land.  This will be her fourth loan from SPBD.  Saili plans to use the additional revenue to further improve her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase land for additional crops

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn D. is from the village of Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is thirty years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Rovelyn owns and operates a barber shop, providing services in the local community. Rovelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $260 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Rovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rovelyn is now requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas E. is fifty-six years old and a widow with three grown children. To make a living, Felicitas owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Felicitas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to further improve her business and support the needs of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. manages a general store. She is fifty-four years old and married to Marcelo L. Sr., who is a furniture worker in their rural village of Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. All her children are already married and no longer living at home. Josefina has managed her store for almost five years, and she is ready to take the chance to further develop her business into a more progressive one. 

She wants a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP10,000 for additional business capital. She is selling lots of bread, biscuits, and different commodities like coffee, sugar and salt. Also, she sells candies, canned and bottled goods and soft drinks. Josefina hopes that someday, with the support of Kiva lenders, her business will become ever more successful.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jorinda

texts.en:
Jorinda D. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jorinda is married, and she has 7 school-age children. To make a living, Jorinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. She explains that the main source of income from the business comes primarily through the planting and harvesting of corn and bananas for sale. Jorinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years, and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2008, Jorinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to thereby help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Jorinda has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jorinda is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175), which will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional crops for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jorinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business and to help pay for her children's school tuition. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small business entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing fertilizers and additional crops

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is 33 years old, and she is married to Romeo, a simple house carpenter. They are blessed with two children: Romar, who is 17 years old, and Krisha, who is 8 years old. Both of her children are currently students, with Roman studying in college, and Krisha studying in elementary school. Marites hopes that, someday, her two children will earn a degree and become successful in their chosen careers.

Her business is more successful and helpful from an economic standpoint for their family than her husband's part-time carpentry business. Fortunately, the income from her business has been able to support her family's living expenses, especially her children's school tuition. Even so, she really wants her food-selling business to continue to grow. Indeed, she sells a variety of foods, such as embutido, longganisa, and hot dogs. Her desire to improve and expand her business motivated her to request a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of 19,000 PHP ($400) in order to purchase more ingredients from retailers at reasonable prices. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional food products

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
In Barangay Manamtam of Bambang Nueva Vizcaya, Milagros and Benny V. live harmoniously with their four children. Their children are students at the high school and elementary school level. The couple would like to further expand their vending business so that they can continue to send their children to school.

Milagros is pleased and happy because, as a result of the income she has generated from her business, she assists her husband in paying their living expenses. She sells different kind of vegetables in their village. More specifically, she buys vegetables at wholesale prices at the Nueva Vizcaya Agricultural Terminal (NVAT), where many vegetables are sold to retail customers. Unfortunately, she has limited capital. So, to improve her vending business, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $275 (12,000 PHP) from Kiva lenders. She hopes that lenders will grant her loan request so that her business will continue to grow and become sustainable over time.

loans.use: For general capital needs and to expand and improve the business

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila owns a simple village store in Villa Marzo, Cordon, Isabela. Managing a store is very hard due to the need to extend credit to many of her customers. She wanted her business to expand in order to give her family a better way of living. She is thankful that she still gains income despite the credits.

Precila would like to have a loan of PHP 22,000 as additional capital for her store. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her request for it will really make a difference.

Precila is 53 years old, married to Pepito and blessed with four children: Julius - 32 years old, high school graduate; Joel - 30 years old and Jolly - 27 years old, both of them college graduates; and Jay - 23 years old who has pursued a vocational course.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna R. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old, married with eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of fruits and vegetables. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
"To expand my business and be able to support the needs of my children is my desire", says Wilma. Wilma considers her children as her inspiration in life to work diligently. She is engaged in the buy and sell business for already five years. She is buying junk materials like cans, bottles, plastics, et cetera and sells them at a higher price in a junk shop. According to her, she never felt ashamed of her business for it is a decent job and her family's source of income.

At present, she would like to seek for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 4,000. She wants to expand her business and hopefully engage in another business selling generic medicines for additional income to further support the education of her children.

Wilma is 38 years old and married to Bonifacio, a farmer.

loans.use: Expand her retail business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a diligent and responsible mother to her six children. She is engaged in the hog raising business and also busy in managing her rice retailing business. At present, she has two hogs left in her pigpen. To be able to maintain the business she is planning to purchase an additional piglet to raise.

Jesusa is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000 for additional capital. She will use the loan to buy feed and piglets.

Jesusa is married to Edwin who works as a farmer. They have six children: Gemma, the eldest, is already married; Edwin - 20 years old, graduated from high school already and is planning to continue his schooling next year; Edwin's twin brother is Francisco, who is now in his college studies; Harold - 15 years old, is already in his first year of high school; Geny Rose - 13 years old, is also in high school; and lastly, Erica - 10 years old, is in her grade school.

Jesusa said that, no matter how difficult life is, she will do everything to provide for them and their desire for education. She just hopes that her children will understand their situation if sometimes they have insufficient allowances.

loans.use: For feed and to buy piglets.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is engaged in a sari-sari (community-based) store. Her desire to generate a higher income for the welfare of her family pushed her to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 20,000.

Lucrecia is 44 years old and married to Rodan, a farmer in their village. They have two children, Remelyn and Roselyn. Remelyn is a factory worker in Manila, while Roselyn is a second-year college student in the province. Lucrecia wishes that her youngest child will someday earn a degree and thus Lucrecia and her husband strive for the best that they can to further Roselyn’s education.

Lucrecia keeps looking forward to a better living by having a stable income in the business she manages. "Failing doesn’t mean you are a failure, instead it means that God has a better plan for you," shares Lucrecia. It is her favorite quotation in life that serves as a guiding principle to move on and look forward for a better life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sara-sari store.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita manages a general store in the village of Linao East Tuguegarao City. She is 39 years old and she is very grateful that her business is doing well. She happily lives with her husband and a niece of who they have supported in her studies up to this time. 

Emelita is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 from Kiva as additional business capital for her general store. She wants the loan to make her store more progressive. She is happy that, despite of the hardships of life, she is able to help her niece financially since she has no child yet. The loan is really helpful in sustaining her general store. Selling has been her passion since her childhood. She also just started a food production business and she hopes that it will be able to help to improve their standard of living and let them continue supporting her niece's educational needs.

“A family that prays together stays together” said Emelita. She believes strongly in this quotation and she prays unceasingly for the goodness of her family and progress of her business to sustain their needs. Being an entrepreneur who is wishing the best for her business, Emelita works very hard and sacrifices much. She patiently manages to open her store at a very early hour in the morning and closes it late at night in order to earn more income. She loves her customers because they help her in her business and she gives them the best of her service. She prays to God that someday, from her sacrifices in the business, she will become successful in all her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Leonora is single. To make a living, Leonora buys and sells bananas in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita operates a general store where she generates income that is very beneficial for her family’s daily needs, especially for the education of her children. She is 46 years old. She was born in the province of Cagayan, in Barangay Parabba, municipality of Peñablanca. She has 6 children. Three of her children have already graduated from college, two are in college, and her youngest child is in high school. Teresita’s great dream is to provide all her children with college diplomas. She is thankful to God for the support He has given to her family.
 
Teresita needs financial capital to keep her store going and satisfy her customers by offering them their commonly needed merchandise every time they buy in her store. She hopes to do this by purchasing stock and buying more goods to sell. She will need PHP 25,000 as additional business capital. She is hoping that with the support of Kiva lenders, she will able to improve her business and save something for the education of her youngest child and for the welfare of her family. Teresita is also hoping to convert her general store into a grocery store in her village.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita or "Mercy," as she was fondly called in her village, has a principle in life which is "to be patient in everything you do so that you will reap a fruit of success someday". Despite of the economic crisis, she is still determined to improve her family's standard of living and to give her children a better future.

She is married to Maximo Sr. who works as a carpenter. Mercy manages a little store and sells street foods and snacks in front of their house. She also manages a hog-raising business for additional income. 

She hopes to further develop her small businesses so she wants to borrow PHP 20,000.00 from Kiva. Because sending her children to school is very costly, she aims to increase her income for their education. She and her husband are doing their best for the welfare of their family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
T. is a 50-year-old single mother and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She was married, but her husband died of senility many years ago. She has seven children, two of whom live with her and depend on her income. The other five are married and have started new homes. Currently, the income she earns comes from farming. She grows rice and vegetables, which she sells to buyers in bulk every two or three months when the plants mature. 

T. will use her loan to better supply her farm by buying more fertilizer and seeds for her growing facilities. She appears in the photo with her daughter at her farm.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta manages a hog-raising business in the distant community of Barangay Cabisera 27 San Antonio Ilagan, Isabela. The business serves as their alternative source of income in addition to farming. With her business, she is able to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their children. Her husband is as farmer and they have five children. Two of the children are in school, two are employed as helpers, and one is helping them on the farm. 

Violeta would like to request a loan of PHP 11,000.00 from the Kiva lenders. This amount will be of great help in maintaining her hog-raising business and continuously improving the business for the benefit of her family. She plans to purchase one piglet and feed to supply her hogs. Without the loan, Violeta will find it hard to pursue her plans. She wants to develop her business and hopes that someday she can expand it for the welfare of her family. “There’s no harm in trying”, says Violeta. As long as she believes what she’s doing is right and for the welfare of her children, she will pursue what she thinks is the best for them.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is the responsible housewife of Romy D.. They live in a rural place in Barangay Manamtam in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with eight children who are currently studying at the secondary and elementary level. Despite the hardships of life, Letty and her husband strive hard to earn a living to support the needs of their children, especially for their education.

The common source of their income is farming. They help each other to cultivate their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Letty sells the vegetables that they harvest in their village. She enjoys the business and wants to further improve the business so they can consistently support their children's education. Letty is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 from Kive to use as additional business capital. Her business brings her family a good source of income and she hopes that it will grow and progress someday.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
“The more the merrier,” is Josephine's comment about having a big family. She has nine children, three of whom are still in school. Josephine is happily married to Romeo, age 57, who works as a farmer. Her family resides in the rural flat area of Cabisera 27 Ilagan, Isabela. 

Josephine manages a hog-raising business in the back of their house. The business helps them, especially in times of emergency. That is why she wants to maintain it and make it more productive someday. 

Having a big family is not easy.  She and her husband are doing their best to cope with necessities, so she decided to venture into another business: selling vegetables. She believes that having another business is more beneficial to her family than to depend only on hog-raising, where they have to wait 3-4 months for their income.  

Josephine still aims to be even more progressive, and for this reason, she is requesting a second loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders to expand her vegetable and hog-raising businesses. She hopes that, with the loans, she can support her family, especially the educationof her three children who are in school.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean D., 31-years old, is the mother of three children. She is married to a farmer. She started helping her husband till the rice field to contribute to the family income. They also raise chickens in their backyard. She uses the income that she gets from growing rice to meet the needs of her family.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy 1 bag of Furadan insecticide and 1 sack of fertilizer. She thinks that this will be a good investment in improving her business. She hopes that she will have better, healthier rice in the future. 

She participates actively in the CEVI cluster meetings. She has learned many things from other micro-entrepreneurs who have used the credit services of CEVI.

loans.use: To buy 1 bag of Furadan insectide and 1 sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old. She is married to Jerry B., who is a soldier. They both work hard to maintain their farming business. They are blessed with five children, four of whom are in school. Their youngest  child is only one year old. 

Mary Jane maintains a hog-raising business. The business enables her to earn a good profit that is really beneficial in providing the education of her children, especially those in college. 

She is now requesting a loan of  PHP 22,000 from Kiva lenders.  She prays that lenders will entrust her with the amount she needs to maintain and, eventually, develop her business. She wishes the best for her family and gives her full support to her husband who works very hard for their children to have a better future.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long L. is a 47-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Siem Reap Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and cane trees two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to hire a domestic laborer to plow the rest of her farmland so she can plant crops. 

Long L. is married to Neang Pros, age 40, who works with her in the farm. This couple has five children.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer and to hire a domestic laborer

loans.name: Gaibullo

texts.ru: Гайбулло Каримов является активным клиентом нашей организации в течении 4 лет. Он лепит коронки для зубов.  В зависимости от клиентов он лепит иногда золотые иногда пластмассовые и  по заказу и выбору его клиентов. За счет своей прибыли он накопил небольшую сумму для  проведения  дома ремонта и в начале июня он провел ремонт дома.  На очередной кредит планирует приобрести  лекарства, основу для пломбы, а также некоторые инструменты для бор машины.

loans.use: покупка лекарств

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба Аминова  является активным клиентом  нашей организацией  более 6 лет. Матлуба  в месяц 2 раза  ездит за товаром  в Киргизию . Сейчас она должна поехать за товаром  что бы привезти большую партию школьной одежды. В разгар реализации она планирует получить большую прибыль. В прошлый раз   когда был сезон летней одежды она получила хороший доход  и провела свадьбу своей дочери .  В настоящий момент  она подключила также дочь Точинисо  в бизнес.  Когда Матлуба уезжает за товаром  Точинисо продает товар.

loans.use: покупка  школьного сезона товара

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old. She is married to Virgilio, who is a farmer. They live peacefully in the rural village of Villa Marzo Cordon, Isabela. She is thankful for having been blessed with four children.  Their youngest is the only one still living with them and currently studying in senior high school. 

Evangeline manages a general store and is doing her best to make the business profitable. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders and hoping that they grant her request. With the loan, Evangeline will buy additional merchandise to sell and she willl expand into selling vegetables, fruits, meat, etc. in front of her store. She is also thankful that her husband helps her to manage their business and help it to grow more and become progressive.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jorrey

texts.en:
Jorrey M. is from the village of Sto. Nino , Lapasan , Cagayan de Oro City. He is 39 years old and single. To make a living, Jorrey makes and sells specialty cooked food products in the local community. Jorrey has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jorrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jorrey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase the ingredients needed to make products to sell. Jorrey is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jorrey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Rufena

texts.en:
Rufena G. is from the village of Capucao in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Rufena is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Rufena plants, harvests, and sells corn. Rufena has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rufena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rufena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Rufena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rufena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina P. has a hog-raising business. She also buys and sells meat. She is 41 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with a child. They live in the rural area of Barangay Annafunan, east of Tuguegarao City.

To support their daily needs, and especially the education of her child, Cristina wants financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to use as additional capital to expand her businesses. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request, because it will improve their living conditions. Cristina hopes that the income from her business will enable her to provide a quality education for her beloved child.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор является нашим старым партнером. Ей необходимо расширить ассортимент своего товара.  Ее старший сын в этом году  поступает в Университет. Для этого она хочет за этот месяц получить от продажи хороший доход. Имея свой капитал также от продажи заплатит за обучение сына. Ее магазин находиться в центре района Явы. Среди нескольких магазинов -конкурентов ее магазин как маленький универмаг. Там она продает и продукты питания и одежду , а также моющие средства.  Кредит получает для покупки моющих  средств и женской одежды.

loans.use: расширение ассортимента

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
The young man in the photograph is Nak S., age 27, who lives in the province of Pursat, which is the best territory for farming. Nak S. is a married man who is devoted to his two young children who attend school and depend on his care. 

Nak S. owns a big farm that he inherited from his grandmother. He grows a various crops on it. He currently plants a peanut crop and he estimates that he will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. He will use the income from selling his mature produce to better meet his family’s needs during the financial crisis. His wife helps him to grow crops. 

Nak S. has another farm that he owns, but he is still not planting crops on it. He hopes to use his Kiva loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 2 children, ages 12 and 16. She also cares for another dependent.

Rehema started her own business selling cosmetics 3 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings (TZS).

This is Rehema's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 150,000 TZS to buy more cosmetics to sell. With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan, Rehema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sel

loans.name: Ausebia

texts.en:
Ausebia is a member of the Twiga borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 22-year-old woman. She is separated from her husband.

Nine years ago, Ausebia started her own cafe where she sells food, such as chapati. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Ausebia's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 150,000 Tsh to buy ingredients like wheat and cooking oil. With the additional profit she gains from the use of her loan funds, Ausebia hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat and cooking oil

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry is a member of the Uamsho borrower group in Kola, Mororgoro. She is a 26-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of a 3-year-old child. She also cares for three other dependents.

Marry started her own business selling drinks 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Marry's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 TZS to buy more drinks to sell. With the additional profit from this loan, Marry hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a member of the Uaminifu borrower group in Msamvu,  Morogoro. She is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 2 children, ages 12 and 23 years old. She also cares for one other dependent.

Mariam started her own business selling shoes 2 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mariam's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more shoes to sell. With additional profit from this loan, Mariam hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Asha is a member of the Tujikomboe borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 4 children, ages 23, 20,18,and 5 years old.

Asha started her own cafe business selling food 6 years ago. She works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Asha's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh to buy more wheat and cooking oil for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of these loan funds,  Asha hopes to save money and expand her business. 

Mariam is another member of the same borrower group. She has also requested 150,000 Tsh to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like rice

loans.name: Jenny Del Carmen

texts.es: Jenny Del Carmen M. D. M. vive en el municipio D. Ilopango en el departamento D. La Libertad. Como muchas madres solteras del país, Jenny se encarga D. criar y mantener a su hijita D. tan solo 10 años D. edad que estudia actualmente el cuarto grado, y a su padre, quien por ser viudo, vive con ella. Hace cinco años Jenny inicio una venta D. gallinas indias, con la que costea los gastos D. su casa y familia. Jenny del Carmen solicita un préstamo para refinanciar su negocio y comprar más gallinas, para aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Jenny Del Carmen M. D. M. lives in the municipality of Ilopango, in the La Libertad region. Just like many single mothers in the country, Jenny raises and provides for her little 10-year-old girl, who is currently in fourth graD., and takes care of her father who lives with her because he is a widower.
Five years ago, Jenny started selling free range chickens. This business pays for her household and family expenses. Jenny del Carmen is requesting a loan to refinance her business and buy more chickens to increase her sales and family income.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more chickens

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is a member of the Tupendane borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is 32 years old and married, and is the mother of 3 children ages 4, 10, and 14 years old. She also cares for others 2 dependents.

Zaituni started her own food business selling snacks 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 30,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zaituni's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 Tsh to buy more commodities like rice and wheat. With the additional profit that she gains from the use of these loan funds, Zaituni hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina F. C. vive en el municipio de San Marcos en la capital del país. La vida de Marina no ha sido fácil, pues desde muy joven mantiene por si sola a sus dos hijos. Ser madre soltera nunca ha sido un obstáculo para Marina, quien con dedicación y amor por sus hijos, ha logrado manejar por 27 años un negocio de venta de licuadoras. La necesidad de apoyar y respaldar a sus dos hijos en su educación, la ha llevado a solicitar un crédito para reinvertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer un poco más.
texts.en:
Marina F. C. lives in the municipality of San Marcos in the country’s capital. Marina’s life has not been easy; since she was very young, she has supported her two children on her own.
Being a single mother has never been an obstacle for Marina who, with dedication and love for her children, has run a business selling blenders for 27 years. The need to support her two children in their studies has prompted her to request a loan to reinvest in her business and make it grow a little bit more.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blenders

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Utulivu borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 30-year-old woman. She is single and the mother of 2 children, ages 3 and 13 years old. She also cares for 2 other dependents.

Paulina started her own business selling charcoal 11 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Paulina's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh to buy more charcoal to sell. With the additional profit that she gains from this loan, Paulina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Theresia is another member of the same group. She has also requested 150,000 Tsh to support her own business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Tomasa Elba

texts.es:
Tomasa Elba V. D. G. vive en Sata Tecla en el departamento D. La Libetad.
La vida D. Tomasa se centra alrededor D. dos grandes ejes, sus dos hijos, a quienes  mantiene desD. chicos, y su negocio, el comedor “Tommy”.  Ambos hijos le ayudan a Tomasa en el comedor, pues ella no tiene suficiente ingreso para pagar empleados, es por eso, que Tomasa solicita un préstamo para invertir un poco más en su negocio y poder así formalizar su comedor, que con tanto esfuerzo, ha sacado adelante.
texts.en:
Tomasa Elba V. D. G. lives in Sata Tecla in the district of La Libertad. Her life centers around two things: her two children and her eatery called “Tommy”. Both children help Tomasa with the business because she does not have enough money to pay any employees.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest a little bit more in her business so that her eatery becomes more established. Through her hard work, she hopes to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Санавбар

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Санавбар продолжает расширять свой бизнес. Свой ассортимент продуктов питания которым она торгует  около дома в летний сезон  добавила прохладительные напитки и мороженое. В период кредитования она увеличила товарооборот и хочет на следующий займ закупить риса и муки.

loans.use: На закупку риса и муки

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 39 years old and is married to Martin. They live happily in Annafunan in East Tuguegarao. Benita helps her husband, who is a tricycle driver, by raising hogs. They are blessed with a happy family and they are hoping to provide for the education of their three children. Their children are currently in high school and elementary level. 

To further assist her husband, Benita would like to borrow PHP 19,000 from Kiva to maintain her hog raising business. This is her way of helping her husband provide for the financial needs at home and for the education of her children. She dreams of becoming a successful hog raiser in the future. She believes that, somehow, she will be able to improve their poor living conditions if they work harder. Benita also added that patience is a virtue, so she waits for her turn to become successful.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. is from the village of Capucao in Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old. Tessie is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Tessie plants, harvests, and sells corn. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and for daily consumption. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es: Sonia Marina G. vive en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en la zona occidental del país. A sus 51 años, Sonia tiene un poco más de una década de manejar exitosamente un modesto negocio de fabricación de ladrillos. El negocio de Sonia ha contribuido a la construcción de muchas casas de su comunidad y municipio. En este momento Sonia solicita un préstamo para comprar así, tierra amarilla y negra para aumentar su fabricación de ladrillos y la calidad y productividad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Marina G. lives in Atiquizaya in the Ahuachapán department in the western area of the country. Sonia, 51, has a little more than a decade of successfully managing her modest brick making business. Sonia’s business has contributed to the construction of many houses in the community and municipality. Sonia is now asking for a loan to buy yellow and black soil to increase fabrication of bricks. She will also improve the quality and productivity of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make bricks

loans.name: Zoila Ester

texts.es: Zoila Ester A. E. vive en Atiquizaya, pequeño municipio en el departamento de  Ahuachapán.  Zoila y su esposo viven con su hijo de 17 años de edad, que estudia su educación básica, y su mama de 75 años, a quien acogieron en su hogar tras quedar ella sola años atrás. Hace 17 años Zoila inició una venta de carne en el mercado municipal de su municipio, donde vende diversos productos de carne roja y blanca. Actualmente Zoila y su familia solicitan un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y productos, para hacer mejorar y crecer a su humilde  venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
Zoila Ester A. E. lives in Atiquizaya, a small municipality in the Ahuachapán department. Zoila and her husband live with their 17 year old son, who is in school. They also live with her 75 year old mother, who they took into their home when she was left alone years ago. Zoila started her business of selling meat in her municipal market 17 years ago. She sells different red and white meats. Zoila and her family are currently asking for a loan to buy new merchandise and products to improve and increase her humble sales in the market. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 25 years old and livies a simple life with her family in Barangay Parabba, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She and her husband are blessed with three children, Rizalyn Joy, 7 years old and in grade III; Rose Caryl, 3 years old; and Rizamae, 1 year old. 

Josie is a hardworking mother who manages a junk shop. This is her way of helping her husband to provide for the financial needs of their family and save for the education of their three children.  She collects and buys scrap materials like old newspapers, used/empty bottles, boxes, plastic, etc., and generates income by selling them in junk shops. She is happy that her chosen business provides her family with a daily income at low capital investment and implements solid waste management in their town and nearby villages. 

To further sustain the business, Josie is asking for the support of Kiva lenders to keep her business growing and help her community and the environment. She hopes to borrow PHP 10,000 for additional business capital.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Саида

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Каримова 1958 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж и сын Каримовой  уехали на заработки в Россию.Она с детство помогала родителям за уходом скота. Теперь она сама занимается откормом скота. У Каримовы есть дойная корова которая приносит ей дополнительную прибыль от продажи молока и сметаны. Она планирует купить  еще корову с телёнком и благодарит кредиторов за финансовую поддержку.

loans.use: На покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Ахматкул

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Маматкулов Ахматкул- мужчина средних лет,имеет семью и четырёх детей.Занимается откормом больше 20 лет.семья живёт за счёт скота,которых они откармливают у себя дома.Также Ахматкул содержит небольшой участок земли, где выращивает сельхозкультуру- корм для своего скота,овощи и фрукты,веник,которую его жена Сурма продает на базаре.Ахматкул  работает с нашей организацией 2года  и продолжает сотрудничать по сей день.Он говорит что мы поддержали его когда ему понадобились деньги.Получив наш кредит он расширил своё стадо. И благодарен нам за это.

loans.use: закуп  скота

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita sells vegetables. She walks from one house to house carrying her basket of vegetables. Sometimes, she also cooks snacks that she sells for additional income. She is 46 years old and married to Villamor, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children, four of whom are still in school. Rebelita hopes that she can continue to send her four children to school so they can finish their studies.  
	
To reach out for her dreams, Rebelita is planning to expand her business by opening a canteen that will be situated in front of the beautiful spot of Sta. Victoria Cave, which is more than an hour's travel from their village. Through the assistance of their Local Government Unit (LGU), and with a loan from Kiva of PHP 6,000.00, she is positive that she can fulfill her plans.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Irma Ester

texts.es: Irma Ester T. D. N. vive en San Lorenzo departamento  Ahuachapán, vive con su esposo que trabaja D. motorista y con sus dos hijos Jose D. 10 años y Juan D. 6 años, ambos son estudiantes, Irma se dedica a la a la elaboración D. ropa a la medida pero también a la logrado montar un pequeño negocio para aumentar sus ingresos con una  venta D. antojitos como enchiladas y pastelitos D. papa , el destino del crédito que solicita Irma es para comprar materia prima para los antojitos y tela para la ropa que confecciona.
texts.en:
Irma Ester T. D. N. lives in San Lorenzo in the district of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband, a motorcycle operator, and her two children Jose (age 10) and Juan (age 6). Both of her sons attend school. Irma makes clothes for a living and has been able to manage another small business making snacks, such as enchiladas and potato cakes.

Irma will use her loan to purchase ingredients for her snack business and fabric for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her snack business & fabric for her clothing business

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly A. is from the village of Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 74 years old. Rolly is widowed. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the ISUZU canteen. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 18000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rolly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rolly is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rolly from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support needs of relatives and other family members. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is already 60 years old. She is a resident of Barangay Parabba of Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is married to Leopoldo, who works as a farmer and also a hog raiser. They have four children, and all of them are already married.  

Aurelia has been managing a village store for almost 20 years. She works hard and gets up early in the morning to open her store for her customers who need her service. She is still energetic and diligent in the business, though she is old. 

Aurelia still wants her income to increase by developing her business into a bigger one. She plans to expand her business by selling meat and vegetables. With this, she would like to ask the financial support of Kiva lenders to grant her loan request. She hopes that lenders will not look at her age but instead give her the opportunity to prove her worth in dealing with business.

loans.use: additional capital for her store

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo C. H. vive en el departamento de La Libertad en el occidente salvadoreño.  Sin contar con la preparación adecuada ni educación formal, Guillermo mostro siempre un interés y talento para la fotografía, talento que se convirtió en su negocio, con el que ha sacado adelante a su esposa y tres hijos, quienes ya dan señales de compartir su pasión por la fotografía.  Guillermo solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevo equipo de trabajo, pues el equipo con el que cuenta actualmente, se ha vuelto obsoleto en comparación a las nuevas tecnologías. Guillermo está seguro que al adquirir este nuevo equipo, abrirá consigo muchas puertas y oportunidades para evolucionar su pasión, y su vida.
texts.en:
Guillermo C. H. lives in the district of La Libertad in the western part of El Salvador. Without adequate preparation or education, Guillermo always showed an interest and talent for photography. His hobby turned into a business that has helped him get ahead, along with his wife and three children. His kids are already showing an interest in their father’s passion for photography.

Guillermo is requesting a loan to buy new equipment for his business, since his current equipment is obsolete when compared to the new technology. He is positive that this investment will open many doors and opportunities to help him develop, both in his passion and in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new photography equipment

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: Jose Alfredo M. C. vive en el departamento de la Libertad, en la costa de El Salvador. A sus cortos 24 años tiene ya bajo su responsabilidad a su esposa y un hijo de 3 años, a quienes mantiene con un negocio de elaboración de tejas para techos . Jose, con mucha fe y espíritu emprendedor, solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima que le permita no solo mejorar la calidad de las tejas que fabrica, sino también la calidad de vida que diariamente brinda a su esposa e hija.
texts.en:
Jose Alfredo M. C. lives in the La Libertad region on the coast of El Salvador. At his young age of just 24 years, he is already responsible for his wife and 3-year-old child. He supports them with a business making roof tiles.
Jose, with a lot of faith and enterprising spirit, is requesting a loan to buy materials that will allow him to improve not only the quality of the tiles he makes, but also the quality of life that he provides his wife and daughter every day.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita L. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Nenita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose Luis E. G. vive en el municipio de Opico en el departamento de San Salvador.  Jose vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad. Bryan, el mayor de sus hijos tiene tan solo 11 años, y Jose y Medellín quienes lo siguen, tienen 7 y 4 respectivamente.  Mantener una familia tan extensa no es fácil para el joven Jose de tan solo 27 años, quien valientemente abrió su propio negocio un par de años atrás, una panadería, la cual maneja junto a su esposa. Jose y su familia solicitan un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y productos que le permitan abastecer mejor su panadería para consolidar su negocio y estabilizar su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose Luis E. G. lives in the city of Opico in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and three young children. The oldest, Bryan, is only eleven years old and Jose and Medellín are seven and four years old respectively. It is not easy for Jose, who is just 27, to maintain such a large family. So he bravely opened his own business a couple of years ago, a bakery, which he runs together with his wife. Jose and his family are seeking a loan in order to buy new merchandise and products which will allow them to stock up his bake shop in order to strengthen his business and stabilize his household.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for inventory.

loans.name: Nguvu Mpya Group

texts.en:
Mather is a member of the Nguvu Mpya group . She is a 39 year-old-woman, is married, and is the mother of two children.Her children are aged 19 and 16 years. She also cares for other two other dependents.

Six years ago, Mather started her own cafe business selling bites (bread-like rolls). She works seven hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mather’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to save money and expand her business.

Christina and Anosia are two other members of the same group. They also requested a loan of 200,000 Tsh each one in order to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Jose Atilio

texts.es: Jose Atilio S.
texts.en: Jose Atilio Silca

loans.use: Stock his business

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es: Marian Elizabeth C. L. vive en el departamento de  Ahuachapán en el occidente del país.  Su esposo, es un policía empleado en la Policía Nacional Civil, y casi no tiene tiempo de acompañarla en la casa ni en el negocio. Marian con mucho valor montó su propia venta de pupusas hace ya seis años, negocio que ido creciendo poco a poco cada   vez más. Marian solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima para elaborar sus pupusas y ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Marian Elizabeth C. L. lives in the Department of Ahuachapán in the western part of the country. Her husband is a policeman who works for the National Civil Police. He almost never has time to help her around the house or with the business. Six years ago, Marian courageously started up her own business making and selling pupusas. The business has been growing little by little over time. Marian is seeking a loan in order to buy raw materials for preparing her pupusas so she can offer her customers an even better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Lilian Elizabeth

texts.es: Lilian Elizabeth A. V. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en la zona occidental del país. Hace ya 11 años, Lilian y su esposo manejan una panadería propia, con la cual distribuyen y surten de pan a distintas zonas de su pueblo. Sus tres hijos ayudan y colaboran en la panadería, que tras una década de existencia se ha vuelto el pilar de ingresos de la familia. Lilian solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima para su mercadería y ampliar su producción y su distribución en el pueblo, que a la vez, aumente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lilian Elizabeth A. V. lives in the Department of Ahuachapán in the western part of the country. For eleven years now, Lilian and her husband have been running their own bakery which distributes and supplies bread to various areas of their town. Their three children work and help them with the bakery, which for more than a decade has been primary source of income for the family. Lilian is seeking a loan to buy the raw materials for products and to increase their production and distribution in the town, while at the same time increasing their income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is a responsible mother and a persevering micro-entrepreneur residing in the village of Manamtam Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Ricardo and blessed with four children. Two are now in college and two are in the high school level. They want them to be successful in their studies and have a successful jobs in the future. The welfare of their children is the motivation of the couple to work hard.

Arcely is managing a village store while her husband works as a farmer. She is now asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to further improve her general store business. She hopes to borrow the amount of PHP 30,000 that she will utilize in purchasing more merchandise. Aside from her store, Arcely is also selling fruits and vegetables to meet the needs of their family and also for their hog-raising business. She is looking forward for the support of the lenders and always believes that “praying without ceasing” will be of great help.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita D. is 36 years old, married to Fernando. She manages a village store and lives in Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. They have a nine-year-old son named Richard, and he is now in the elementary level.  

Conchita is maintaining her store in order to generate a daily income for her family, especially for her child’s education. The store keeps growing and her desire to improve it motivates her to be more patient and hard-working. She also decided to request a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to be used for her store.  

Conchita is looking for the benefits of her family; that is why she is so diligent and patient. Also her husband is sacrificing a lot for them. Her child Richard gives them the inspiration to move on and keep life going.

loans.use: additional capital for her store

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es: Pedro Joaquín A. vive ene departamento de Ahuachapán.  A sus 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijas, las cuales estudian bachillerato. Pedro maneja una tapicería de muebles desde su propia casa, donde  fabrican todo tipo de muebles para casa u oficina.
