La Tapicería “San Jose” tiene 23 años de existir y se convertido en un sueño hecho realidad para Pedro y su familia, pues ha sido la base para la superación de la misma. Pedro solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y comprar nueva materia prima, para continuar elaborando muebles de alta calidad y duración.
texts.en:
Pedro Joaquin A. lives in the district of Ahuachapán. He is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters, who are both high school graduates. Pedro operates a furniture upholstery shop out of his house, where he covers all types of home and office furniture. His shop, called "San Jose", has been in business for 23 years and has been a dream come true for Pedro and his family.

He is requesting a loan to invest into his business and purchase new materials so that he can continue offering high-quality, durable furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase upholstery material

loans.name: Рачаб

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Раджаб продолжает расширять свой бизнес. В период кредитования он целенаправленно используя займ увеличил поголовье скота и повысил уровень семейного положения. На следующий займ он хочет купить ангорских коз .

loans.use: На покупку ангорской козы

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
“Hard work will make my dreams come true”--this is what Rogelia always keep in mind every day. She is busy maintaining their home and her hog-raising business. Aside from raising hogs, she also cooks homemade doughnuts and sells them in their village.  

In order to have additional capital, Rogelia decided to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000.00. She aims to generate more income from her small businesses and improve it. If given the chance, Rogelia will purchase additional piglets to raise and maintain her doughnut vending.
 
Rogelia is working hard to continuously support the education of her two children who are currently studying. She also would like to help her husband in providing the financial needs of their family, especially their daily food consumption. Her husband Valeriano is working as a farmer. They have eight children; three of them are already married, three already have stopped their studies and ended up being helpers/laborers, and two are still studying. Rogelia wishes someday that her two younger children will continue their studies and somehow gain a college degree since most of their children were not able to pursue their studies even in high school.

loans.use: additional capital for the farm and doughnut store

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
Charline B. is from the village of Danao. She is 27 years old. Charline is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Charline owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Charline has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Charline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Charline is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Charline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the fish business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hog raiser. Aside from that she also sells retail feeds in their village and has been doing so for four years. She is a member of Barangay Nutrition Scholar or BNS. 

Her first loan from Kiva lenders enables her to maintain her business, but still her income is not enough to meet all the needs of their family. For this reason, Marilyn is again requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 8,000. According to her, she must work hard for her family. She always aims to give them a complete education, which she and her husband are trying to provide for their future welfare.

Marilyn manages her business well. Her husband is a rice mill operator. Three of their children are still studying, while their eldest is already a college graduate. Marilyn hopes and prays that God will give them more strength as they are now growing older. She is looking forward to the day that all her children live with good future because it is what they have dreamed of and is trying to give them since they were born.

loans.use: additional capital for the farm

loans.name: Jodi Fe

texts.en:
Jodi Fe C. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 23 years old. Jodi Fe is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Jodi Fe owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jodi Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jodi Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jodi Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jodi Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jodi Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Bedcia

texts.en:
Bedcia is a responsible housewife of Ernesto. They are living in Brgy, Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She aims to become successful in her business so that she can support the studies of their three children who are presently in their secondary and elementary level. They want them to finish their studies in college so that they will find stable jobs in the future.

Despite the economic crisis that they are experiencing, the couple still has their strong faith and determination in maintaining their business towards success. Bedcia used to roam everyday from one house to another to sell their vegetables. She is patiently doing the business for the welfare of her family. She is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP10, 000 as additional capital. She hopes that someday through the lenders' help, and hard work and patience in the business, her family will someday able to overcome the hardships of life.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Teab

texts.en:
Teab S., age 46, is married and has 6 children. Two of her children have been enrolled in a local secondary school, and the rest are employed. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She operates a grocery store, typically earning US $5 per day. Her husband makes a living by digging soil to refill his customers’ land with an income of US $8 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase soil and transport it to refill her husband's customers' land.

loans.use: purchasing soil

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa B. is from the village of Danao. She is 60 years old. Felipa is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Felipa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Felipa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Leas

texts.en:
Leas S., age 61, is married and has a child. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband have been involved in the agriculture sector as farmers, typically earning approximately US $7.75 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her standard of living. She is asking for a loan to purchase a used motorbike for her child to resell with profitable price.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Кузибоев Умед проживает в районе Абдурахмон Чоми. Возраст 27 лет. Не женат, детей не имеет. Умед по специальности "строитель". Он более 2 лет занимается торговлей строительных материалов. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота, т.к. в данный момент в его районе начался большой объем строительства.
texts.en:
Umed K. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 27 years old, single and has no children. Umed is a construction work by profession. He has been involved in selling building materials for over 2 years. He is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover because his district is currently experiencing a construction boom.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam N., age 38, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband have been involved in the agriculture sector as farmers, typically earning approximately US $7.50 per day. Besides their farming on the rice fields, they raise beans to meet the market need to generate more income.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, N. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan to hire other persons to plough and clear her farmlands so that she is able to farm more variety of crops. By doing so, N. and her husband will be able to produce maximum outputs.

loans.use: hire other people to plough the farmland

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia S. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 57 years old. Rosalia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Rosalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Rosalia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn P. is 28-year-old and a resident of Pursat Province. She lives in her own old wooden house with other family members and makes a living as a farmer. Her husband works as a requirement worker for income and also assists her on the farm. This couple is blessed with two kids who are not yet attending school and under their care. In the past, the family has been paying much money in hiring the neighbor’s oxen to alleviate plowing their farmland because they don’t own a cow to for using purposes. Phorn P. is taking out her loan to buy a cow so that it will allow her to cut the hiring fee.

loans.use: To buy a cow so that it will allow her to plow the fields

loans.name: Suth

texts.en:
Suth S., age 38, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She is grocery seller, typically earning approximately US $5 per day. To make a living, her husband usually buys rice directly from farmers in his village and resells it with a fair profitable price, earning US $3.75 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, Nang is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more rice from the local farmers to resell. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing rice to resell

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally L. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayn de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Sally is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sally is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Chheoun C., age 27, is married and has a young child. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale, typically earning approximately US $2 per day. Her husband has been involved in construction business, earning US $7 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work easily and to transport her pigs to sell at the nearby local markets. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita C. is from the village of Katipa. She is 53 years old. Rita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Rita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Rita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Teap

texts.en:
Teap R., age 71, is a widow. She lives with her two children in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she has been selling food, mostly roasted chickens and beef, typically earning approximately US $20 per day. The family is also assisted by her two children who are now currently employed with a reasonable income to make a good living.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, R. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, R. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase construction materials in order to build and repair her house. She believes that she will be able to R. her current business at home when her home is convenient enough with the new construction plan she is going to invest in.

loans.use: To purchase wood and construction materials

loans.name: Mahmadnazar

texts.ru: Махмадназар Холиков проживает в районе Абдурахмон Чоми. Возраст 55 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Махмадназар имеет кафе на рынке, где занимается приготовлением национальных блюд. Кредит просит для закупа сырья, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Mahmadnazar H. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 55 years old, married and has 6 children. Mahmadnazar has a cafe at a market, where he prepares traditional dishes. He is requesting a loan to purchase raw material in order to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material to increase turnover

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla S. is from the village of Katipa. She is 50 years old. Rosavilla is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosavilla owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosavilla has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Rosavilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosavilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosavilla is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Rosavilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Maua R., age 32, is married with three children, 13, 10 and 8 years.   She stays with her mother. She has a beauty salon. She started this business in 2006.  She works daily from 8am until 7pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $226.

This will be Maua’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy a dryer and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to start selling rice, which she intends to collect from upcountry.
 	
Maua will share this loan with her loan group,  Karibu View, which totals 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Maua is second from the right in the front row.

loans.use: To start a new business selling rice.

loans.name: Sy

texts.en:
Sy Y., age 50, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she has been involved in a business producing Cambodian traditional cakes, typically earning approximately US$3 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction builder with an income of US$5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Y. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, Y. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to work easily and to expand her current business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to provide a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Амирова Сафаргул проживает в районе Абдурахмон Чоми. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Сафаргул более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует национальными тканями. Муж работает таксистом. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Safargul A. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. She is 55 years old, married and has 3 children. Safargul has been involved in sales at a market for over 5 years. She primarily sells traditional fabrics. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Safargul is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is part of 47-year-old Hem K.’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Teang Buntoeun, assists her with the farm work and he appears in the photograph above.

On the other hand, the family also raises a few pigs at home to generate extra profit. Two of their children are working in different jobs, while the other five are still unemployed and help on the farm.

Hem K. will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and seed to facilitate rice-growing. With the remainder of loan she will buy a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for rice cultivation

loans.name: Chhut

texts.en:
Chhut L., age 42, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she is involved in a business selling palm sugar, typically earning approximately US$7 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband (pictured) who is raising pigs and buying cows to resell with an income of US$6 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, L. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase pigs and cows to resell. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to provide a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and pigs for her husband to raise

loans.name: Peter Kimemia

texts.en: Peter J. is 33-years-old and married to Lucy Waringa. They have two children. Peter has been in the motorcycle transportation business for five years. He heard about KADET through the company’s marketing promotions and he decided to join. He was advanced his first loan which he used to buy his own motorbike and he paid back the loan on time. He also has another business selling clothes and shoes which he runs with his wife. With the advancement of this second loan he plans to expand it by adding more stock. In the near future, Peter is planning to buy his own taxi to boost his income. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To restock his shoes and clothes business

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Chhom C., age 34, is married and has four school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province.

To make a living, C. is involved in a business selling Cambodian dessert, typically earning US$6 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker with an income of US$4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike to easily commute to sell her dessert. By doing so, she will be able to cut back on the great expense of transportation and save more income to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for delivering her dessert

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea P., age 36, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she goes to work in town as a construction builder, typically earning US$3.75 per day. The family is also assisted primarily by her husband who is a speaker repairman and a construction builder with an income of US$5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase speakers and a trailer. By doing so, she will use the trailer to transport speakers to rent to the people who want to use them in any ceremony.

loans.use: To purchase speakers and a trailer

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth E. is a 31-year-old mother of Loue Mar, 2 years old, and 1-year-old Ma. Lorraine. She is a wife to Loue and an entrepreneur to many of her customers. Maribeth enjoys every single day of her life playing different roles being a woman. At the age of 27, she became a member of ASHI. She made a loan, and she found herself running a business she enjoyed the most, buying and selling fish. Five years ago, Maribeth was still in the process of discovering the secret towards business success. As she goes along with her discovery, loans she made in ASHI have helped her. Eventually she found what she was looking for - happiness being the owner and manager of her own business. She has grown and produced another kind of business out of her profit- a variety store. 

From a PHP5,000 loan she made when she first joined ASHI, now she makes a PHP24,000 loan to be used to finance her fish business and her variety store. She plans to add shrimp, prawn, and crab to the items she sells. 

Someday, Maribeth wants all of her children to finish college and have their own career. She would be very happy to see them enjoying a life that is not under the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To buy a variety of seafood to sell and to finance her variety store.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel G. B. de 35 años de edad  vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposa  quien trabaja como comerciante y sus dos hijos gemelos de 13 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando, Miguel es un padre muy responsable apoya a su esposa en los gastos familiares con las ganancias que obtiene de su humilde negocio una venta de sandalias plásticas en el mercado municipal de Ahuachapán, el destino del  crédito que solicita Miguel es para surtir su negocio que le ayude obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel Gomez Buendia, 35, lives in the "departamento" of Ahuachapan with his wife, who buys and sells goods, and their twin boys, 13, who are still in school. Miguel is a responsible father who helps his wife with household expenses from the money that he earns operating a small business selling plastic sandals in the Ahuachapan municipal market. Miguel will use the loan to stock his business which, ultimately, will help him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell
